name: La petite bouquinerie
description: La Petite Bouquinerie offers a wide variety of used books at low prices. They also take phone orders for customers who are not comfortable using a computer. There is something for every taste!
full_address: 950 Rte Elgin S, Saint-Pamphile, QC G0R 3X0
working_hours: {Monday: Open 24 hours, Tuesday: Open 24 hours, Wednesday: Open 24 hours, Thursday: Open 24 hours, Friday: Open 24 hours, Saturday: Open 24 hours, Sunday: Open 24 hours}
review_1_text: Excellent online second-hand bookstore. The prices are very low (paperbacks for $4 and vintage children's books for $1.25!). Excellent service, order placed on Friday and received the following Monday! Everything was very well packaged. I highly recommend.
review_2_text:
The books are in very good condition, the processing time was very short, everything was packaged with great care.
Very happy to have discovered this bookstore
review_3_text: I ordered a book from this bookstore via the monpanier.ca website and I am very satisfied.  Fast delivery and book in excellent condition!

name: Friends of the Ottawa Public Library
description: The Friends of the Ottawa Public Library Association (FOPLA) supports the Ottawa Public Library through fundraising and volunteer efforts. They host monthly Mammoth Book Sales with gently used books, CDs, and DVDs. FOPLA also provides funding for library programming and initiatives like the Awesome Authors youth writing contest and the TD Summer Reading Series.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-2p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-2p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-2p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-2p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-2p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-2p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
I had misread the hours of operation. As a result, I arrived just as the last volunteer was leaving. In addition, he explained that one is supposed to make a reservation before coming

Despite my failures re not arriving during their operating hours and not having made an appointment, the gentleman very kindly went back inside and checked to see if they had the specific book I was looking for. However, he was very kind and understanding to check
review_2_text: I recently bought books from KindReads that were on my TBR list. It was really easy experience from looking up books but title or Author. They had a wide range of books to choose from. And the quality of books is amazing, they were well-preserved, with minimal signs of use! anyone looking to expand their book collection, I highly recommend KindReads! You won't be disappointed!
review_3_text: I've made a number of purchases over the last few months from KindReads.  I like both getting a great deal while at the same time supporting a great cause (the Public Library System).  My books have been in great condition, the pictures and descriptions are fully accurate, and the checkout system is quick and easy to use.
review_4_text: Vast selection of books and you know you are supporting a great cause (Ottawa Public Library). Coordinating pickup was easy! Would highly recommend to anyone looking to find some great reads at a good price! Also loved their kids bundles around Christmas as a stocking stuffer.
review_5_text: Books were in great condition and at an awesome price. Downside would be I hadn't seen it mentioned anywhere until I placed the order that pick-up (at the Nepean location anyhow), is only from 10-2 Mon-Sat, so I had to take time off work. Also there was a random unmarked bag of -what turned out to be- tea in the bag that  I had to email to clarify what it was.

name: Librairie Vincent Legendre
full_address: 3000 Chem. Royal local 101, Qu√©bec, QC G1E 1T7
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-4:30p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m.}
review_1_text: Great selection of books, excellent service, excellent price. I was looking for old Star Wars books and there are plenty!
review_2_text: Really friendly owner who knows his stuff! Very affordable prices
review_3_text: Very passionate owner who does not hesitate to help you in your research and who engages in conversation! Also, an excellent collection of used books, CDs and DVDs of all genres
review_4_text:
Lots of choice, and for all tastes.
Beautiful, good, inexpensive
review_5_text: Very nice used bookstore, with a huge selection. The owner knows his stock well, it's well classified and almost impossible not to make discoveries!

name: Country Life Books
description: Country Life Books, formerly Beacon Books, is a secondhand bookstore in Creston, BC offering a wide selection of used books. The online store features first-editions, rare and antiquarian books, and a large collection of nautical and military history.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
So... this place is magical.

Such a wealth of knowledge and inspiration contained in one place that I could tangibly feel the energy of it when I walked in. It felt sacred.

Feels like a haven. Extremely grounding, peaceful, healing vibes.

Their selection of books is unmatched, so please stop by and support this new local business.
review_2_text: This is an absolutely amazing bookstore. They had so many phenomenal options to choose from and the proprietors were so helpful and nice. I wish I was local and I would be stopping by constantly. Prices were great too. 100% recommend.

name: Bellwoods Books
description: Bellwoods Books is a Toronto bookshop curating a dreamy collection of vintage, secondhand, and rare books, specializing in women writers.
full_address: 784 College St Lower Level, Toronto, ON M6G 1C6
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: Closed, Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: A must-visit for rare and interesting vintage books! A very well curated selection and the owner is incredibly courteous and kind.
review_2_text: Some of the best vintage book curation in the city.
review_3_text: fabulous :)) !

name: JMC books
description: JMC BOOKS offers a great selection of science fiction and fantasy books, as well as modern first editions. They aim to provide a pleasant and efficient shopping experience and offer assistance with finding specific titles. They have a large stock not fully listed online.
review_1_text: Very friendly and helpful! I was looking for a book for my son that is no longer in print. He is a Stephen King lover, and they had it! And at a reasonable price too. Will definitely try here again.
review_2_text: Thousands of selections. Some rare stuff too. Great guy to deal with.

name: Faustroll et fils, disques fins et livres choisis
description: Faustroll et fils is a bookseller specializing in a variety of categories including Art, Beaux livres, G√©ographie, Histoire, Litt√©rature, and Livres Anciens. They also offer books in Americana, Architecture, Archeologie, Bande dessin√©e, Botanique, Canadiana, and many more.

working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 9a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
Best bookseller and bookstore in town.
It has everything! You will find, among other things, classics in pocket format, beautiful art books, essays, old books, rare books and even some curiosities! In short, a very nice selection of books, both old and modern.
The bookseller is exquisite and passionate. In addition to enjoying the beautiful selection of books and the person in charge, you will be won over by the atmosphere. Indeed, the arrangement of the shelves, the paintings and the decoration make a visit to the book kiosk a real journey into the world of ideas.
Definitely my favorite bookstore.
review_2_text: Best bookstore in town to find rare gems at a good price!
review_3_text: A great place, where you will find lots of passionate people. Just great discoveries, memories. It's simply magical

name: SG Livres Usag√©s
description: SG Livres Usag√©s is an online bookstore offering used books delivered to your door. They strive to give books a new life and share a love of reading.  You can also request they search for specific books you need.
review_1_text: The classification is very easy for everyone

description: Librairie Le Chat Lit offers a wide selection of books, including new releases, reference books, and titles by both local and international authors. They also have a selection of comics and discounted items.

review_2_text: A beautiful little bookstore with a very friendly person! Prices are reasonable. I recommend!
review_3_text:
Need a collection of Sarah Rivens
THANKS
review_4_text: Excellent price on books and friendly welcome
review_5_text: Nice little store and good price

name: Well Read Books
description: Well Read Books is a social enterprise bookstore that funds community programs. Books are donated by the community and the store is mainly volunteer run. They also consign with local authors.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: The selection is incredible, I was almost overwhelmed by how many books there were to look through, but it's still very well organized. The prices are reasonable and they have a loyalty stamp card you can get if you end up shopping there frequently
review_2_text: Great selection of used books, fiction, non-fiction and some rare and vintage stuff. Also great selection of oversized reference and art books. Prices are very reasonable, friendly staff, too!
review_3_text: A beautiful bookshop with so much selection and very reasonably priced! Happy to have stumbled on this spot while we were in Nanaimo
review_4_text: Such an amazing selection! The staff is very friendly and helpful when looking for specific titles. The store feel like it goes on forever, but very well laid out and easy to navigate.
review_5_text: Outstanding used book store. Great selection across many categories. I found an interesting memoir about a girl growing up in the family mortuary.  Highly recommended.

description: The Nikkei Japanese Bookstore offers a curated selection of Japanese books, magazines, and other materials. We are dedicated to promoting Japanese culture and language.

name: Second Chance Reads
description: We are a indie bookstore in Downtown Grande Prairie, AB! We sell new & used books as well as all the awesome bookish merch!! We have book boxes, book clubs, everything your bookish heart desires!
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Beautiful romantasy/dark romance vault. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Books in excellent condition.
review_2_text:
There Adult book fair are amazing!

I also got a missprint of Onyx Storm. Messaged them after hours, just to see if anyone else had one. They immediately Messaged me back. And made a special delivery when they were closed to bring me a new copy so I can finish the book!
review_3_text: I visited this hidden gem of a bookstore on a whim. I knew I wanted a light read, perhaps a romance. The owner helped to pick the perfect book for me! The parallels between my life and this book were undeniable. I‚Äôm glad I bought the sequel too. Best $20 spent. My experience was so wonderful, I will definitely be back. Thank you!
review_4_text: What a hidden gem this wonderful bookstore is! A welcoming ambience with beautiful displays of books and super cute knick knacks everywhere made me want to curl up and read. The coffee station and comfortable seating helped keep my husband entertained while I chatted with the friendly store owner.
review_5_text: My friends and I went book shopping with starting a book together in mind, me never picking up a book since middle school was worried about not finding anything interesting. I was proven so wrong when one of the staff members asked us if we needed some help, and she found the perfect book for all three of us. Haven‚Äôt been able to put the book down since!

name: Reeve & Clarke Books ( ABAC / ILAB )
description: Reeve & Clarke Books is an online antiquarian book business formerly operating from a historic store in Georgetown, Ontario (formerly Glen Williams, about an hour north of Toronto). They have been buying and selling antiquarian books since the early 1980s.
review_1_text: Great transaction experience long distance by email!  Purchase was shipped promptly and very well packaged/protected. I recommend them.

name: Minotavros Books
description: Minotavros Books offers a diverse selection of fine and rare books on subjects including folk and fairy tales, proverbs, alchemy, and mythology, as well as art, poetry, cooking, fine binding, first editions, and ephemera. They help customers find the right book for their collection.
full_address: 10 Sunray St Unit 4, Whitby, ON L1N 9B5
review_1_text: The online selection was incredible, but I can't wait to visit in person! My books were shipped quickly and packaged with such care!  Very reasonable prices for some vintage and modern reads! The condition of this First Print Ray Charles autobiography was even better than expected and I'm over the moon! Thank you, Stefano!
review_2_text: Best Book store in Durham region. Very nice owners who know a lot of great reccomendations and will do searches for you, and seem passionate about their sales. Very nice people, perhaps my favourite spot to shop in general. Go here If you want personal help throughout your whole exploration of this wide collection
review_3_text: Very nice to deal with and was able to get a great gift for my wife - staff was very friendly, informative and ensured my package arrived ontime with great care taken.  Would highly suggest!!
review_4_text: This place has wonderful collections! Incredibly organized and wide variety. Would highly recommend checking out
review_5_text: No hours posted on door

name: librairie vilsy
review_1_text: thank you for the beautiful books that I found at your place.
review_2_text: Thank you, good books and great service

name: Contact Editions Inc
description: Contact Editions is a well-established bookstore operating since 1990, currently located at 491 Davenport Road in Toronto. They offer a diverse inventory including literature, history, poetry, and rare books, with hundreds of titles not listed online. They also buy books, focusing on first editions and rare volumes.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I‚Äôm surprised there hasn‚Äôt been a review since 2 years ago! I curiously found this place on Google while looking for interesting bookstores to take my partner to and we were both pleasantly surprised by their selection. We had a nice chat with the owner and got to see (and touch!!) the 7/100 signed copy, 1936 printing of Ulysses by James Joyce. For anyone who loves antique and rare books, this is THE spot. We were honestly blown away by this hidden gem of a bookstore and will definitely be coming back!
review_2_text: My mother and I had a wonderful time looking around pre-covid, admiring the collection, and having long chats with the staff on a beautiful afternoon.  They were helpful and just really friendly and accommodating to us. 5/5 and thank you for existing!
review_3_text: Wes and gang are great to deal with. Kid, friendly and always resourceful. The store is clean and well organized. The books are great and you can always find a gem here!
review_4_text: I have never been disappointed with Contact Editions. Wes, and staff, are friendly, helpful and knowledgable.  In my opinion it is one of the best antiquarian bookstores in Canada.
review_5_text: Had some estate books.  They evaluated them and were extremely nice, polite, courteous, and helpful.  Would definitely recommend.  Bonus:  they have a couple of parking spots right out front!

name: Bjarne Tokerud Bookseller Inc.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Bjarne Tokerud is a knowledgeable, wonderful, professional antiquarian bookseller. I had some antique maps to sell and the whole process was easy and smooth sailing. I highly recommend him and definitely hope to deal with him again in the future.
review_2_text: I have been a client of Bjarne Tokerud Bookseller for a few years and have always enjoyed coming in and discussing options with him and Hanna in downtown Vancouver. Recently purchased a few books from him and look forward to coming back. J. Gibson
review_3_text: I had the pleasure of working with Bjarne on a genealogical project. It was fascinating and Bjarne‚Äôs services were professional and timely.
review_4_text: I have known Bjarne Tokerud for over twenty years.  I have bought, sold and traded historic photographs of British Columbia with him for the last several years.  I have always been treated fairly by him.  He knows a great deal  about the business he is in. Every time I deal with him he teaches me something.  I appreciate that.
review_5_text: A gem of an old world antiquarian bookstore in the centre of Vancouver for the discerning collector of rare books, photographs and ephemera.  While it is by appointment only if you are serious about books it is worth making a call

review_1_text: An absolutely lovely shop. The owner is amazing. I would recommend this book store to any book lover. The books are in like new condition and there are certainly many gems to be found. Prices are excellent. I certainly will be returning.
review_2_text: Super kind owner, lots of treasures both English and French. Good prices. Will definitely come again if in area. Thanks
review_3_text:
I'm a book collector and book enthusiast who loves visiting book stores and I always love going to this one. The owner is very passionate about books, he's extremely welcoming and kind. I also love the music at the store. Having visited every bookstore in the area this one is my favorite.

One of those shops that you visit often to find great gems at a great price.
review_4_text: This is the cutest place I have ever been. Very good books in very good condition at an amazing price. Could not recommend it enough. It has a great and clean ambiance and they play this very delightful music genre.
review_5_text: Nice selection of french and english books. Friendly service and great prices too!

I don't think you can give a much higher recommendation than that.

working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:30a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10:30a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10:30a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: A pure joy to come to this bookstore. A very warm welcome from an enthusiast. Wonderful meeting with regulars too. We loved it and will happily return.
review_2_text:
Small bookstore with a wide selection. The prices are really affordable and the book selection is very good. The bookseller is great! He's funny and offers personalized service!
Best bookstore in the area
review_3_text: Small used bookstore with exceptional personalized service and unbeatable prices. An essential service!
review_4_text: The best place to buy used books, especially those available in new book libraries. Come here first! Eric was so helpful in finding the titles and authors I wanted - lots of recent titles as well as the classics! Thanks, Eric!
review_5_text: Eric is passionate about books and he offers truly top-notch personalized service. All the books he sells, even though they are used, they seem new. I highly recommend Bouquinerie 4 Saisons.

name: CAVITY Curiosity Shop
description: A unique bookstore offering secondhand books, vinyl records, cassettes, VHS tapes, and local art, with a focus on horror, occult, and counter-culture items.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12-6p.m., Friday: 12-6p.m., Saturday: 12-6p.m., Sunday: 12-6p.m.}
review_1_text: I don't think there's anything I can write to convey what a treasure this place is. The owner is important to the local music scene and the collection of art and media is a sight to behold. Plenty to find here no matter who you are or what you like. It's like a dragon horde of art and stories.
review_2_text:
An eclectic shop with a good selection of classic, sci-fi, horror and fantasy paperbacks.
I enjoy the mojo of the place and my granddaughter is always wanting me to buy her one of the cool, strange toys from days gone by.
review_3_text: Weird little place, cool staff, lots to look at. I haven‚Äôt unfortunately found anything to buy for myself yet but, but appreciate the uniqueness. Taxidermied oddities abound.
review_4_text: 10 stars if I could.  Both the owner and the shop itself are the heartbeat of its community. And it's truly magical.
review_5_text: Super rad little shop. Worth the walk for the vibes alone. Go check it out!

name: Bookends
description: Bookends Books is a bookstore located in Fredericton, New Brunswick offering a wide selection of books. They accept various payment methods including Apple Pay, Google Pay, Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, JCB, and Interac.
full_address: 215 Main St E, Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Nice local business for the booklovers out there.
review_2_text: I really liked Bookends.  The books are well organized, and categorized.  We used to go to owls nest when it was still open, so I was very happy to find out that we still have a quality used bookstore in Fredericton.   The location is really easy to get to, and parking is simple, as opposed to trying to find a place downtown.   With used books, one can never have a place that is big enough, but I feel the selection is good for the size.  Inventory is, in part anyway, supplied by those who bring in books to sell or get store credit, and the prices on the books for sale are more than reasonable.  You should at least check it out, you won't be disappointed!
review_3_text:
The woman behind the cash was so helpful, and the look of the place with books in every corner, piled high in walkways, and flowing over the shelves, was a book Lovers dream. The prices were amazing, I was able to find all the classic for my Literature course, and the ones I couldn't find she took my name and number for if she finds them. So nice!
If you got a free hour or two totally recommend  Gusbooks
review_4_text:
Visited for the first time last week, and it very quickly became my favourite place to purchase used books. It is very organized, and it was easy to find specific authors/books. Owner was very welcoming and so helpful!
I can guarantee my personal library will be growing at an alarming rate from frequent visits to this great store.
review_5_text: Let's first start off by saying that I'm serious book collector who buy books all over north America and across the pond as well, and I've dealt with many shops. Anyhow I called the shop and ordered a book, the owner I talked to was very kind and friendly, then the package came in wonderfully wrapped, however, there was a slight mix up. I called back and he went well above and beyond my expectations to correct the mixup. Suffice to say I'm very impressed with the whole experience in general. Gus books gets 5 Gold stars from me and a new regular customer :)

name: Juniper Books
description: Juniper Books of Windsor offers a great selection of used books at reasonable prices. They serve the local community with over 45,000 books in stock and have various themed rooms, like a mystery/true crime room and a children's room.
working_hours: {Monday: 12-5p.m., Tuesday: 10:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 10:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 10:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 10:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 10:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: This book store is like a teensy slice of heaven for readers of the unusual ü•∞ lots of old and unique finds plus the books that are new releases are also not your "every day reads". You can find everything from poetry from Italy in the 1800s to rare graphic novels here. All of the staff are the perfect combination of professional and friendly as well. They also allow friendly pets which is absolutely lovely. We just found Juniper Books about a month ago, and now we make it one of our most important stops every weekend. üíñüìöüìñ
review_2_text: This store was very lovely and it was a pleasure to make Alfred's acquaintance. A nearly perfect experience but minus one star because I did fall down the stairs.
review_3_text: I really love how the books are organized in this house setting. They have 3 levels of books and a garage full of books. Definitely, give it a shot and if you buy books from here you will get 10-15% when you have food from Roast and Toast family diner which is across the street to this book store. Enjoy!
review_4_text:
Juniper's Books is one of my favourite bookstores of all time. The store is literally an entire house (garage, attic, and basement included) filled with books from top to bottom! Each room is dedicated to a specific theme (spooky/horror is up in the attic, cuisine and cook books are in the kitchen, etc.) so finding what you are looking for is simple and quick if you need it to be.

Personally, however, my favourite way to spend time at Juniper's after being welcomed by friendly staff (including cat!), is by wandering aimlessly through the aisles of treasures. You can easily and gladly lose track of time at Juniper's Books and our city is blessed to have them!
review_5_text: This bookstore is worth going out of your way to visit! The layout is unique and they have sections for every genre you could think of. I will be making juniper books a regular stop!

name: The Printed Word
full_address: 16 McMurray St Unit 3, Dundas, ON L9H 2W5
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
One of my favourite places. Owner James is extremely knowledgeable on all matters literary and poetic! If he does not have a book in stock he is always happy to order it for you.
Make a visit, enjoy the space and buy a book or two.
review_2_text:
I've literally never left a google review, but during the long work weeks in the winter, sometimes I give myself something to look forward to by making plans to go the The Printed Word. I've picked up so many bangers here, and though the new shop is a bit smaller, it means that things turn over faster and there is always amazing things to discover. James is super nice, knowledgable and friendly.

People in these reviews say things like "Printed Word is the best book store in the Hamilton area" but honestly it might be the best book store in Canada, period.

Love the Printed Word.
review_3_text: The best bookstore in the whole area. Highly recommended. Owner very knowledgeable. A pleasure talking to him.
review_4_text: James takes out the time for questions both offline and online, researches about specific book availabilities, orders them for you if need be, and has a very honest business ethic. The bookstore has a good social media presence too. I find the most unique books here, esp kid lit.
review_5_text: Lots of great books. James is very knowledgeable.

name: The Scribe Bookstore
description: The Scribebookstore offers a curated selection of rare, vintage, and used books. Specializing in first editions, victorian bindings, vintage paperbacks, illustrated books, beautiful jacket art, signed books, Folio Society editions, leather bindings, children‚Äôs books and illuminated manuscripts.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text: Amazing bookstore with unique finds and old classics. Everything is in great condition and all the staff members are lovely. Come here for old books you can't find anywhere else! There are always new additions, as well as a rare collection that cycles its items as well. I always stop by this beautiful spot when I'm in the Danforth area to see what I might find :)
review_2_text: Such a beautiful bookstore with the friendliest and coziest atmosphere! I felt so content browsing all the shelves of beautiful books, which are at decent prices for the quality they are in. I will absolutely be coming back!
review_3_text:
I went in the store not knowing what to expect. I was shocked at how beautiful and organized the store was. I got two books today- The republic of Plato (1866) and Sketches by Boz by Charles Dickens (1850). Absolutely love the store and their collection! Friendly staff and reasonable prices!! The books were in great condition. Plus, I like the fact that they put plastic wraps on books. Will definitely visit again üòÅ‚ù§Ô∏è
Bonus - their location is really convenient. Right outside the Chester subway!
review_4_text: their collections are so so so good! a gem! the owner is so sweet as well. every visit is hard for my wallet hahah üòÖüòç
review_5_text: This rare book store is such a treat. There was wonderful music playing as we walked in and the space was so inviting. They didn‚Äôt have any Agatha Christie novels in my price range as they sell so quickly however the owner Justin graciously let me hold and see the very rare few he had. There is a sweet intimate hidden room in the back as well to go and write a note with old style ink and put your note on the wall. Lovely place to visit and walk through.

name: The Odd Book
description: The Odd Book offers a curated selection of uncommon and rare volumes. They also buy books and offer an off-line search service for items not currently catalogued online.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text: If you love authentic classics, old historical pieces, tons of rich informative guides, and anything odd and obscure you've never heard of, then I'm confident you'd love this place. I'll admit there's not a whole lot that was here for me, but that's a me problem. It's a super unique, charming used book store that's worth checking out.
review_2_text: Just when you think nothing will surprise you anymore, enter The Odd Book. So many amazing treasures, my eyes didn‚Äôt know where to look first. The best part was finding a book gifted to my mom upon her retirement in 1996. She passed 20 years ago, this May. The store owner refused payment and just handed it to me saying ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs your book.‚Äù Thank you, sir! I can‚Äôt wait to see what I find on my next visit.
review_3_text: It's nearly impossible to walk out of here without a book. The owner is lovely, and the shop nicely portioned into sections, making your treasure hunt all the lovelier. I could spend all day in here perusing the old books.
review_4_text: I love this bookstore. I always find something interesting there. Can not wait to go back.
review_5_text: Great place to discover that hidden gem for anyone interested in vintage books on just about any subject! Found the perfect gift for a special someone!

name: Red Cart Books
description: Red Cart Books is a used bookstore serving Cornwall, Ontario, and the surrounding area. They offer books in every genre and subject, as well as hard-to-find and collectible books. They have over 260,000 titles and accept book donations.
full_address: 812 Pitt St Unit 52, Cornwall, ON K6J 5R6
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Love this bookstore so much, and now they offer rewards cards where if you buy 10$ worth of books 10 times, you get 10$ off.
I also love the selection of books. It's quite varied. Some of the books are on the pricier side, but still a huge discount from new. And they're all in very good condition. Be sure to check their website if you want something in particular, though,  because a lot of their stuff is in a warehouse nearby.
review_2_text: Such a lovely shop, the owner was very kind and knew exactly where things were down to specific books which was very helpful. It was a lovely visit and I will be returning.
review_3_text: Lovely little book store. My partner and I visit periodically. It's a bit cramped in there, but we love scouring the shelves for treasures.
review_4_text: what a great place with tons of good finds! workers are always incredibly nice and greet me with a smile. definitely check this place out for some cheap must read books.
review_5_text:
Very happy I found this little gem! All the used books are in excellent condition and always interesting finds! The lady that runs the place is very sweet and helpful.

Definitely worth stopping by.

name: Peryton Books
description: Peryton Books offers quality used books on all subjects. Serving Saskatoon and area since 2019, they provide quick, eco-friendly bicycle delivery through ZenZED (within Saskatoon's Circle Drive perimeter).
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:30a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10:30a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10:30a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10:30a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10:30a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: I emailed Peryton Books asking if they had an online inventory (they did not) and offered shipping (they do) and so to accomodate me, Aimee then spent the next long while patiently taking pictures of the spines of books of several different areas of interest and then provided a price list for every title I saw of interest (and I threw a lot of these at her!). Not only was the service extremely accomdating, friendly, and beyond helpful, but books were all in like new, beautiful condition and arrived safe and in  very timely fashion! Many thanks to Aimee and Peryton Books for all the time and effort and I look fowrard to doing it again!!
review_2_text:
Peryton Bookstore is such a gem!
Out of the 6 books on my wish list, they had 4, which absolutely made my day. The girl working there was very kind and helpful, she even set aside her lunch to help me find all the books on my list and‚Äôs handed them to me. Thank you!
The books were in great condition, and the prices were fair. left feeling happy and will definitely be back! Thank you for being awesome!
review_3_text:
Lovely book store with a wide variety of great condition used books. Will be going back there any chance I get
The books are in amazing condition and the price is phenomenal.
I love just going in and browsing the shelves for new hidden gems
review_4_text: If you‚Äôre looking for a used bookstore in Saskatoon, Peryton Books is the place! It is so peaceful in there with hundreds of books to choose from. Books are very well organized, and a fraction of the price! They also offer trade ins that can earn you credit to spend on more books there. Thanks Peryton!
review_5_text: Great selection! Very nice staff.

name: Les Mots Passants Inc.
description: A bookstore serving students in Chicoutimi, offering used university textbooks for rent, sale, and trade. They also have a seasonal used clothing section.
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Super service
review_2_text: Great experience (once again!!) with Val√©rie for this new session. Always a pleasure to pick up my textbooks from Mots Passants. Val√©rie sells, rents and takes back books at advantageous prices. Let's avoid overconsumption, let's think about the planet :-)
review_3_text:
A top team, welcoming and smiling who are dedicated to helping others. I recommend all foreign students (and those from Saguenay) to come to them to borrow their school books. And don‚Äôt hesitate to talk about it to those around you! It‚Äôs a fashionable model that must continue!

Never change, your good humor is contagious, you bring a smile to people's faces. Thank you!

üá´üá∑üá®üá¶
review_4_text:
Thanks to Val√©rie and In√®s with whom I had the pleasure of talking during my clothing drop-off.
Lots of great projects are coming: I wish you much success and thank you again for your commitment to the students!
review_5_text: Val√©rie suggests that students take back their books once the year is over and then resell them to those who are starting it. The service offered defies all competition since the books are sold at a very advantageous price. She then transfers half of the amount of the sale to the student. This was very useful to me at the end of my year. Val√©rie is smiling, passionate, accommodating and always very available. Thanks again!

name: Kingfisher Quality Used Books
description: Kingfisher Used Books is a cozy bookstore in Creston, B.C. with over 25,000 titles and a selection of specialty drinks using locally roasted coffee. They aim to be a community hub, hosting local events and artwork displays. A welcoming spot to browse, relax, and enjoy the pleasures of reading.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I've never loved a book store more! The atmosphere, selection, customer service, and coffee are all amazing. Truly lovely people trying to fill people's hearts with the art of reading.
review_2_text: Amazing collection of used books and very friendly owners! A lot of thought into all the unique bookends and aesthetic items throughout the place. Cozy and quiet place to grab coffee too.
review_3_text: Cute and quaint  book store excellent biscotti and hot drink selection  grab a couch and pick up a well loved used book to take come
review_4_text: I asked the owner how he keeps track of all the books and his answer was  "I don't". But, oddly enough one seems to gravitate to the exact area they are seeking. The natural order in what seems disordered is perfect. Amazing treasures abound in old book stores like this I know this because wherever I travel I always seem naturally pulled to the street that a Used Book store and cafe are situated on. If you go to a store like this to actually find "a" specific book you may be disappointed. But, if you go with curiosity and an open mind you will find your next "Good Read" as Ralph Fiennes said in the English Patient.
review_5_text: Lovely bookstore with comfy couches and delightfully delicious London Fog.

name: Hollywood Canteen
description: A store in Toronto catering to film enthusiasts with the world's largest selection of film books, scripts and movie posters. They also sell photos and stamps.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Staff: 5.0
Atmosphere: 5.0
Films: 5.0

This is a very cute films store. There are films and posters of every kind. The staffs are very nice too. I recommend going if you are near the area.
review_2_text: Amazing treasure trove full of film books, posters, movies and memorabilia! Many hours can be spent looking at all of the wonderful cinema content. A highlight for any film lover!
review_3_text: Every movie lovers DREAM. I could just spend hours in here looking through all the posters and books and awesome memorabilia. This is absolutely a must go if you're looking for a cool store in Toronto
review_4_text: Amazing shop. Film lover‚Äôs dream and with the most helpful and wonderful staff. Thank you Mike and Louise for everything!
review_5_text: Fantastic place for movies memorabilia and great books. The owner is very nice and we had a pleasant chat!

name: Bearly Used Books
description: Bearly Used Books is a used and rare bookstore in Hamilton, Ontario, offering a wide selection of titles.
full_address: 15 James St, Parry Sound, ON P2A 1T4
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: What an amazing experience! The owner was an absolute delight to speak with. She took the time to talk to me about some history of the place, how they order in some books for special orders and we just chatted about books for about 30 minutes! If you plan on stopping in, be ready to be here for hours! For a used bookstore with over 350 000 books, the aisles are easy to walk through with ample space for all!
review_2_text:
This is my favourite store. I‚Äôve been buying books from Bearly Used Books since I was 6 or 7 about 26 years ago! I‚Äôm pretty sure the first book I ever bought myself with my own money was from this shop when they were still next to Radio Shack on Bowes St. They‚Äôre as wonderful today as they were back then.

Budget friendly, fantastic selection, personable staff great books‚Ä¶ what‚Äôs not to love?! I even have books put on hold via social media! They‚Äôre quick to respond. 10/10 would recommend! Because it‚Äôs a used bookstore, the selection is ever changing and it‚Äôs never the same selection twice.

Even now, I am sure to stop by every time I come for a cottage visit. I could spend all day shopping at Bearly Used Books!

IMHO, everyone needs BUB in their life. The store just brings me so much joy!
review_3_text:
Looking for a new read?  Trying to fill a gap in your favourite novelist's collection?  Want to help rehome books to your home?  Come in with an open mind and you'll leave a with a bag full of books.  Yes, it's crammed with books, but also well staffed with helpful friendly bibliophiles to guide you to a treasure!
Enjoy!

August 21,2024
F & J
review_4_text: One of my favourite places on earth!!! Stepping in here is almost overwhelming - the amount of books they have is mind boggling. I love coming in here on a rainy day for a few hours. The staff are so friendly and kind and there‚Äôs a black lab who is there sometimes and is very cute.
review_5_text:
Fabulous used bookstore! My husband and I spent an afternoon of our holiday here, it‚Äôs a book lovers dream!
The store is a bit chaotic and it‚Äôs hard to find things but, once you get the hang of it, the hunt to find a book is a lot of fun.

Three staff we encountered were very helpful, kind, and passionate about books. One staff member audibly sighed when I asked for help reaching a novel, and seemed frustrated later when I was standing in an aisle he wanted to walk through ‚Äî it is a tightly packed space!

Overall, we enjoyed our experience (and our full bag of books!), we will be back next summer ‚òÄÔ∏è

name: TORN PAGES
description: Torn Pages is a cozy second-hand bookshop in downtown Stayner offering thousands of books, including bestsellers, children's classics, and non-fiction titles. Friendly and knowledgeable service in a welcoming environment.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Great book store! A great vibe, good selection and fair prices. The owner is a great guy. I was looking for books from a particular author and I had quick a very quick reply via e-mail with all the details.
review_2_text: A gem in the heart of Stayner, Torn Pages is a must stop on your visit through town. This shop has used books on every topic: politics, history, religion, cookbooks, art, science and of course, the widest selection of fiction you can imagine! Enjoy a browse through many other items available for purchase in store including mystery packages, bookmarks, comics, DVDs and more! The friendly owner is knowledgeable and willing to offer a recommendation!
review_3_text: Bookworms Unite! Torn Pages is a gem of a used bookstore in Stayner, Ontario. Wall to Wall books and an incredibly knowledgeable owner named Troy, who SOMEHOW knows almost every single book in existence. Knowledge and enthusiasm like his is hard to find and SO appreciated. He always steers my daughter and I toward some incredible books to try, and is always right. I love the feel of this quaint, little shop. Troy also packages books together into "mystery packs" wrapped in brown paper. Mystery, drama, romance, thriller, etc. Low price for great picks and a perfect surprise if you're unable to decide for yourself.  This little shop is definitely worth visiting.
review_4_text: Amazing book store. I got so many gems and my 5$ mystery book bag had 6 awesome books in it. So glad I found this place. I will be back!
review_5_text: Decided to finally make the trip to Torn Pages and I was not disappointed! Not only is Troy just a great person to chat with, he knows his stuff!  He gave me the lay of the land and then gave me a couple book recommendations that I can‚Äôt wait to dive into!  10/10, will shop again! Thanks Troy!!

name: Literacy Quesnel Society
description: Literacy Quesnel promotes community understanding of literacy and provides services to build literacy skills for individuals of all ages. They offer a used bookstore with books priced at $3 each, learning support with a focus on digital literacy, virtual health support and various community programs.
full_address: West Park Mall, 155 Malcolm Dr, Quesnel, BC V2J 3K2
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 12-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Great staff and volunteers. Good selection, prices, and services. Welcoming vibe.
review_2_text: Great selection of used books for $3 each. Very worthwhile organization to support. Cheerful, helpful volunteers.
review_3_text: $2 used books, non-profit society. Well worth supporting.
review_4_text: Friendly women there. Very helpful

name: The River Trading Company
full_address: 559 Barton St E, Hamilton, ON L8L 2Z2
working_hours: {Monday: 12-7p.m., Tuesday: 12-7p.m., Wednesday: 12-7p.m., Thursday: 12-7p.m., Friday: 12-9p.m., Saturday: 12-9p.m., Sunday: 12-7p.m.}
review_1_text: This is the perfect store to find books you‚Äôve never heard of that sound amazing! The place is so well arranged, with every corner filled with books, magazines, movies, board games, and trinkets. The prices are more than reasonable, especially for all the recent titles available. The mystery section is to die for! You should definitely go check out this store; the owner has made it so welcoming and warm :)
review_2_text: One of the best used bookstores I've been to.  Very, very well organized with high quality books.  Large selection, with decent prices.  Personable, friendly owner.
review_3_text: Stopped in on a whim and ended up buying over a dozen books. They really have a little of everything, and the gentleman who was working made some great recommendations for me. The prices are awesome as well. I would highly recommend stopping in and looking around. I will be back the next time I'm in town.
review_4_text:
This was a highlight of our visit to Hamilton (from Buffalo). There are SO many things to see in here, you will definitely be able to find a book (or a whole stack) for yourself or someone you know

I particularly loved the cats here, how organized all of the books were, and the good conversation we had with the shopkeeper. It's nice to meet with someone who seems friendly, genuine, and down-to-earth.
review_5_text: An amazing book store with great staff! The joy it brought me walking into the store was unbelievable! They have great selections, it's well organized and nothing was overpriced. Can't wait to visit again.

name: By the Books PTBO
description: By the Books is a carefully curated used bookstore in Peterborough, offering high-quality books and free same or next-day delivery within the city. They also offer an ever-expanding online selection.
working_hours: {Monday: 10:30a.m.-3p.m., Tuesday: 10:30a.m.-3p.m., Wednesday: 10:30a.m.-3p.m., Thursday: 10:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Friday: 10:30a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-3:30p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-3p.m.}
review_1_text: such a lovely book store! comfy cozy vibes and the owner was soo so sweet!
review_2_text: This is a wonderful used book store, conveniently located downtown. I love going in to browse around! If you can't make it in, you can check out their FB and Instagram where they share books that they have- and you can reserve them for another day! The staff are so friendly and helpful, and the prices on the books are fair. I just wish that they had more horror.. or as they call them, "stressful reads" üòÇ
review_3_text: This is a fabulous second hand book store. It may look chaotic (that's half the fun), but they really know their stock. If they have it, they can take you straight to it. Looking forward to visiting again soon.
review_4_text: I can't possibly imagine a more charming bookstore! I first discovered this bookstore because of their interesting Instagram posts. The owner is knowledgeable on so many topics and the design of the space makes you want to stay there for hours! I especially love how dedicated the owner is to diversity and social justice in their collection.  I'll definitely be signing up for their unique customized book club.
review_5_text: Love this book store! She has an incredible selection and always posts on socials what she has in stock.

name: Nuggets Used Books
working_hours: {Monday: 12-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
I can always find a book worth picking up here, and several more I didn't know I was looking for. Every genre you can think of is in the store. If you take a good look around, you'll find some retro collectibles on the shelves and walls.

It's a bit of a maze inside, but I love that. Being surrounded by literature isn't a bad thing. There is also a small selection of free paperbacks and hardcovers out front of the shop.

The owner is personable and always has time for a quick chat. One of the better used book stores in my opinion.
review_2_text:
Both my Dad and I Love coming to this bookstore! It's quite a drive for us to come out to Chilliwack, but coming to this bookstore is so worth the trip! The owner is so friendly and helpful, he keeps everything so wonderfully organized each section of books in their own little alcove and category and spots where you can sit and read the place is laid out and designed like a hidden maze were you can journey in search for something to read as well as a section for new titles as well for current book releases.
There is also a section for music were you can browse Records and CDs.  They do have a washroom so if you'll find your self spending time browsing or getting lost in reading a book you don't have to leave to find a bathroom. We find the Prices are very reasonable and when we took in some of our own books to the store the owner does offer both options of either cash or store credit.
Would greatly recommend anyone who wants to spend a weekend browsing books or is looking for a used bookstore with a great selection.
review_3_text: The vibes here are immaculate. It's cozy with the kind of meandering layout that invites you to browse at a leisurely pace, the owner is absolutely delightful and always knows how to help you find what you need, and I always find at least a couple books to take home with me. I love coming here.
review_4_text: This book store is nothing short of fantastic.  Neil has without a doubt created the best and most unique used book store and hidden treasures.  This store is a must see to browse through for your next read.   The ambiance is great and the service is even better.
review_5_text: He knows his books and music. You tell him your authors and he will introduce you to similar ones. He is  great with kids and helping them find books. I come from the states and get all my books from him. Very reasonably priced.

name: Book Lovers
full_address: 175 E 3rd St, North Vancouver, BC V7L 1E5
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Book Lovers is another of my top fave used book stores in the Greater Van area, and in my opinion is one of the best in this city. The owner, Dallas, is super helpful and wonderfully knowledgable. I've called her a few times trying to track down something a little rare and she's been very helpful to check to see if she has it-  and I've been very lucky most times that she did have it!!!  Book Lovers has a great selection of books, and the owner also gives fair value for select trade-ins. Highly recommended, highly worth the trip across one of the bridges.
review_2_text: I went in the store on a vacation I took in Van this year, and it was great! The owner is super sweet, has a memory of her stock I am jealous of and I found a couple jems I have never seen anywhere else. If you like to peruse used bookstores, or like books in general, make the journey
review_3_text: The Cheers of all bookstores. The owner is friendly, witty and always so happy to see all her regulars and welcome new ones. Store is clean and organized. Always find a book that I have been looking for ages here!
review_4_text:
When I stepped into the Book Lover second-hand bookstore in North Vancouver, I was immediately struck by the warmth and friendliness of the female clerk (whom I believe is the owner). She not only provided prompt and professional service but was also willing to engage with customers, answer questions, and offer recommendations.

The bookstore boasts a wide variety of books covering diverse topics and genres, from fiction to non-fiction, from history to science, catering to all interests.

Moreover, they have a treasure trove of rare and out-of-print books, making it a haven for collectors or those in search of unique finds.

In terms of pricing, I found the books offered to be very reasonable, sometimes even more so than other second-hand bookstores.

Additionally, the quality of the second-hand books is commendable; the book I recently purchased looked almost brand new.

Most importantly, despite not being an avid reader before, my pleasant experience at this bookstore has sparked a greater interest in reading for me.

Therefore, I highly recommend the Book Lover second-hand bookstore in North Vancouver to anyone, whether you're a book enthusiast or someone looking to cultivate a love for reading. It's an excellent choice for all.
review_5_text: I e driven by this bookstore many times. I was looking for a particular item so I called ahead and the lady who runs the store was so helpful! She put a few books aside for me and was very nice! Thank you üòä

name: Forest Books & Media
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Best book store in town! Very well maintained and well stocked with books and movies of all variety. The staff are all so very helpful!
review_2_text: Great place to find good books.  If you have a list of books you are looking for, make sure it's not from a source that needs internet.   No fault of the store owners,  it just that the building itself is one of those that cell services may struggle.
review_3_text: Awesome experience, lots of great vinyls and vintage pieces, super cheap and good quality stuff, if you have time to look a little!
review_4_text: Well stocked with books movies games etc. friendly helpful staff. Would absolutely recommend going to check it out. Five out of five stars! Will definitely go again!
review_5_text: Great addition to our community!  My family visits regularly for books, games, records and more!!

name: Bookcase The
full_address: 676 Memorial Ave, Qualicum Beach, BC V9K 1S9
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Great used book store with VERY fair pricing. The ladies working were lovely and there‚Äôs even a cute shop of locally made goods in the back. You should definitely check it out if you‚Äôre in the area
review_2_text: Thank you Kara and Albert for helping keep our beautiful beach library stocked with a great selection of good reads. There's something for everyone in this book store and you couldn't ask for more of a friendly and helpful staff.
review_3_text: Love the gift shop at the rear of the bookstore. Art from local artisans.
review_4_text: Friendly knowledge staff. I appreciate the art, local goods variety of products too. I have purchased  lovely journals, cards, soaps, and jewelry at Sea & Thrift.
review_5_text: Albert is a veritable buffet of knowledge. From history to science fiction to escape literature to children's books , he's the guy to go see . A good old fashioned book store ! What a treat to have met him and the best hour I've had o  our visit to the Village of Qualicum!!!

name: New Friends Book Shop
full_address: Unit 8, 520 Westney Rd S, Ajax, ON L1S 6W4
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I accidentally stumbled upon this gem and now I don't want to buy books anywhere else! Affordable and replete with quality books of all genres, I highly recommend! Best of all, proceeds go to two local shelters AND you can donate the books you don't want anymore to help out the cause. 15 out of 10.
review_2_text:
I've visited this store several times, and each time I was able to find an interesting read.  The selection is quite extensive and the prices are fantastic. This store will also
accept book donations which is a great way to recycle books that you no longer want but can be enjoyed by others.  You can also tell that the staff are passionate about what they do!
review_3_text:
January  26, 2024 ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
I stopped by New Friends Book Shop in Ajax today on a mission to find a specific book. I had previously borrowed the audio version from the library but wanted to add a hard copy to my collection. I not only found the book but also at an incredibly affordable price of just $2. This budget-friendly discovery exceeded my expectations. If you have any used books, it's also an ideal place to donate. The store has many new books for readers, making it a great place for book enthusiasts. If you like puzzles, they also have a nice selection to check out.

Like this post if it helped you!
review_4_text: You can get books very cheaply here.  Their selection changes as more books are dropped off.  The books are in good condition and there is no mildewy smell at all. Some vintage finds the Gen X will appreciate.
review_5_text: Can always find an interesting read and the selection of used puzzle helps keep my puzzle addiction in check

name: Librairie Les Rayons du Savoir
full_address: Entrep√¥t U-Haul, 3850 Rue Jean-Talon O Suite 134, Montr√©al, QC H3R 2G8
street: Entrep√¥t U-Haul, 3850 Rue Jean-Talon O Suite 134
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-8p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: I couldn't find the book I was looking for, and this bookseller had it at a very affordable price. The book was used but in very good condition.
review_2_text: Excellent customer service, wide variety of used books in very good condition and at reasonable prices. I recommend this bookstore without hesitation.
review_3_text: I bought my educational book here, I'm in Quebec and it delivers to me for 2 days üò≠üò≠üíñ good quality even if it's a "used" book, I don't believe it, it seems like a NEW book!! Fast and efficient, good service!!
review_4_text: Exceptionally friendly bookseller. I found books that no longer existed elsewhere; even the giant Amazon was out of stock, regardless of quality (new or used). I highly recommend!
review_5_text: I would like to highly recommend this bookstore to you.  The owner was very pleasant, kind and friendly. Communication was also clear and quick when I called for information. He is truly a passionate man who knows his inventory perfectly and is always eager to help you and provide very good service.

name: Castaway Used Books (Nearly New Books)
description: A haven for book lovers, collectors, and casual readers alike, offering a handpicked selection of used books. They also offer book trade-ins for store credit.
full_address: 1761 - B Comox Ave, Comox, BC V9M 3M2
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: The best used bookstore I have ever been to. Very pleasant owners, I NEVER leave empty handed. Very well organized and a peaceful place to find a book.
review_2_text: I love this store. I love shopping local for used books and staff is very knowledgeable about their stock. They are super friendly as well. Plus you can bring your books in for credit. And each time you pay, up to half of your credit can be applied to your total. It's a really cool system and she gets lots of turnover with lots of volume.
review_3_text: Great collection of titles. Decent prices.
review_4_text: An amazing store! We only bought 10 books (airline weight limit issues) but could have easily bought 2X that many of our favorite authors. Plus a very knowledgeable owner who is very helpful too. If you like to read and like low prices, Nearly New is a Must place to visit. Highly recommended!
review_5_text: Great little used book store. Lots of choice and good quality titles. Dropped off some used books and got 50% off my purchase of new to me books for my kids. Go check it out if you've never been. Well worth the stop for any book reader. Friendly and helpful staff makes it an easy choice to come back. Thanks again nearly new books.

name: Alhambra Books
description: Wide-ranging and large collection of quality used books. 60,000+ books for sale in a brick and mortar store located near Whyte Avenue. Open Tuesday through Saturday noon - 5 p.m. Special hours for Edmonton's Independent Bookstore Extravaganza April 26 & 27, 11am-5pm.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12-5p.m., Wednesday: 12-5p.m., Thursday: 12-5p.m., Friday: 12-5p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
This is a great used bookshop in Edmonton, and I would recommend this store to anyone who is looking for a good book, or even just in the mood for a nice place to meander around and browse on a hot day. I found the prices to be some of the best in the city for affordability and fair market value, they don't overcharge even though they easily could because independent bookstores are becoming more and more scarce.

There were many rows of books, with shelves ranging from shoulder height, to some going all the way to the roof. I'm sure there is easily thousands of books to choose from, and I would definitely say this place is worth the trip.

In the back area of the store, there is a display with tons of cool antique postcards from around the world, and I could help but buy some
review_2_text:
Great little shop.

Friendly staff. Well organized and a good selection of history, religion and local history.The non fiction section was decently sized. The popular book section was a bit smaller.

They did ask right away if we needed help. Sometimes this can be great. Sometimes this needs to be pulled back so not to scare people into not buying.
In my situation, I was looking for a specific book and they were able to easily and quickly locate the author.
review_3_text:
Was early for an appointment and decided to walk into this place as I love to read.
Anyone who also loves to read, needs to stop in here! There is such an amazing selection and soo well organized. As I was going to another place after, and I saw soo many books I wanted to take home, I need to return and pick them up!
review_4_text: Of course, it smells like a used bookstore, the smell of death. The store is organized and has plenty of books at a reasonable price. Just far enough off of whyte ave to actually have parking
review_5_text: Went in looking for kids books. The owners husband directed me to the place and showed me where the author I was looking for was located. It is second hand so choice is sometimes limited but I found what I was searching for and they were nice to my granddaughter. Smells so great in there like old books! A place I will continue to go to.

name: Friends of the Library Bookstore
description: The Friends of the Library Bookstore offers gently used books, DVDs, music CDs, and more at affordable prices. Most books are $1, and children‚Äôs books are 3 for $1. They also have premium books and specially priced antiques & collectibles.
full_address: 50 East St, Sault Ste. Marie, ON P6A 3C3
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: An unexpected treasure located just down the stairs and to the right of the main entrance to the Centennial Library. Three small, but packed rooms of books. The kids section had lots of great picture books with beautiful illustrations, and there were a number of award-winning YA fiction titles. Many gardening, hobby and crafting titles. Also had a small selection of vinyl records near the front desk.
review_2_text: Very friendly atmosphere, was visiting from out of town and enjoyed the experience
review_3_text: This bookstore was easy to find thanks to the photos posted by "Canadian Vandweller" (previous reviewer). Although this store was small, there were 3 rooms full of great books, and even some that were free! Many books were in good condition and only $1! Staff were friendly. Definitely worth a stop!
review_4_text: Amazing used bookstore. Most books are $1 and you can find new titles as well as older titles. Very friendly staff. They receive new stock pretty much daily. Many genres too choose from.
review_5_text: Hidden gem! Excellent used book store and very friendly staff. Very well organized and easy to find great cheap books.

name: Pickwick Books
description: Pickwick Books is a charming bookstore in Waterdown, Ontario, offering a wide selection of books since 1995. They sell new and used books, offer book boxes tailored to your preferences, and have a selection of rare and collectible books available on Biblio.com. They also partner with Libro.fm for audiobooks.
full_address: 325 Dundas St E, Waterdown, ON L0R 2H0
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text:
Fantastic bookstore with an eclectic selection of titles. You never know what you will find.

Used to be the old bank so enjoy the architecture and early 20th century fixtures such as the bank vault and tellers office. Each holds a selection of special books.

Pickwicks also carries many collector books. Stop in and spend the day browsing.
review_2_text: Cutest little shop. The vault is interesting to see.  Wide variety of books. Also, willing to keep a list and call you if your requested books come in.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Parking is a little tricky, try diagonally across the street.  Wonderful place to browse, worth a visit!
review_3_text:
This charming and cozy bookstore is a treasure trove of variety, offering an extensive array of sections that cater to different genres and styles. It boasts a delightful children's area and a fascinating zone dedicated to vintage books, making you feel as though you've stepped into a literary Hogwarts. The air is rich with the scent of books, both old and new, each in varying conditions, creating an enchanting atmosphere.The staff are exceptionally knowledgeable and eager to assist, always ready to help you find the perfect book for your needs. Additionally, the store features unique postcards that capture its original charm and a rich history that enchants every visitor. You‚Äôll also find lovely accessories and pins themed around books, adding to the store's delightful character.
My apologies apparently something went wrong I give u 5 stars ‚≠êÔ∏è, but for some reason google only show one , fix it already ü´∂
review_4_text: I‚Äôve been coming here for years and love it just as much now as I did then!!! Recently saw a post on instagram about the Percy Jackson series which I loved as a kid and have always wanted to own and re-read! The owner held them for me so that I could buy them when I was able to make it down to the shop! Cutest bookstore around in a beautiful building and full of gems you wouldn‚Äôt find elsewhere
review_5_text: I used to come here all the time when my aunt and uncle lived on Mill Street. Glad the Book Crawl brought me back, such a cute bookstore with so many great deals!

name: Janus Books
description: Janus Books has been buying and selling high-quality second-hand books in downtown Guelph since 2012. They stock over 10,000 books in-store and online and offer free in-store pickup and Canada-wide shipping.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text:
Amazing bookstore.  FINALLY found a copy of Stephen King‚Äôs Thinner and a couple of other hardcover books I wanted.  The gentleman who runs the store asked us a couple times if he could help (in a very friendly, not pushy way) and had some folks in selling books so we got to hear about how he chooses/prices the books and his quality expectations.  The books were some of the most pristine used books I‚Äôve ever seen (they may as well have been new!).  He even kept the more delicate ones behind the counter to avoid damage but was happy to bring anything out to look at.  It isn‚Äôt an exceedingly large store but I was surprised with the selection.  He also had a charity table (he donates to his local shelters and other charities!) and a shelf of ‚Äúpay what you can‚Äù.   The owners mother was there as well and was such a sweet lady.  Seriously folks, everyone needs to shop here.  Wish we were more local, I‚Äôd get all my books here.

If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.
review_2_text: Amazing little bookstore with incredible staff and a wide range of selection. We always leave smiling, with a book and one of their signature bookmarks. A must stop for any book lover.
review_3_text: Books are in great condition at fair prices. Often cheaper than Amazon. Very friendly and personal customer service without being too intrusive. The shop has a great selection and special clearance sales outside the front door. Support your local stores! I‚Äôll return for another book soon.
review_4_text: Wow! Sold some graphic novels and was offered an excellent deal - split store credit and cash. Well curated book selection is fairly priced and all are in great condition. Good selection of sci-fi, graphic novels. Nice to see an Indigenous authors section, too. Super friendly and funny staff. Would recommend.
review_5_text: A little hidden gem in this plaza dominated by market fresh! The prices of the books are a little higher than what you would normally find for a used book store, but the selection is great and the staff here are always lovely and very helpful! Support this little local business and read more, it‚Äôs a win-win! Personally love checking out their Mystery section üëåüèª

name: What the Dickens Books & Curios
description: Retail new and used books, collectibles.
full_address: 145 Mill St E, Acton, ON L7J 1H9
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
A small shop with a great variety of books. I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs that special but for a small town like Acton, it‚Äôs a life saver to be honest. You don‚Äôt really have many options here, even the library nearby is a bit lacking.

The best part here is the old lady, man she‚Äôs a great person to talk to. Makes the trip here always worth it.
review_2_text: Tons of cool books! Organized nicely and shop owner was very friendly.
review_3_text: Such a great experience. I love used bookstores and they are baffling hard to find in the GTA. But this one had some wonderful hidden gems and great ambience. Take your book lovers.
review_4_text: A real book store, with an owner who knows and loves books! Always worth a browse - you never know what treasure you might find. In addition to books, we found some lovely paintings here.
review_5_text: Amazing bookstore with a wonderful variety of books. The owner is so sweet‚Ä¶shopping here was a lovely experience!

name: Dartmouth Book Exchange
description: Dartmouth Book Exchange is a treasure trove for book lovers, offering a wide selection of great condition paperbacks, hardcovers, and trade paperbacks, along with teas inspired by classic literature, book bundles, and literary events. Friendly customer service is a priority, and the store is known for being unexpectedly large and well-organized.
full_address: 1187A Cole Harbour Rd, Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E8
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: BEST BOOKSTORE EVER! I stopped here on my way home and suddenly 2 hours had passed. We'll organized, great selection, good prices, friendly staff. Good spot for self-shopping and finding gifts. In addition to used books, they sell local tea, tote bags, and book accessories. Liked the "blind date with a book" selection (and price) as well. This store will be a new staple visit whenever I am in the area!
review_2_text: One of my absolute favourite places. Used bookstores are often stuffed but dirty or empty but clean, and this gem manages to be both stuffed and clean. Everything is so well organized and charming and the staff are incredible. They even have a digital inventory system which is so rare for used bookstores. The absolute best!!
review_3_text: Lots and lots of great books here...loads of room to look around.. helpful staff(the lady that was there she was very helpful in pointing me in the right direction) you'll need a lot of time to cruise around so many books... great prices...all books were in fabulous condition. Doesn't sell really old books though if you're looking for that. But definitely lots to choose from.
review_4_text: Great staff, helpful, clean and well organized. Good selection and pricing. The best of the 4 used book stores I've attended. Hope they're around a long time!
review_5_text: Fantastic bookstore. Staff are amazing, they remember you, they recommend books. Keep track of what is in store,  you emails when you are added to a waitlist for a book. Many events to get you into more books. Local authors visit the store for you to meet

name: Companion Books
description: Companion Books is a bookstore with over 60,000 books, offering both new and used selections. They also buy, sell, and trade books, and offer estate sale services. They plan to launch a Mobile Book Store in the future.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: This store has a long history in Burnaby. Been coming here with my kids since forever. After a 2 years in stint abroad, my son who is an avid reader was so stoked to be back in Canada with English books! The staff are friendly and very knowledgeable in all genres. They also buy and trade your used titles. Make sure they are in good condition though. Lovely place and vibe even if it is just to browse. Recommended!
review_2_text: Amazingly great experience for any book lovers!!! Owner and staff really love reading books too with their wholehearted recommendations!!! Definitely will come and buy books from now on!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüëçüëçü•∞ü•∞üòòüòò
review_3_text: I went to this store for the first time and had such a great experience. I struggled to get around because I was pushing a big stroller, but James was so kind and moved things around so I can get by and even went and brought books up to me at the front so that I didn't have to walk around so much with the stroller. James was so helpful with letting me know where everything was in the store and he also gave some great recommendations. The store carries some really good books and even the used ones were in really good condition. I bought a couple and i'm so happy with my purchases and will definitely be back to buy more books but also just for the pleasant experience.
review_4_text: I love this bookstore. Cozy, chill vibe. Lots of used books to browse. Staff are very friendly and helpful with suggestions. I've also ordered through them a few times for books they don't have on hand as I'd much rather support a small bookstore than the chains.
review_5_text: Companion Books is one of my top fave used book stores in Vancouver, and in my opinion is one of the best in this city. They have a great selection of books across all genres in really good condition, and I've been successful at getting a couple of books here which I haven't ever seen physically at any other used bookstore, before or since, including a really rare Ray Bradbury book, which is quite an exceptional feat. They also give fair value for select trade-ins. Not that its something I personally purchase, but they also sell a great selection of really nice book-themed cloth bags, and some very cute stuffed animals. Big shout to the fantastic staff, I've had great help from James a couple of times, along with Wes and Arian, and another lady there whose name I forgot. Highly recommended.

name: Boutique Livres et Tr√©sors
description: Bookstore utilizing the CLZ cloud system for book management and sales. Offers a wide variety of books with options to filter by genre, author, publication year, and more. Books available for sale, wishlisting, and tracking.
full_address: 495 Rue King E, Sherbrooke, QC J1G 1B6
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: They have lots of choices from little-known books to must-have classics. Not to be missed, this store. In addition, the people who work there are passionate, knowledgeable and charismatic. I highly recommend
review_2_text: Beautiful, busy little shop! A multitude of very well-ordered choices on 2 floors and a librarian who knew the books really well. I loved the service and highly recommend. I will go back soon!
