review_3_text: Very clean and well-lit bookstore with large selection of books (antiques, classics, recent). The owner is helpful and pleasant. I could have spent hours there looking at the books and objects. I will return there during my next visit to Sherbrooke.
review_4_text: We found lots of treasures (the name is perfect) for the children and for us! Little wonders and very affordable prices. I highly recommend!
review_5_text: A superb place to go and read; warm welcome, relevant and competent information; a bachelor's degree in literature to guide you!

name: Well-Read Books
description: Well-Read Books is the Yukon territory‚Äôs only used bookstore, serving the community for over 25 years. They offer a large selection of books and provide friendly service.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text: All books are catalogued and place smells great!  They clean their books extensively so that library smell doesn't creep in! This is a must stop for any book lover!!
review_2_text:
If you are in whitehorse and you love books then this place is a must visit.
Huge collection of books from all genres and most of them are second hand and in very good condition. You can browse around or ask for assistance from staff.
All of them are friendly and well versed so they can be helpful resource if you are looking for a particular book or record. Yes! Not to miss , they have a separate music section and another section for kids

Even though I didn‚Äôt take any food picture while i was there but let me tell you very honestly that they have so so so much of bakery goods that you will have hard time deciding on what you want to eat.
Everything is freshly baked in brick oven so imagine the freshness and taste. For sure its not regular grocery store so prices are little on higher end. Not too too expensive though.
I tried pumpkin spice latte which is very creamy and flavourful , a person next to my table was raving all about the yellow spice turmeric latte. Apple strudel i had just melted in my mouth and i am guessing that their all time famous is onion,rosemary,walnut bun as not only me but almost every other person bought it.
They also have customized chocolates with engraving of thank you and happy birthday.
Staff is very pleasing and helpful. You can use wifi and sit inside or outside on their patio which is like litle garden with benches to sit and eat. Clean bathroom. Baskets and dairy to purchase too. Homemade yogurt, dips and spreads can be purchased from here.

Indoor plants decorated book reading corner is the best part of the whole place and a purple painted piano is outstandingly cool . I am guessing you can play it after taking permission from the staff or maybe you cant . At least you can enjoy its glorious display.
I ended up buying 5 books and all for $35 so go ahead and grab what you want from a hobbybook like origami‚Äôs tutorial to full fledge novel collection and biographies.
review_3_text: Lovely store, amazing stock and staff, could spend hours , books maps you name it , great prices
review_4_text: Great selection.  I bought 8 books I needed in a series I'm collecting
review_5_text: I love going to Well-Read Books! My children do as well, they have a nice little kids area well stocked with books. It's well organized and staff are always friendly and will look up books you are looking for if you can't find them. We bring in books which gives us credit towards our next purchase. Good program, nice space

name: SEPHYR - Les livres de l'Espoir
description: Scl√©rose en plaques Haute-Yamaska - Richelieu (SEPHYR) is a community organization supporting people with multiple sclerosis and related chronic neurological diseases, their families, and caregivers. They operate a used bookstore and an online shop to fund their services.
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-3p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: real Nice! The money go to a foundation, love it. lot of choice, most french but also English
review_2_text: Great store, all used books cost less than 5$. French and English books available
review_3_text: This place is wonderful. Well organized. Great selection of books.
review_4_text: Excellent
review_5_text: Very nice and clean

name: Re-Read Used Books
description: ReRead Used Books offers a wide selection of quality used books at affordable prices! We are located in Canton, GA.
full_address: 1626 Stittsville Main St, Stittsville, ON K2S 1P3
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: I've bought an advent calendar from here and some books. Every time I come in the staff are friendly and helpful. The shelves always seem well organized. I always find some hidden treasures. The prices are great too! I love their blind dates with a book!
review_2_text: Wow, what a fantastic second hand book store.  Cheerful, helpful staff and such a vast selection of books, very well organised.  You should go!
review_3_text: I come here to get my kid books and there are plenty of options at great prices! Love the selection! The woman who works there is also very lovely.
review_4_text: I love this bookstore.  It started because they list their inventory online - but now it's because of the amazing customer service I receive in every single interaction I have with them! I also love their holiday advent calendars (amazing price!)  Definitely recommend - Happy reading!
review_5_text: Really friendly family owned store! Our daughter enjoyed picking out books and bringing them to the counter in a child-sized shopping cart.

name: The Monkey's Paw
description: The Monkey's Paw is a Toronto antiquarian shop specializing in uncommon books and paper artifacts from the age of print. They are also home to the Biblio-Mat, a randomizing vending machine for old books.
full_address: 1067 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 3B9
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: the collection is pretty old and there‚Äôs a lot! good prices, can spend hours in here. the biblio-mat machine adds a fun experience just for $5 (if you pay cash). it was a great experience ü•∞
review_2_text: I've had a few unforgettable moments like this when exploring a new store! The selection of books is nothing short of amazing‚Äîit's like stumbling upon hidden treasures at incredibly fair prices! And let me tell you, the book machine adds an extra layer of excitement to the whole experience‚Äîno spoilers here, but trust me, it's a delightful surprise! Plus, chatting with the owner was such a pleasure; it made the visit even more enjoyable. I can't recommend this place enough‚ÄîI‚Äôm already counting down the days until I can go back!
review_3_text:
It was my lucky day that I left work early and finally got to visit this gem of a bookstore before it closed for the day.

I could've spent hours in here browsing their amazing and eclectic collection of books. It's such a quirky, unique, and one-of-a-kind place and is oh-so-rare in boring Big City Toronto. This store takes you back to more peaceful and simpler times, before the days of technological distraction.

The owner was so aptly dressed for the store and exuded such warmth. His dandy dress, his look, and kind personality is so reminiscent of stepping into a 1960s bookstore. You HAVE to visit this place to feel this ambience... and try the book machine :).

I'm told their collection changes every month so I will be back :).
review_4_text:
Staff: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5
Overall: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 5/5!!!

If you are looking for a bookstore that sells old and antique books, look no further! This bookstore has all sorts of books in old editions, from cookbooks to math textbooks. I was thrilled to see Katherine Mansfield‚Äôs Garden Party in it and immediately grabbed it. The staff is very willing to answer your questions. There‚Äôs also a machine where you can spend 5 CAD to get a random old book, which is cool. The bookstore is small, but I could easily spend an hour in it. The ambience and atmosphere are also great. Next time I visit Toronto I will try to go here again!
review_5_text: So so cozy and the staff are so friendly. The biblio-mat is definitely a highlight. It‚Äôs worth a visit, very unique and special

name: Librairie La Cargaison
description: La Cargaison offers used books, comics, and vinyl records. They buy and sell items.
full_address: 51 A Rue George, Sorel-Tracy, QC J3P 1B9
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12-5p.m., Wednesday: 12-5p.m., Thursday: 12-5p.m., Friday: 12-5p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Where should I begin with!!!
My favorite store in Sorel.
Charismatic owner with great knowledge of his environment,willingness to share it all, with you
review_2_text: What impeccable service! Thank you very much for a perfect online shopping experience! Easy to use website, large selection of books, package shipped very quickly with immediate tracking at every stage of shipping, the book was double and carefully packaged to ensure optimal protection of the merchandise to my grateful hands. Additionally, the submission was accompanied by a bookmark and a hand-written thank you note. You truly have a winning recipe. Thank you so much!
review_3_text: Beautiful bookstore, nice theme, welcoming staff
review_4_text: Bookstore, clean in easy order in its landmarks. I loved it. Several comics, CDs, DVDs and puzzles.
review_5_text:
Delighted with the selection and impeccable service. Seamless online ordering and swift shipping. Looking forward to visiting in person when in town!

Delighted with the selection and impeccable service. Ordering online was simple and fast shipping. A visit to the store when passing through town is in order!

name: Karol Krysik Books
description: Karol Krysik Books offers a variety of books and related resources. Explore their website to browse their selection and learn more.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 11a.m.-2p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Incredibly patient and helpful proprietor. He brought in some books from off-site for me to look over and was very communicative as to his availability. The best selection of fine modern copies I have so far encountered in the city. Many of the selections represented on the shelves I have personally had a hard time sourcing anywhere in person in fine enough condition or interesting enough editions (Malcolm Lowry, Patrick White, Cormac McCarthy, Seamus Heaney). All priced fairly and commensurate to their condition. Would be hard pressed to visit and not find something relevant. Thank you kindly.
review_2_text: Hard to get a reply to emails from them. One book I wanted, that was described as "near fine,... a like new copy" on their website, had multiple yellow & black stains on the spine in a picture of it that they (thankfully) emailed me. I noticed these and asked if they would wipe off, to which they said no. The other book I wanted they could not find.
review_3_text:
Tons of rare and antique books. If you're a collector and looking for a juicy new addition, Karol can hook you up. He's very well connected and can connect you to any book you're looking for or find a buyer for any books you may own.

The store is very clean and organized. You can spend hours here just browsing his collection on display. Everything he has on display is only a small portion of what he actually owns. Just ask him or check his online store on abebooks.
review_4_text:
A wonderful collection of old and older books. The owner Karol knows his stuff and is extremely helpful. I had one book in mind but Karol was able to offer suggestions on related and similar items.

This store keeps irregular hours so contact them in advance if you don't want to be disappointed. Karol can arrange to meet you.
review_5_text: Karol is a great proprietor of used and rare books. The store and clean and organized super well. The floors are particularly awesome! Karol is knowledgeable, super good to deal with and is a great addition to the young book dealer club. Highly recommended!!!

name: Williamsford Mill
description: A restaurant and bookstore located in a historic grist mill in Williamsford, Ontario. Offers homemade breakfasts and lunches alongside over 80,000 books in more than 50 categories.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text:
The Great Books and Cafe is a charming location (by a small river since it used to be a mill!) with quite the wide array of books.

The fireplaces (both by the dining and reading areas) are kept going while the weather outside is cold.

The food is lovely. The fries match well with ketchup and the Mill Burger my parter and I had was very good.

Of course, the books were my own main draw and I was delighted to see quite the range went beyond my own imagination.

Though I could find no dedicated location for fantasy there were such books along the shelves. There were also books on history, cooking, religion, art, mystery, westerns, science-fiction (so much), and other types without types along the three floors granted to the books.

Though the hours open are short, if ever nearby you should indeed give this spot a visit.
review_2_text: They say there are over 100k books on hand. Also vinyl records, DVDs and magazines. Plenty of little nooks to hang out and read and enjoy a beverage. Also, plenty of indoor/outdoor seating to have a snack or a meal. They've got a decent menu. Food is made to order. It's really a lovely place and we will make the near 2 hour drive again. Plenty of parking.
review_3_text: One of my favourite places! We went there for brunch yesterday with friends. We sat by the cozy fireplace. Even though I wasn't hungry, I ate every bit of my BLT and Salad, oh, except the half piece of bacon I shared with my husband. The bacon was thick cut and perfectly cooked. The tomatoes tasted like garden fresh summer tomatoes from my garden and the salad had lovely greens, cucumbers, tomatoes, and some herbs too. Then we looked around and with the owners help, we found some great books. Great prices for used books. We left with full bellies, and a stack of books!
review_4_text:
We absolutely love this place. It's a great place to stop in and eat, relax and have a warm drink and shop for books. The food is delicious, the selection of books are amazing and the atmosphere is warm and cozy. The outside grounds are really pretty too and you can walk down to the river in the back.
Oh and they have butter tarts that are so yummy!
review_5_text: This is a very unique restaurant and bookstore, the owners are wonderful people, the food is always amazing, and there is a great selection of books. Always a special and well enjoyed experience -- can't wait to go back!

name: Fiona's Book Corner
description: A bookstore with a gallery of images showing the store's interior.
full_address: 575 Notre Dame St, Belle River, ON N0R 1A0
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-2p.m.}
review_1_text: Very nice used bookstore. A good selection and prices are reasonable. There are actually 5 businesses in this building and they were all very good.
review_2_text: Lovely book store. Always a pleasure browsing and talking with employees. Large variety of choices.
review_3_text: Great selection of used books! Impressed with how many bestsellers they have!
review_4_text: Incredible selection of books and new ones are always coming in! 10/10 would recommend!!

name: Doug Miller Books
description: A bookstore with frequent photo updates of its inventory and offerings. The website features numerous images of books and the store environment.
full_address: 650 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6G 1K9
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text:
It‚Äôs a used bookstore with a lot of books and Lego inside. The owner is very knowledgeable about the books he has (and doesn‚Äôt have) in inventory.

We browsed for a while and selected a couple of books for purchase.

Things to note. Since there are a lot of books and Lego, there isn‚Äôt a lot of room to maneuver.

Additionally, the terminal doesn‚Äôt like tap for debit, apparently. You can tap with Visa and Mastercard or you can insert your debit card in the machine. This happened quite a bit while we were browsing and the owner needed to explain. Basically, no debit if it‚Äôs in your mobile wallet only.

Overall, it‚Äôs a quaint little place. We may need to stop by on occasion to see if there are any ‚Äúnew‚Äù books available.
review_2_text: Stepping into this bookstore is like entering a literary wonderland, where each corner and shelf seems to whisper tales from different eras. The atmosphere is incredibly cozy and welcoming, making it easy to lose yourself for hours among the well-curated selection of books that span centuries of storytelling. It's a place that not only caters to the bibliophile but also to those seeking a quiet, friendly nook to unwind and explore.What sets this bookstore apart is the delightful surprise of a Lego section. This creative corner is stocked with an impressive array of Lego sets, appealing to both young builders and adult collectors. It‚Äôs not just a side attraction but a fully integrated experience that bridges the gap between playful creativity and the intellectual stimulation of reading.The combination of books and Legos creates a uniquely inspirational space, fostering imagination across mediums. It provides a safe and inviting environment where passions for constructing worlds, whether through building blocks or within the pages of a book, are celebrated and nurtured.This bookstore is truly a magical destination. It is a sanctuary for those who love to read, build, and dream, making it a perfect spot for anyone looking to be inspired or to find solace in both new stories and timeless classics. Whether you're a seasoned reader or a Lego enthusiast, this charming spot offers a delightful blend of both worlds.
review_3_text:
One of my favourite book shops in Toronto, I can easily spend an hour in here just looking through their massive selection. I like their variety of used and new books, this is my new go-to for graphic novels since Hairy Tarantula closed down, but mostly I flip through their classics. Many books in my collection have been added thanks to Doug Miller Books.

Plus -- their prices are super reasonable, they always have $1-$2 deals, and they're open long hours. Gotta love that!
review_4_text:
Smashing IT! üìöüòéüìö

Found this little gem in the heart of the Annex the other day, and I am very happy that I did.

I've been strolling through the city and visiting a lot of second-hand bookstores, and I must say I feel at one with Doug Miller's Books!

What I really love about the charm of the store is the easy layout and being able to access books based on what reading mood I happen to be in at that moment.

I also really like the fact that there's an emphasis on the classics and their front and center. Easy to locate and easy to find.

And get this, they have the old Hardy Boys Book Collection!

I read those back in grade school!

I just adore this book store and can't wait to delve into this magical bookstore again! ‚úåÔ∏è
review_5_text: I would definitely recommend for any book lovers. Amazing selection and amazing prices!!! The person working there was so nice and helpful.

name: Book Brothers The
description: Book Brothers offers a wide selection of used books at affordable prices: Trade Paperbacks $4.99, Hardcovers $4.99, and Pocket Books $3.99. They also offer a 360 degree virtual tour of the store.
full_address: 25 King St E UNIT C, Chatham, ON N7M 3M6
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Great first visit! Will definitely be back. Huge selection. Love the atmosphere.
review_2_text: Amazing place, you can live in if you're a book lover! So many many books which is like in a fairy tale story. Very kind and helpful owner, his knowledge of books and well organized store....and thoughtful of making a nice spot for readers, a cozy chair with blanket....
review_3_text:
Walking into this place is overwhelming but there's a peace about it!
No order, no organization, nothing in a certain area.
They could definitely use someone with perfectionism working there aha.
Be prepared to spend hours looking at the mass amount of options available.
The staff are always always kind!
review_4_text: Excellent collection at pretty good prices too. The books are in sections and alphabetical by author last name but not in order by letter. You‚Äôll need to search carefully but you‚Äôll likely find surprises along the way too. Check around and give yourself time to look, don‚Äôt be in a hurry or you‚Äôll miss a great find in the stacks. Friendly and helpful people there to assist you. Enjoy your time here.
review_5_text: A must for book lovers! An interesting used book shop where you may find something you had been looking for ages. Good prices too!

name: Antiquarius
description: Antiquarius Bookshop is a long-established rare and antiquarian bookshop located in Chicago. We specialize in rare books, first editions, and other collectible books.
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Website is definitely old school, but had no issue purchasing and delivery to the US. Thanks!
review_2_text: I had been looking for a certain book for a couple of weeks, in and out of used book stores with no success. I googled it and this online store popped up. Well I ordered it right away and I have just received it. It is in better condition than I thought it would be and the price was reasonable. Packaging was top notch as well. Now I know where to start my next search. Thank You!
review_3_text: Had a wonderful chat with the owner

name: Agricola Street Books
description: Agricola Street Books is a used and rare bookstore in Princeton, NJ. We specialize in an eclectic mix of books, with a focus on literature, history, and the arts.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: I love Agricola Street books. It is a very inviting, bright space, with an interesting assortment of used books at a discounted price as well as cards, games, notebooks and gifts. All the books are in great condition and I have yet to leave without a new read. The staff are very helpful and friendly, easy to talk to. Also, they do a great buyback program every once in a while where they will take your old books in exchange for store credit! Highly reccomend!
review_2_text: Small, cozy, charming bookstore with a better/more interesting selection of books than in downtown. They also have a small section of cards/stationary and a few gifts. They do book buybacks if you ask (they also have signs up about it). Lovely. A must see in Halifax for all book lovers!
review_3_text: A snowy Sunday, a walk to enjoy a quiet bookstore, with coffee in hand from JB roasters. The vibe is perfect. The place is beautiful and the selection of books, though not huge, has something for everyone - stationery, cute socks, games for kids and discounted books.
review_4_text: great place to get new or used books, they also have a discount section with books for 5$! the staff is so friendly and the atmosphere is charming and bright. i want to start coming here more often :)
review_5_text: Agricola street books is my favourite book store in Halifax! Their selection and quality of books beats any other used book store I‚Äôve visited. Besides that, the environment is so calming and beautiful. Their memoir section is incredible! But they also have lots of other books including lots of local authors, young adult, general fiction, poetry and more!

name: The Purple Platypus
description: A cozy little bookstore in rural Alberta offering a wide variety of secondhand books and new books by local authors.
full_address: 5003B 50 Avenue Main Street, Castor, AB T0C 0X0
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: If you like "old school" used bookstores, this is your place! Floor to ceiling shelves packed with books, boxes of books everywhere free for browsing, and an enthusiastic proprietor who can point you towards just about anything your heart desires! We stumbled upon it by chance, but we're already planning a return visit!
review_2_text: Lynn is excellent at finding the books you want. She stocks all types of books that will appeal to all ages. You can bring your books in for credit or just donate.Fun place to shop!
review_3_text: Wonderfully cozy  bookshop! Love the variety in the selections! Very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be returning. üíú
review_4_text: A good selection of gently used books with helpful cheery staff

name: Squamish Community Bookstore
description: The Squamish Community Bookstore is a volunteer-run source for books in Squamish. Books are donated by community members and curated by dedicated volunteers.
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: Their sign advertising $3 books brought in me in the door, but their warmth and compassion kept me inside. Their mission to help immigrants and the LGBTQ community continues to become vital. Weeks after my visit, I continue to reflect on the conversations we had and wish them the best.
review_2_text: A place to call my own, where I find myself in every book donated or bought, and in every satisfied customer and visitor's smile. Volunteering in this very special bookshop has helped me to connect more and more with this beautiful city that has welcomed me. Moreover, the money from the books helps the Community Center and the Bookstore for everyone as it has been for over 10 years. The money also helps enhance the programs for free to support newcomers and immigrants. A wonderful spot to relax and enjoy some time browsing through a diverse selection of books. I also enjoy discovering the beautiful dedications throughout many of the books.

name: The Paper Hound Bookshop
description: Paperhound is an independent bookstore in Vancouver offering a curated selection of books, vintage postcards, and unique finds. They are known for their witty social media presence and a playful approach to bookselling.
full_address: 344 W Pender St, Vancouver, BC V6B 1T1
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text:
This was a super cute and tiny bookstore!
I picked myself up a book that I probably never would‚Äôve gone for in a larger department store. TBD on whether or not I like it, but it did seem interesting on something that usually wouldn‚Äôt be on display at other bookstores.
I am giving it four stars versus five as it is smaller and it doesn‚Äôt carry a lot of big and trendy books. It‚Äôs more somewhere you go to find things off the beaten path, and they seem to have a lot of dystopian topics available.
It was super clean and I was happy to see it open during the holiday. There were three other people there while I visited and we each bought a book. Which gives me the census that there‚Äôs something for all of us.
Overall, I would recommend checking it out for the vibes and to find something cool and different.
review_2_text: I absolutely love this bookstore. The layout is incredible, and there are so many vintage books! It has the widest variety I've seen so far‚Äîand it's extremely well organized. I'm currently trying to learn Russian and stumbled upon a very old Russian learning module that came with two books and a listening vinyl‚Äîin pristine condition!
review_3_text: Today was my first time discovering this store. I had to run because my parking was running out, but I will be back again for sure! They have a selection of some very amazing  and rare books, and the overall vibe feels like a " little magical book store", where you might find the book from Neverending Story or a passage to Narnia.
review_4_text:
Cute second hand bookstore. Found a book that I loved reading here. I was given a bookmark with the cutest dog on it. I also bought a shop tote bag and I‚Äôm totally obsessed.

You have to come here! I wish I lived closer, I would visit all the time.
review_5_text:
A beautiful and well kept store with shelves packed to the brim of incredible choices and beautifully done binded books!. I also couldn't help but love the amazing and unique sign for paper hound, the wood work was so cool!.

Owner/front entrance staff(?) was very kind, welcoming us into the store even if it was a little busy at front counter.

name: Nearly New Books
description: Nearly New Books is a family-owned and operated bookstore in Red Deer, Alberta, offering a wide selection of over 40,000 gently read books at reasonable prices. They welcome trades and provide a book recycle solution.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Such a great selection and variety of books. The staff are also very helpful. A very nice hidden gem of a bookstore!
review_2_text: Nice little used bookstore, and it's a perk that you get credit for donating! Books are insanely expensive nowadays so I donate rather than purchase, but when looking for those gems you just want physical copies of, a place like this is nice. Wish there was a bit more selection, but makes sense when demand for physical books is down.
review_3_text: Lovely store, knowledgeable staff. A great selection and wonderful trade in policy. Will definitely be back!
review_4_text: Love this store!  Definitely an asset to Red Deer. Great selection of all genres plus at any given time. Spacious, airy & beautifully set up. The owners & employees couldn‚Äôt be more accommodating & friendly.
review_5_text: Great bookstore. They had many titles and everything was well sorted and alphabetized. The staff were kind and knowledgeable. I spent a good deal of my time in the children's books section and found many good quality books, quite a few were in brand new condition and had never been cracked. I will definitely be coming back!

name: Librairie Librissime
description: Librissime is a general bookstore offering a wide selection of books, magazines, and gifts. We also feature a cafe and host events!
full_address: 479 5e rue de la Pointe, Shawinigan, QC G9N 1E5
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Great library, friendly staff and great selection of books. I highly recommend it :)
review_2_text:
Beautiful bookstore, with a thousand and one treasures of literature...magnificent place..
And very friendly property and attentive to our needs..ü§©
üìîüìïüìóüìòüìöüìïüíù
review_3_text: A superb second-hand bookstore, the owner is charming and these literary recommendations are perfect! I love going there just to savor the atmosphere and the smell of old books! My favorite part when I come to Shawinigan, go there without hesitation üíñ
review_4_text: Always a great selection of books at low prices! The owner is very friendly and attentive to customers!
review_5_text:
I passed on Saturday February 17, 24
The young man (S√©bastien) who was there was very kind and polite towards me.

I recommend this place to buy and leave books you no longer need.

name: Comptoir FA√âCUM Roger-Gaudry - Kiosque de livres usag√©s (KLU)
description: Buy and sell used books online. Search for books and pick them up at a convenient location, or sell your used books by registering online.
full_address: 2900 boul. √âdouard Montpetit, Pavillon Roger Gaudry, local V-114, 2900 Edouard Montpetit Blvd, Montreal, Quebec H3T 1J4
street: 2900 boul. √âdouard Montpetit, Pavillon Roger Gaudry, local V-114, 2900 Edouard Montpetit Blvd

review_1_text: Very useful given the sometimes expensive prices of new books!

name: Kestrel Books
description: Kestrel Books is a well-established bookstore specializing in rare, fine, out-of-print, and antiquarian books, as well as general inventory. They‚Äôve been serving the Vancouver public since 1985 and are currently located in Kitsilano.
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-7p.m.}
review_1_text: Instantly felt at home as soon as I walked in. So many old books to choose from. I took particular interest in the extremely old copies with yellowed pages, leather covers and slightly frayed edges but still in impeccable condition. The books are also very affordable and the owner is very nice. I'd definitely visit again.
review_2_text: Kestrel Books is easily my favourite place in the whole city of Vancouver. It‚Äôs a gem and an oasis in the city, a magical little corner where nothing changes except the books on the shelves. The gentleman who runs the bookstore is incredibly knowledgeable and friendly and can hold a conversation on any topic. The bookstore is designed such that you can easily linger and sit for long periods of time. Come here if you want to eliminate your stress for a bit.
review_3_text:
This is the best used bookshop in Vancouver! The owner is kind and offers fair rates for selling/trading used books. The shop itself is well-organized and straight forward to navigate with one giant fiction section. Other shops drive me crazy when I have to try to decide if the author I'm looking for is in general fiction or in the tacitly judgmental "genre" sections (is Wilkie Collins literary fiction or detective/mystery fiction? I don't want to have to look in two places. And don't even get me started on the "new releases" sections of some shops. It's not a Blockbuster video rental!).

What I'm trying to say is that this shop has nothing that annoys me about other shops and everything that I DO love about book shops. As a bonus, there are some reasonably priced, unique vintage gems tucked into the shelves, so it's like a little treasure hunt to go through and see what you find!
review_4_text: What a great little shop!  I've never found a place that had a better curated section of books on awakening/nonduality than this one.  There were some real gems that I haven't seen elsewhere; I was so happy that I stopped in.
review_5_text: Lovely second-hand bookshop with a good selection of newer fiction, at very reasonable prices, and some lovely old editions too!

name: Phoenix Books
full_address: 5928 Sherbrooke St W, Montreal, Quebec H4A 1X7
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12-6p.m., Thursday: 12-6p.m., Friday: 12-6p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: 1-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Cool little used bookstore on Sherbrooke  street. They have 1$ books outside and in the entrance. I picked up a couple and 2 more for the regular used prices. I was looking to find some Tom Clancy, Jack Higgins and Stephen king so I was not disappointed. Picked up a Dean Koontz book a couple days later. Great, fun store. Will definitely check it out again! :)
review_2_text: I love this bookstore. It has an amazing cool vibe in the city with an array of selections of genres. I bought two poetry books from the local author‚Äôs section. The owner is so nice and hospitable.  A must visit to find a treasure of books. Poetry section is excellent.
review_3_text: Awesome place, stellar staff, great Sci-fi section. I will definitely be spending a lot of time there.
review_4_text: Beautiful little book store, and great customer service, plus you can drop off some books to them too which I really liked.
review_5_text: Dropped in on a whim, and very much liked this cute little book shop. The owner Melanie was a delight to speak with, and the eclectic selection made for a lovely hour of browsing and a few bargain-priced purchases. We will go back!

name: Great Escape Book Store
description: A welcoming bookstore offering a wide selection of used books.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: My favourite used book store in the city! A visit is always a part of my Saturday routine. The selection is incredible and I‚Äôve found so many great books already for great prices. I‚Äôm so grateful to have this store in my community.
review_2_text: This bookstore is a dream!! It‚Äôs like a bookstore in a cozy mystery book! Great variety of books. This year I m gonna leave more space in my suitcase! Update: I bought more books and my little cute friend was there!!
review_3_text: Dropped into this store and was pleasantly surprised at the selection of kids books.  Picked up a number of graphic novels and early chapter books.  Good selection of adult literature as well.  The owner was also very friendly.  I‚Äôll be coming back.
review_4_text: It's one of my favorite place to visit on the weekend.  There are so many treasures to be found in this little store, and the gentle doggie store keeper is the best browsing companion!  The staff is always knowledgeable and helpful.  What a gem!
review_5_text: This is an amazing store! The son of the owner knew immediately where to find half a dozen books of different genres that I was looking for. The used books are in excellent condition and very well priced.  I will be shopping here for all my books.

name: E.C. Rare Books
description: EC Rare Books offers a variety of books and related services.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text: What a wonderful bookstore. My family and I did the afternoon book binding workshop and had a wonderful time. Richard Smart, the owner, leads the workshop and truly is knowledgeable about book binding and rare books. Stop by. Highly recommend.
review_2_text: I definitely wasn‚Äôt expecting to fall in love today! I stumbled upon this little gem as I wandered around. I didn‚Äôt see anyone at first so I may have delicately sniffed a book. When I did meet Richard, he was charming and delightful to talk to and I very much look forward to when I can attend the book workshop.
review_3_author: Naus√Øcaa From the Valley of the Wind
review_3_text: What a magical, creative space filled with beautiful books and  gifts. The Book Binding workshops are an unforgettable experience, one of a kind. üíô ‚ú®Ô∏è
review_4_text: Steph and Richard were amazing. They talked about their knowledge of coool books and the amazing history surrounding all of them. Would recommend this spot if you‚Äôre into history and a good conversation!!
review_5_text: An adorable book shop with a super passionate owner. Ask him to show you his most cherished book. I managed to grab a first edition book signed by the author!

name: Blind Forest Books & Novelties
description: Blind Forest is a family business offering books, tarot, astrology, and other magical finds. Located in Sackville's vibrant downtown, they cater to customers both locally and online.
working_hours: {Monday: 12-6p.m., Tuesday: 12-6p.m., Wednesday: 12-6p.m., Thursday: 12-6p.m., Friday: 12-6p.m., Saturday: 12-6p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Love this shop! I'm a couple hours away but make a point to stop in when traveling through to NS! Friendly owner, always willing to set something aside, amazing selection! Love the whole atmosphere
review_2_text:
I love browsing the aisles here,  they‚Äôre full of great reads! I don‚Äôt go in as often as I‚Äôd like to as I know I‚Äôll leave with more books than my wallet would like.
Miriam‚Äôs tarot reading was the absolute highlight of winter last year- I wholeheartedly recommend one to anyone needing a little boost in their day.
review_3_text: Loved going to this bookstore when I use to live in Sackville, it was at another location on York St back then. Miriam is a wonderful person and always made me feel welcomed
review_4_text: Went in looking for novelties unfortunately there was maybe one small table with items other than books. If you are looking for books there was a huge selection just wasn't what I was looking for.
review_5_text: Magical little family-owned business that has an incredible selection of used books of all genres and offers mind-blowingly helpful tarot and astrology readings. Worth the drive to Sackville for a visit!

name: Lu et relu
description: The Association des Auteurs des Laurentides represents over 100 authors from the Laurentian region, working in various literary fields. They also welcome friends of literature and corporate/institutional members who support the literary life in the region.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: A little gold mine for finding a cheap book. The lady was very nice. THANKS!
review_2_text: I love this used book store which is managed by the Laurentides Authors Association. Not only do I bring books to donate, but I buy them!  If you visit St-Sauveur, bring your books and... buy some! You will make discoveries there.
review_3_text: Nice selection, saleswoman a little too much in our bubble but the important thing is to find what we are looking for
review_4_text: This place is great ü§© Low prices, lots of choice and plenty of advice from the volunteer booksellers üí°üíú
review_5_text: Discovered this place with used books section for all subjects. For a minimal cost, you have a book that someone has read before.  The profits go to the Laurentides Authors Association. There is also another section for Quebec authors.  To discover for those who like reading and the resource people know their books.

name: Carson Books & Records
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-10p.m., Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11a.m.-10p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-10p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-10p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-10p.m., Sunday: 12-10p.m.}
review_1_text: I love this store. It is very unassuming from the outside but it holds a trove of goodies. I primarily read SF and the section is not large but it is well curated and I often find things here that I never see at larger, more picked over book stores. I almost always leave with a good score. Plus the staff are always kind and welcoming.
review_2_text: Carson Books is probably my fave used book store in Vancouver, and in my opinion is one of the best in this city. Somehow, they almost always have something that I am looking for! I've found myself almost making a weekly "pilgrimage" to this store (because they seem to have a fairly rapid turn over, you snooze, you lose there!) Huge props to the staff: Tim (owner) and Al, are very knowledgable and great to talk to. One thing I really like about this store is the late night hours, it's become a bit of a fun routine for me to stop by this store after work and grocery shopping on Main, chat to Al, and purchase a Wheel of Time volume with a specific Darrel K Sweet cover, or a vintage Ian Fleming James Bond novel. Carson books has a super selection across all genres in decent condition at mostly reasonable prices, with new titles appearing constantly. Most highly recommended.
review_3_text: Extremely messy, even for a used book store. Shelves are not labeled well and books are overpriced. Would advise against going out of your way to visit this store. Staff seemed friendly though.
review_4_text: Great selection of titles and really good prices. With a sale, I got 3 books for $25! ü§ç
review_5_text: Such a hidden gem, on main road, public transit stops nearby and such a warm place for readers. The owner is such a lovely person, the pricing is good, the collection is good, give it a try.

name: Ed's Books & More
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: This has been a favorite spot of mine for years. I live away in Halifax but had a wedding in Sydney so i knew my boyfriend and we had to stop in. Ed is an absolute sweetheart and very knowledgeable! Always cherish the great chat and hanging out with the cute kitties. It is now my boyfriends favorite spot! Great selection of books and at great prices, he always gives a good deal. Highly recommend!
review_2_text: When you think of a used bookstore, it's Ed's that you're thinking about. It is a labyrinth of fabulous books. Take your time and you will find a gem. The two-store cats are absolutely precious. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable.
review_3_text:
Great place to go book hunting, wish there was some kind of alphabetical order or something but still can't complain.
I don't think there's an another place around town with such cheap prices.

Definitely check upstairs too.
review_4_text: Nice selection of books! With 2 beautiful cats in the store ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: Best bookstore I've ever visited ! Be prepared to be greeted by two cute cats. There is a LOT of books, even some in french. Ed is super nice and the book prices are beyond reasonable. I highly recommend going there if you're passing by Sydney !

name: Alfsen House Books
full_address: 154 Main Street Markham N, Markham, ON L3P 1Y3
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30a.m.-4:30p.m., Wednesday: 11:30a.m.-4:30p.m., Thursday: 11:30a.m.-4:30p.m., Friday: 11:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Such a gem. I love this bookstore. Not enough bookstores like this around. A HUGE variety of gently used books. The owner is a lovely man he spent time showing us some of his amazing paintings. Go in and check them out and grab a few books!
review_2_text: A truly unique lost-in-time experience. Well worth a visit to this vintage, used book store where you‚Äôll very likely find that book you‚Äôre looking for in a tightly packed but well organized store. Talk to Adam Alfsen about his biblical paintings and you‚Äôll come out a little better educated on the celestial connections!! This store is worthy of being supported and preserved as a heritage feature by the City of Markham!
review_3_text:
Go there and find a book that makes you laugh or cry, teaches you a little better about the world, and perhaps yourself.
I had a great time chatting with the owner, Mr. Adam Alfen, and reading his book 'Lost Prophets of the Agora.' It really got me thinking!
As far as I know, this is the sole authentic English bookstore in Markham, apart from possibly the only two Chinese books there authored by myself, which I earnestly requested Mr. Alfen to include in his collection.
review_4_text:
Feb2025: This is a hidden gem of a used bookstore, which I recommend, if you're into vintage books.

Alfsen reminds me of the long gone used book stores that populated Queen St W and Yonge St decades ago.

Much of the inventory is from the 2000s and alot of the paperbacks are from the '70s to the '90s. They do stock more current books as well, including some YA genre fiction.

The books are well priced with many notably less expensive than BMV stores in Toronto.
review_5_text:
the loveliest bookstore owned by the loveliest man !

this store is full of beautiful classics in editions i doubt you could find elsewhere, and even then, definitely not for as low a price. i love the feeling of finding little pieces of newspaper clippings and notes written by the last owner. they make every visit of mine a wonderful and exciting experience.

during my last visit, i spoke with Adam Alfsen and learned that his parents had originally owned the bookstore and were both incredibly talented artists like himself. the family's artworks are displayed throughout the interior. it gives me such a newfound appreciation for the already warm atmosphere.

i was gifted a book written by Alfsen himself, titled Lost Prophets of the Agora (on Plato & Scripture), and although it's not my usual reading, it was undoubtedly a very thorough and thought-provoking one.

i have found some books from here that i will treasure forever. i truly find it to be such a privilege to have such a bookstore so accessible to me. thank you, adam !

name: Fernlea Ivix Non Profit Used Books
working_hours: {Monday: 2-5p.m., Tuesday: 2-5p.m., Wednesday: 2-5p.m., Thursday: 2-5p.m., Friday: 2-5p.m., Saturday: 2-5p.m., Sunday: 2-5p.m.}
review_1_text: This is a wonderful used bookstore! Great selection, relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff. Definitely worth checking out
review_2_text: Very welcoming place. Good atmosphere and just a relaxing place to be! Will be going again, especially with their many options of books!
review_3_text: Amazing place ! I highly suggest readers of all genres to go there !  I found first edition Stephen king books 10 & 8$ !  There selection of all different titles and genres is out of this world!  I found my new book store ! Plus they‚Äôre non profit !  I can‚Äôt wait to go back !
review_4_text: Excellent selection of used books, reasonably priced. We were given fair credit on the books we brought in, and found five 'new' books to grace our shelves. Very helpful and friendly service. Open 2 to 5, seven days a week.
review_5_text: What a great idea. They turned an old motel into a used book store where you can sit and read or discuss local events with other traders with a common interest! Or you can browse their collection of used books and maybe buy a book you've wanted to read and buy it at a really reasonable price! I understand that proceeds go to  aid victim's of natural disaster! I love this place, and I'd encourage everyone to check it out!!!

name: Atelier-Librairie Le Livre voyageur
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: The profession of bookseller is a fabulous profession, which involves passion, communication as well as a good dose of general knowledge. I found this at the traveler's book, books of all colors and models always in our beautiful French language! The service was courteous with great availability from the bookseller.
review_2_text: Great discovery during a recent visit to Montreal. Good selection of paperback books from the Folio/Folio Classic series at good prices; as well as an extensive collection of books on philosophy. It's difficult to find French novels in Toronto, so I'll make sure to frequent this charming bookstore during my next visits and stock up on books.
review_3_text:
Brunosphere = Bibliosphere (relaxingly modified version)

On YouTube, I recently had the privilege of discovering a remarkable channel. Led by an individual whose sense of sharing and love for books command respect, it constitutes an undeniable source of intellectual enrichment.

Indeed, his dedication to the transmission of knowledge and his contagious passion for books make him a true beacon in the contemporary digital landscape, often characterized by superficiality and futility.

I strongly invite you to explore this channel and succumb, in your turn, to the erudition and contagious enthusiasm of this great man.

Ahmed
review_4_text: The neighborhood has just gained one of the best booksellers in the city! Formerly located on Swail Street (corner C√¥te-des-neige, not far from the University of Montreal), this bookstore has just moved to this location. Soon, this place will be a beautiful bookstore where you can find quality second-hand books, coupled with a unique meeting space.
review_5_text:
From an atypical encounter on Youtube, a visceral passion emanates from the bookstore Le Livre voyageur where everything seems to be one with timeless writing. On his wise advice, a double encounter, that of Charles Juliet "Meetings With Bram Van Velde". THANKS
Auvergne
Greeting

name: The Book Place
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: would be nice if they were open when they say they are, comming out from another town and finding it closed more then once when it states on the door it should be open. disappointing.
review_2_text: Great selection of older and newer books. Would be a great place to spend some time looking for older hard to come by books. Owner was super nice and very knowledgeable. Definitely would recommend if you are trying to find a good read.
review_3_text: Very nice little hidden gem downtown.
review_4_text: Stopped by with the intention of finding some new books, and The Book Place far exceeded all of my expectations. I selected 1 book from the front display, and within a few minutes I had 5 books hand-picked by the store owner (all of which were of interest to me and matched the "themes" of my initial selection). I will be back again once I've read this batch of books, and I would highly recommend visiting The Book Place before looking for reading material anywhere else.
review_5_text: Such a treasure trove of literature and composition of authors. Always find something that peaks one's interest. The owner is very cerebral and is walking wizard of words, a master of the written scrolls, a good guy you can count on.

name: Librairie Laforce
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text: My favorite book store in Quebec City!  Bernard is awesome!  I find so many wonderful and rare books there!
review_2_text: Great store, very friendly, great prices!
review_3_text:
Great selection of records! Picked up some nice progressive rock vinyls and some cool niche Beatles records too!
Very nice staff, would recommend anyone looking to buy some records and books in Quebec City!
review_4_text: Absolutly amazing store, great price, great stuff
review_5_text: Super !

name: The Smart Bookshop
full_address: 4430 W Saanich Rd #105, Victoria, BC V8Z 3E9
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: The staff are so nice and they have a great selection of well priced, great quality books
review_2_text:
Oh my...books and books and more books!!! The best staff, location, hours and selections to choose from...I could spend all day in there if it wasn't for Covid..

The staff are great, friendly and most of all a pleasure to speak with when you ask for their opinion. I know you can buy online used, but I prefer supporting my local community...you must swing by and check it out...I promise, you won't be disappointed!!!

Plus...now is the perfect time to sit back with a good book or books...what else can you do during a pandemic???
review_3_text: This is such a great shop for used books! The best in Victoria.  They always have a great selection and when you return a book you get a credit added to your account.  When you buy a book you get a discount on it from your credits.
review_4_text: Great selection and fair prices.
review_5_text: Lovely store with a great selection of books and very reasonable prices

name: Librairie St-Germain
full_address: 1085 Rue Des Cascades O, Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec J2S 4N9
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:30-5p.m., Wednesday: 12:30-5p.m., Thursday: 12:30-5p.m., Friday: 12:30-5p.m., Saturday: 12:30-5p.m., Sunday: 1:30-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Great store, with a fascinating collection and an interesting, well-informed owner who's happy to the books on offer. I found a rare/out of print book about travels in Egypt, just after I met the author in India.
review_2_text: WOW. Book nerds go here. You will find that thing. And many, many More.
review_3_text: One of the best bookstores in Quebec without the slightest hesitation. Steve St-Germain is a bookseller like few others remain: erudite, open-minded, he likes to talk with customers, take the time to know everyone's interests and help find what we are looking for. He always has rare, even unique, books in his possession, which he always sells at very good prices. I have known his bookstore for almost ten years and I continue to frequent it regularly. Discussions with the bookseller are always fascinating. A must-see place in Saint-Hyacinthe!
review_4_text: The bookseller will be able to serve you professionally with a courtesy that is becoming increasingly rare these days. Let it guide you in your choices, enriching conversations will eventually take place. In an era where the digitization of documents no longer provides the soul that a binding contains, the role of a bookseller is more than essential; it is vital. Thank you Mr. St-Germain.
review_5_text:
I didn't find what I wanted in reading mode, but I felt like I was in another dimension, another era, in a film...
Updated 2023, it's been a while since I let my feet drag my feet there or let my eyes run over the covers but it's really a maaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaingly-magnificent store! Don't go in with a specific idea, this is a place of discovery!

name: Renaissance Libraire L'√éle-Perrot
description: Renaissance is a non-profit organization that supports job integration through thrift stores and donation centers. They focus on responsible consumption, waste reduction and offer employment assistance and career opportunities.
full_address: 106 Bd Don-Quichotte Unit√© 6, L'√éle-Perrot, QC J7V 6L7
working_hours: {Monday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 8a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 8a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 8a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text: Amazing donation center, and all books in alphabetical order by author and genre!! Friendly helpful staff as well!! Thought it was only books but they take all donation items except furniture. Great place!!!
review_2_text: Always love to come here. The staff is always super friendly and the prices are very affordable. There are definitely hidden pearls here. Any bookworms, french or english, would love it. There is a wide selection of both official languages for anyone interested.
review_3_text: A nice used book store with a wide selection of books in both English and French at very reasonable prices.
review_4_text: Went to drop off some new and some gently used Utensils and bedsheets, comforters etc. Very polite staff, even came to help me unload from my car.
review_5_text: Great selection of books, movies and video games. I go weekly to see the new arrivals!

name: Ordi Livres Signes D'Espoir
description: Ordi-Livres recovers, recycles, and resells computers, books, vinyl records, CDs, and DVDs.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Great place! Thoughtfully organized and easy to browse. The English-language section on the second level has a wide-ranging and well curated selection that doesn‚Äôt feel as small or as random as the stock you see in other bookshops around town. They also have a really good selection of comics in English and graphic novels and manga in French. Everything is very thoughtfully organized.
review_2_text: Wide variety of books in French and English. Very well kept and friendly staff always ready to help. I‚Äôll come back again!
review_3_text: Great service and qualified technician. Did a great job and done before date originally given.
review_4_text: Great place to get uses records, books and computer gear at very affordable prices.
review_5_text: Best place for used books. Price are fair and Really go to charity

name: Centre du Livre Usag√©
description: La Porte Ouverte offers literacy, French language training, and popular education workshops to adults. They also operate a used bookstore, Le Centre du Livre Usag√©, to promote reading access.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12-5p.m., Wednesday: 12-5p.m., Thursday: 12-5p.m., Friday: 12-5p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I stumbled into the book sale this week and they are selling books for $5 for an entire bag. That is just an insanely good price and it supports a great mission so I love the place. The people working there would genuinely lovely too.
review_2_text: I must say, as a bookworm, this has been MY favorite bookstore since I discovered it, when we didn't have access to additional premises. Just browsing is a huge pleasure for reading lovers. The staff has never been rude. Parking is a little bumpy, but that's quickly forgotten when the door bell rings...
review_3_text: Lots of books of all kinds at a bargain price that serves a very good cause. Very happy to know about this place.
review_4_text: Great variety and prices are not too expensive.
review_5_text: Very pleasant, I found books that I had been looking for for a long time, The staff knows their books

name: By the Book
description: The Friends of the Ottawa Public Library Association (FOPLA) supports the Ottawa Public Library through fundraising and volunteer efforts. They host regular Mammoth Book Sales with gently used books, CDs, and DVDs, and provide funding for library programs and initiatives.
full_address: 363 Lorry Greenberg Dr, Ottawa, ON K1T 3P8
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-1p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-1p.m., Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: 10a.m.-1p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-1p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Best bargains on used books in the city!  Also a great place to drop off books when you‚Äôre done reading them.
review_2_text: Very nice couple and excellent assortment of books with great prices.. will be back..

name: The Skeleton Key Used Bookstore
full_address: 288 Korah Rd, Sault Ste. Marie, ON P6C 4H1
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: OMG if you haven't been here you need to go. If you love books at a great price it's a must
review_2_text: The Berrys are not good people. I regret the moment I met them
review_3_text: Found some great books ! Very outgoing and friendly environment.. we will be back when we are in town again .
review_4_text: This has to be my favourite used bookstore! Such a great atmosphere and layout, not to mention very organized. Stellar customer service. Tons of like new or gently used books for an amazing price, highly recommend checking it out! Oh and they have a bunch of antique‚Äôs hidden in the back of the store!!
review_5_text:
Went for the 2nd time yesterday; such a great find - $3 for most books & the selection is unreal! They also have a massive antiques section that‚Äôs possibly disappearing soon so go snag them quick!

A must go in SSM.

name: Bouquinerie Rock'n livre
full_address: 762 Rue Saint-Joseph E, Qu√©bec, QC G1K 3C3
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Excellent! Ordered CDs off Discogs from this shop. They were shipped quickly and came in perfect condition. Would happily drop by this store if I ever visit Quebec :)
review_2_text: The Bouquinerie is small, cramped and overstuffed. If there are three or four customers, you wouldn't be able to move around. I went on two occasions. The first time, I couldn't get past the door and left. The second time around I was able to get inside, a meter or so from the door, but couldn't get farther as three other customers were inside. I looked around -without moving from my spot- and left again, empty-handed and disappointed. It's a shame. It seems like a very cool place. A bit of decluttering, some creative organization or even a different layout could make a great difference.
review_3_text: Had a great experience ordering a couple of new records off of Discogs. Good communication, fast shipping, and impeccable packaging. Would definitely order from this shop again, either in person in Montreal (if Trump doesn't screw up relations even more), or through Discogs. Highly recommended!
review_4_text: Excellent customer service. got the Record through Discogs. Informed when product will ship. and packaging was great. Will be checking out more from here.
review_5_text: I ordered an LP, La Mort des √©toiles by Les s≈ìurs Boulay, online from this store. Patrice was very kind and helpful, and the album was in mint condition, still in its wrapping.

name: Librairie Saint-Jean-Baptiste
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:16-6:30p.m., Wednesday: 12:16-6:30p.m., Thursday: 12:16-6:30p.m., Friday: 12:16-7p.m., Saturday: 12:16-5:08p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: A charming library/ bar. Visited during the afternoon and it had a very peaceful and quiet atmosphere.
review_2_text: Amazing gem of a book shop with a coffee bar exuding immaculate intellectual vibes. Come in, get some coffee, read a book or two, chat with others, and feel right at home (even if I'm just a traveler passing by) ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_3_text: If you like books, tea, amazing rum, or inspiring/ invigorating conversations, do yourself a favour and go pay this gem of a place a visit. Everyone is a delight in there, I for one am so grateful for David, the owner for creating such a space. Though technically away from home, I felt right at home among the books and the lovely company at the bookstore. So much love!!!!! ‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüèº
review_4_text: David is a kind, welcoming, generous, well-read, and handsome soul. His establishment is a reflection of his personality and philosophy. Is he single?
review_5_text: Wow.. what a great spot!  Browse books with beer.  Loved the vibe!

name: Au Tourne-Livre
full_address: 43 Rue Wellington N, Sherbrooke, QC J1H 5A9
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Well curated book store with some CDs and lps. A very sweet, zen atmosphere. Kind owner. Worth checking out the bd section.
review_2_text: The owner is wonderful. Randomly walked in because there was a sweet book in the window. Lots of selection (alot in french to be honest) but all of them carefully chosen. Some used CDs and movies too. The owner learns your likes and dislikes and helps you find what you're looking for, but also keeps them in mind and keeps others aside for your possible next visits. He gives the same care to each customer and its always kind. This man has been this job for good while. And has learned how to make customers feel they are in an inviting library.
review_3_text: No card machine to pay
review_4_text: A great place to find high-quality used books and music at great prices! Pierre is attentive and helpful. Cash only.
review_5_text: It's a magical bookstore. I found the books I had been looking for for a long time. The person behind the counter looked like a wish-granting genie. Cash payment.

name: David Mason Books
description: David Mason Books offers a curated selection of books and catalogues. They also provide information on publications and the history of the bookstore.
full_address: 366 Adelaide St W Suite LL05, Toronto, ON M5V 1R7
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
David Mason Books is my favourite bookstore in Toronto. You‚Äôre always greeted with a smile by staff and by the cutest book store helper i‚Äôve ever met (Henry the cat).

Not only do they have unique and rare finds, the shop is so beautifully decorated and eclectic. It‚Äôs truly a beautiful space to be in. The staff (and Henry) are always ready to assist you in whatever you‚Äôre looking for, and make great suggestions when you are unsure. They‚Äôre patient, kind and show a genuine interest in what you‚Äôre looking for in books.

My boyfriend stopped by for the book sale yesterday and had an amazing experience, with friendly staff and ease while shopping. He was able to pick up some great finds and leave smiling. This is a common experience when we shop there, and why we are always drawn back.
review_2_text: Came here with my girlfriend last year during fall. We picked up a book each, one on neurology techniques from the 1900s and ‚ÄúThey Walk in Darkness‚Äù by Ellen C. Philtine from 1960s. While we both got overwhelmed by work, I recently got around to reading it and as my first ‚Äúreal‚Äù novel (excluding diary of a wimpy kid), it has genuinely caused a new passion for reading within myself. I didn‚Äôt know such a unique book existed and I would find it in a hidden gem such as this. The owners allowed us to roam and told us about the most important pieces of work they‚Äôve collected and guided us in finding the above mentioned books l, which turned out to be exactly as they predicted. Of course, Henry the handsome cat was also one of the main attractions. Will be coming here sometime this week with my friends, hopefully they can find something that piques their interest.
review_3_text:
I felt compelled to write a review as I noticed a 1 star review and couldn't disagree more. I needed some advice on appraising a book, sent an email and some photos and response time was 20 minutes.
Debra was extremely professional,  gave me sound advice, options and did this all at no charge. It's rare to find this quality of service for "free" . I would absolutely recommend David Mason Books. Forget believing 1 bad review and at least try. Thanks  Debra for a fantastic experience,  I will be coming back!
review_4_text: Wonderful bookstore in the heart of Toronto. Awesome staff who‚Äôre very helpful and kind. Great place if you‚Äôre looking for older books. My favorite part: Henry the four-legged bookstore manager
review_5_text:
Awesome place. Lots of rare finds and very friendly staff. In particular, you must meet Henry - the resident cat.

I picked up a unique find here - tempted to get others but... ran out before I got more :)

name: Brown & Dickson Bookstore
description: Brown and Dickson Bookstore is a brick-and-mortar and mobile secondhand bookshop offering a curated selection of diversions for book lovers. They specialize in uncommon and fascinating books worthy of a collection.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Very helpful staff, wonderful selection of reloved books, cool location shared space with vintage furniture and clothes.  Great spot to spend some time in a cozy nook while browsing your selections.
review_2_text: What a great selection of books and vintage! I left the place with two books and a plant, but I was enchanted with everything.
review_3_text: Would not really describe as a bookstore. Yes it has books but most of the store is used furniture, clothes etc
review_4_text: Great secluded bookstore of modest size. Owner is very friendly and nice. This book store has lovely doggos too!
review_5_text: This store is a real treasure.  It has an amazing feeling, very intimate and cozy, but with an expansive book selection that feels huge!  The owners are helpful, interesting, and knowledgeable, and the store dogs are super cute!  Special events like concerts and poetry readings elevate the business and bring the London community together.  Highly recommended!

name: The Haunted Bookshop
description: Specialists in early works of weird, exotic & unusual books, plus fantasy, mystery, thrillers, poetry, antiquarian maps and more. Old and rare books bought, sold, and appraised.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text: Great bookstore, easy to get to and lots of variety. Military history section was decent with a large range of specifics and general study.
review_2_text: Scads of used books crowded into a musty space, arranged into topics such as mystery and WWI. If you're willing to hunt for treasure, you can peruse the shelves, as well as the stacks on the floor. Knowledgeable, helpful staff.
review_3_text: Great little bookstore with very knowledgeable owner.  Many antique books and rare finds.  He showed us a book from the 1500‚Äôs!  Don‚Äôt miss this little treasure.
review_4_text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è A Treasure Trove for Book Lovers!

The Haunted Bookshop in Sidney, BC, is an absolute gem! Located at 9807 Third St, this quaint and charming shop is a book lover‚Äôs dream come true. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted by the cozy atmosphere and shelves brimming with fascinating books. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate, always willing to help you find that particular title or offer recommendations.

Whether searching for rare finds, literary classics, or something spooky to match the store's name, you'll feel a sense of wonder browsing through their curated collection. The Haunted Bookshop is more than just a store‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience that transports you into the enchanting world of literature.

I highly recommend you stop by if you're in Sidney! It‚Äôs the perfect spot for anyone who appreciates the charm and nostalgia of a well-loved bookstore.
review_5_text: Excellent selection of used books. Can easily spend hours there exploring. I always leave with more books than intended and never disappointed.

name: Bouquinerie A Dede
description: Bookstore located in Gatineau, QC, Canada. Selling books since January 8, 2008. Offers a wide variety of curated collections and searchable catalogs.
full_address: 313 Rue Notre Dame, Gatineau, QC J8P 1L3
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Such an amazing place to buy good book ok there use book but in perfect condition and all French plus they are really cheap üòÅ I bought 4 books yesterday milenium and 3 Stephen king books 5$ each
review_2_text: Nice book store with lots of selection at decent prices
review_3_text: We found 4 great old books on Catholism.
review_4_text: Always a pleasure to explore a variety of quality items with dedicated professionals.
review_5_text: Very good service. The bookstore is magnificent and the prices of the books are affordable.

name: Baker's Books
description: Baker's Books is a locally owned and operated used bookstore in Hope, British Columbia. They offer a large variety of books, with thousands priced at $2 each. Books are donation-based, ensuring low prices and a commitment to keeping books in circulation.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Any time I am in a new place, I immediately hunt down the local used book store. It is an obsession, an addiction‚ÄîI crave the intoxicating scent of old books. I love to meander through aisles of books stacked high and find unique treasures. Baker‚Äôs does not disappoint! This is one of the coolest bookstores I have ever visited and I audibly GASPED when I realized almost every book in the store was $2. This is a magical place for book lovers and you‚Äôll get lost in the joy of the hunt. Please do not sleep on Baker‚Äôs and make sure you reserve at least an hour on your visit to Hope (or on your stop over on your road trip) to appreciate and support this truly special local business.
review_2_text:
Best book store ever. Lots of selection, great prices, chairs where you can sit and read.

The real magic is the staff. I came on a day where I was too sick to go on a hike with my family, and not only were there spots to sit and read - the lady running the shop made me tea with honey.

Absolute peak bookstore experience. Wish I could give the store 6 stars. Thanks, Kammie, for making the holidays special.
review_3_text: came into the store passing through town. the store has a large non-fiction selection and is organized well. i found some classic fiction pocket books for 2$ - can't beat that. there's also an impressive selection of beautiful rare books.
review_4_text: Found a whole bunch of Sweet Valley High books here. I went in with hope and left a happy girl. The condition of these vintage books are as good as new. Priced at $2/book, IT‚ÄôS INSANE!!!
review_5_text: I could have spent hours here. The store was very laid back, welcoming and theres a small play chest in the back to entertain small kids while parents browse. We picked up a few books and a sticker and loved our visit

name: Westgate Books Inc
description: Westgate Books is a bookstore under new ownership as of May 2024, with a rebrand coming soon. They offer a diverse selection including Indigenous focused books, vintage children's books, and general fiction.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-4:30p.m.}
review_1_text:
A few things that would have made my experience better that I'd like to leave as a few thoughts.

1. Sadly, pet allergies are becoming a serious issue. We carry an epi-pen thankfully wherever we go. Unfortunately we did not ever consider a public store would have a cat wondering about considering the severity of some people's allergies. To my surprise... there was one in the store wondering about.

When it comes to allergies, cleanliness, etc... for most people this makes the space warm and inviting, for others, it can mean an unexpected trip to the ER.

I feel in this case a noticeable warning sign on the door could prevent this in the future.

2. The pricing for used books was just a bit too high. For those who buy new, definitely this is cheaper. For those who get their books from places like Value Village, this is more more expensive overall.
