3. The navigation of the store is quite difficult. So if there are specific books you are looking for, they are quite hard to find.

Overall, if the navigation would have been easier, prices about 25% less or better and no kitty, I would have likely spent around $200 in books in my shop in this store as I'm presenting building quite a library. It was just too many things working against me during my shop.

That all being said, it makes me very happy to see book stores still open.
review_2_text: Love this bookstore. Always leave with something for myself. Tons of kids books too! Staff seems to know where every book in the store is somehow! Call and ask if they have it or get them to hold it if the title comes in!
review_3_text: Best bookstore in Saskatoon! Selection was incredible, and the prices were great. Staff was friendly, personable, and knowledgeable. 5 Starts all around!
review_4_text: Went here for the first time with my kids today and we had a great time. The kids loved picking out books, and there is a great variety of all kinds of books. Will for sure be returning!
review_5_text:
amazing new owners. really kind and considerate.

they have a really cute kitten named crackers. you should go see him, he really cute, really good boy

name: Ted's Paperback
description: Ted‚Äôs Paperback and Comics is a spacious used bookstore offering over 200,000 books and 100,000 comics, CDs, DVDs, and LPs at bargain prices. They have a wide variety of genres including fiction, non-fiction, and comic books.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I love this book store. Super friendly service and they always have what I am looking for. 10/10 would recommend.
review_2_text: Really nice bookstore. The staff were very friendly. It was really well organized. I found what I needed very quick, especially due to the nice directions provided by the lady at the till. The parking was very easy at the street. The place was very simple to find. The prices were very good and the quality of books was great. I would definitely come back here and I feel making the trip to the location from Penticton was definitely worth it. Thank you so much!
review_3_text: Awesome store!  They are so helpful!  I could spend hours wandering through their really well thought out sections.
review_4_text: Best used book store in downtown. All well priced , lots  of other language books, comics, religion antique and historical
review_5_text: This is the best book store I've ever been in. It has an enormous selection of every author/genre you're looking. Lots of comics as well.

name: Bridgeburg Books and Games
description: Family-run bookstore in Fort Erie operating for over thirty years. They offer a vast selection of used, rare, and out-of-print books, with a focus on science fiction, fantasy, and a growing stock of records, media, and role-playing games.
full_address: 16 Jarvis St, Fort Erie, ON L2A 2S1
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Super disappointing experience here. After digging around in this store for literally hours -- which was fun, there are tens of thousands of books here -- I brought a stack of books I'd found around the store to the checkout, only for the owner (I assume) to re-evaluate and re-price the books by searching online listings while I was standing there.

This is a pretty lazy and greedy business practice. First off, he referred to listings on Abebooks that were still for sale, meaning these weren't prices that the book had SOLD for -- they were prices that sellers were listing them at, and these prices are often very inflated. These are prices that people AREN'T paying (considering they are all still for sale).

Also, he made no effort to offer me a fair price. I would think that considering the fact that I was there, in the store, ready to make a purchase, the least he could do is offer me a realistic price, especially considering he didn't even know these books were down there and they probably would have collected dust for another couple years. I am not an online customer somewhere across the world. I dug through the store and found the books, only to be told "Unless you want to give me 1000 bucks..."

Anyway, I don't expect this to be an issue for the average customer, but this is not a store where it's worth digging around. You will be gouged for anything remotely cool that is found. The owner's vibe was overall standoffish and not super welcoming. A waste of an afternoon spent here.
review_2_text: Great store!! Love the vibe and all the treasures. Fun hunting and finding some great reads.
review_3_text:
A gem that needs to be visited. A variety of books, grab a couple of books from the author Ken Follett. Morgan is always keeping me in mind and helping me complete my hardy boys' collection.
Thank you for always helping out. See you soon.
review_4_text: I could spend days in this store without being bored. There is so much to see here! So many topics to explore! Thanks for having such a wonderful store!
review_5_text: This place is heaven for book lovers, whatever you want to find or whatever you are looking for this place has. I found an older book on Scottish  poetry and i am loving it! Will be going back, the experience was wonderful!!!

name: Les Tr√©sors du Futur inc.
description: Used bookstore with two locations in Saint-Hyacinthe and Beloeil. They frequently post updates on new arrivals and special offers on their Facebook pages.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Excellent store! A bookworm‚Äôs heaven. The way the place is packed with books every nook and cranny gives a warm feeling as soon as you enter the store. The person in the store is very sweet as well!
review_2_text: Great place to find another gem! Does have a nice variety in English. I enjoy the fact that I can find almost any study book.
review_3_text: I came to exchange books with Fr√©d√©ric. I found what I was looking for and so did he. I will go back
review_4_text: Even though it's far from home, when I'm in the area I force myself to go there! In fact, it's not an obligation but a personal reward to go there and find some good-value reading material to accompany me in metro-work-sleep mode! The owner of the store is very friendly and good company. Thank you!
review_5_text:
Customer service from the employees is A1. On the other hand, I cannot say the same about the owner who was totally disinterested in his customers. Coming to sell books which, according to employees, were in demand, the owner did not deign to provide any help or customer service for the sale.

The sale supposedly takes place on Thursday mornings, no notification in this regard is made. Therefore, there is a strong risk that customers will travel for nothing.

name: Schooner Books Ltd.
description: Schooner Books offers a selection of vintage photographs, historic documents, and rare books. They have featured items and regularly add to their collection.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Excellent prices for an exceptionally wide variety of books. A must visit of a trip to Halifax. You can spend hours in here and you are sure to find something to take home.
review_2_text: Today I received an item I ordered from Schooner Books. The packaging and the labelling  was excellent. The item I bought is very old and they made sure it was securely packaged. It was a real pleasure dealing with Schooner Books. They were friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this book store. I would without hesitation order from them again. I thank the staff  for making this transaction so easy and pleasurable.
review_3_text: Recently purchased a rare book online Schooner Books. Price was extremely fair, shipping was fast and packaged with care. So very pleased with my experience and thrilled with my new treasure!
review_4_text: I recently picked up a couple books from Schooner Books and I was happy that I decided to visit. While a small location, Schooner's space has been well optimized to fit plenty of books from a plethora of subjects without looking cluttered or making your feel cramped in a small space. The section I was looking into most was philosophy and, while not exhaustive, was extensive enough that I found two titles that I have been looking for. I will be visiting Schooner again!
review_5_text: This has been my go to store ever since I started collecting books, I've dealt with book stores all across North America, and this one is my absolute favorite. Their knowledgeable, they're just a call away if I got a book question, their selection is excellent, and their prices are fair! I highly recommend!

name: Rivendell Books
description: Rivendell Books is Barrie's premier used bookstore, offering a wide selection of fiction, non-fiction, young adult, and children's books for the whole family. They also offer a rare and specialized antiquarian collection available both online and in-store. Now offering online shopping with in-store pickup or shipping options!
full_address: 165 Wellington St W, Barrie, ON L4N 1L1
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: The best bookstore in Barrie!!! Ample variety of books that are always in fabulous condition. Staff are always friendly and helpful. The shop is tidy and well organized.  I placed an online order for the first time out of curiosity and it was ready for pick up within 5 minutes! Nothing beats an afternoon browsing in shop, but if you are in a hurry, I highly recommend ordering via website. This place is certainly a staple to the community, keep up the great work!!
review_2_text: Love at first sight! As soon as I walked into the bookstore I immediately became a fan, the amount of books but also the type of books that they have. Caters to so many audiences! And the owner and her daughter are awesome, they have great taste in music too!
review_3_text: Cute shop. Lot of options, some books a little too expensive for being used books. If I lived in the area I would keep checking in to see what other stuff comes through.
review_4_text: Excellent used bookstore! Fair prices, decent stock. The piece de resistance, in my opinion, is their website!
review_5_text: Good selection of diverse books. Clean and I love that they have their catalog online so I can search and budget if they have what I am looking for.

name: Re: Reading Used Books
description: Used book oasis in the heart of Greektown on Danforth with over 40,000 titles in Fiction and Non-Fiction. They offer a wide variety of genres and are a community favourite, even recognized by Guillermo del Toro!
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text: Re: Reading Books is a hidden gem for book lovers! It offers an impressive selection of used books at great prices, all within a beautifully decorated and charming space. The cozy, vintage atmosphere makes browsing a delight, and you‚Äôll often stumble upon rare or out-of-print titles that are hard to find elsewhere. Whether you‚Äôre a casual reader or a serious collector, this place has something special for you. A must-visit spot for anyone who loves the magic of books and the charm of a well-curated bookstore.
review_2_text: Nice used books/video store with a great interior! Lots of complete TV series DVD and Blu-rays too.
review_3_text: We drove an hour 45 to check it out because THE Guillermo del Toro recently cited it as one of his favourite spots to get lost in when he shoots in Toronto. It‚Äôs unapologetically eclectic with a room dedicated to sci-fi just past the shelves with the classics. We lost time in the store for about 90 minutes, standing in the tight aisles and searching shelves for things we didn‚Äôt know we needed. I brought home two late 1960s Canadian classics by Margaret Laurence that I vaguely remember from years much later than that. I didn‚Äôt know I needed them until I started to dig in. You might find something or nothing. But that something might be a piece of yourself. You will have fun if you let yourself
review_4_text: Great spot to explore unique and used books. I went for the used DVDs and was not dissapinted. Left with 5 titles, one being a 24-season series. Super pleased. There is something to explore in every nook and cranny.
review_5_text:
I don't typically post reviews for non food places but this bookstore is a treasure. It's full of wonder and throwbacks for different generations. The setups are well done and I felt I could spend hours here browsing through the great collection of books.

There is a dvd collection area here too which would definitely pique the interest of those born in the 80s, 90s and 2000s. Give this place a try and bring your kids along!

name: Librairie D'occasion
description: A used bookstore offering a variety of books and games.  Orders must be picked up in store; no shipping is available.
full_address: 586 Av. du Phare E, Matane, QC G4W 1B1
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Beautiful bookstore with a wide selection of books at very affordable prices. I found two books from my childhood! A nice selection of games too, as well as baby accessories. Friendly employee who took the time to tell us about different products. A must-see!
review_2_text: Very good place to buy books, board games or even baby accessories. The employees are great and know their products well. I recommend!
review_3_text: Very good service. The saleswoman has excellent knowledge of board games and others and advises us very well.
review_4_text: I LOVE this shop! Used books, new books, board games and puzzles for adults and children, several types of toys, lots of baby essentials and even a little snack corner! Also, the service is still on the mark. Please go there in large numbers.
review_5_text: At first glance, this store seems ordinary, but when you enter it, it contains beautiful treasures. A small, well-stocked store selling games, baby accessories, and used books. The owner is truly charming, making you want to buy games and invite her to a party to play them. The table with a 20% discount is full of lovely surprises. Good selection, reasonable prices (we compared with other stores). For gift suggestions and a change from video games, ask the owner... You can even make special orders if you can't find the game you're looking for. If I lived in the area, I would probably be at this store regularly.

name: Globosapiens Used Bookstore
description: GloboSapiens is a bookstore that allows you to read, trade, and sell books. They are currently accepting books but request only one bag or box per visit. They are prioritizing a safe environment and ask patrons to practice hygiene and stay home if sick. They operate on a cash-only basis.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:30a.m.-7:30p.m., Wednesday: 10:30a.m.-7:30p.m., Thursday: 10:30a.m.-7:30p.m., Friday: 10:30a.m.-7:30p.m., Saturday: 10:30a.m.-7:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Serendipitous discovery while walking around, waiting for my windshield replacement. The lady working the desk was so charming and fun.

Soul-southing, spirit-lifting community engagement.

My first used book store. Wow, the things that have been discovered within them. The books, that is!

A pleasant run-in with a former coworker.

A nice discussion about 70‚Äôs rock, stemming from a man‚Äôs Marshall Tucker Band hat I was admiring. He travelled all over the southern US to see them various times, and highly recommends Savannah, Georgia as a travel destination.

An enthusiastic book recommendation from one of the store‚Äôs regulars; 1 of 5 books she‚Äôs ever kept in her possession permanently: ‚ÄôNumbered Account‚Äô by Christopher Reich.
review_2_text: Great source for books at a reasonable price. Highly recommend them
review_3_text: So warmhearted lady ownerÔºåwho can speak Norwegian as well. Recommended some books I may be interested and gave advices to me for my improvement of EAL. Absolutely I will be back againÔºÅIt is one fantastic used bookstore and the only one in the west of Winnipeg right nowÔºÅ
review_4_text:
This is exactly what I was looking for in a used bookstore.

Excellent prices, countless genres to look through, and Cathy (the Store Owner) makes you feel welcome as soon as you enter.

I cannot wait to come back and browse again!
review_5_text:
In August, 2020x I emailed several second hand bookshops looking for a particular. I didn‚Äôt hear back from most of them and gave up as a lost cause.

Well this March, the owner, Cathy called me to tel me that book had come in. Apparently she is very passionate about finding books for people. She has everything entered on this incredible document and remembers when people are looking for books, so can pull up their info when/if she comes across it. Just incredible service. Would give 10 stars if I could!

name: KW Bookstore
full_address: 308 King St W, Kitchener, ON N2G 1B7
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Great place to buy a book! They almost always have what I am looking for (or more!), and great prices. The owner is a true pleasure to visit.
review_2_text: This bookstore has such a wide variety of books with great prices! The staff are really welcoming and helpful!
review_3_text: Huge selection of books (and movies!) at very reasonable prices. Very friendly staff too.
review_4_text: Beautiful store, paradise for a book lover! So much selection! They are both newer used and older used books. You could spend a whole day there seeing everything they have. It‚Äôs nicely organized so you can find what you‚Äôre looking for easily. They also have a discount selection that‚Äôs budget friendly. Definitely recommend anyone going who loves books or who wants to shop for someone who loves books.
review_5_text: One of my favorite stores in town. The owner Scott is very nice and helpful. The store is clean and well organized. They also purchase used books at a reasonable rate!

name: Encore Books & Records
description: Encore Books & Records is a community book and record shop located in the heart of NDG, Montreal, established in 2004. They offer a wide selection of new arrivals and also have a print and design studio producing high-quality fine art reproductions.
full_address: 5670 Sherbrooke St W, Montreal, Quebec H4A 1W7
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-7p.m.}
review_1_text:
As an avid reader, this is my favourite bookstore in Montreal. The place has a really cozy atmosphere, with books literally from the floor to the ceiling I can (and often do) spend an hour or two just pouring over their incredible selection of books.

I mainly read non-fiction, and they have a great selection with a lot of turnover, so there‚Äôs always a reason to drop by and check out any ‚Äúnew‚Äù books.

The prices are very reasonable, with most books I‚Äôve looked at hovering between 7-9$. Very rarely do I see books go over that, and they can go lower  depending on the quality of the book.
review_2_text: Obsessed with this place. This amazing haul was literally less than $45‚Ä¶.
review_3_text: Great selection of books, Vinyl Records, CDs, DVDs and games! However, the price for goods (selling to them) is significantly lower than competitors (ex: 2$ for video games) üéºüìÄüé∂üíøüéµ
review_4_text:
This is the best secondhand bookstore I‚Äôve ever been to in Montreal

Organization, Friendly Staff, Variety, Quality of books, everything is top notch

And it‚Äôs also quite coincidental that they have all but the first book of the traitor son cycle, (which I picked up from another bookstore). Great prices too
review_5_text: It‚Äôs a good place to sell used books a dollar per book which is fine. My real gripe with the place was slow service which could have been forgiven if they took used library books which was most of my collection. I got these from Vanier college which they tend to give out old books every semester and it was a shame I couldn‚Äôt give them a second home.

name: √âcolivres
description: √âcolivres is a bookstore and social organization that offers affordable books, supports local communities, and provides employment opportunities. They accept book donations and redistribute them to organizations and individuals in need. They also have a '3rd chance' store for items that cannot be sold in their regular bookstore. They strive for an inclusive and welcoming environment focused on sustainable consumption of cultural products.
full_address: 38 Rue Charles-A.- Cadieux Suite 130, L√©vis, QC G6V 7Z6
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 9a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
A hidden treasure full of rare finds.  Books, CDs, Vinyls, comics, video games.  Beautiful socially responsible business model that gives to the community.  Caroline is doing a fantastic job taking an already amazing concept to a whole new level.
Definitely worth a visit.
review_2_text: Bon choix de livres usager √† bon prix. Good choices of used books at fair prices. More choices of French books but have a good variety of English books too.
review_3_text: Good place for used books
review_4_text: üìñ
review_5_text: Good place for book lovers, vinyl DVDs and collectors. Possibility of finding works that will immerse you in the past and make you relive your memories. Price ok also ideal for finding a DVD for you little ones.

name: The Bookery
description: The Bookery is a quaint shop with over 20,000 used books, Celtic jewellery, trinkets, and metaphysical wares. They buy and sell used contemporary, scarce, antiquarian, and collectible books and have been trading since August 2000. They are known for being knowledgeable, fair, and honest.
full_address: 191 St Andrew St W, Fergus, ON N1M 1N6
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
Very clean and organized used bookstore, that is quite deceptive - it's much bigger than it looks!  Just keeps rambling on.  Prices are quite reasonable.  As an aside, the bookshelves are unique in my experience.  They don't have solid backs, but rather netting or chickenwire that help allow light into the store's various nooks and crannies.

It's also more than just a bookstore - various interesting knickknacks and geegaws are also for sale at the front of the store.
review_2_text: What a great shop! There is a great selection of used books. More than meets the eye! Plus a great selection of crystals, incense, and other interesting items.
review_3_text: It's a wonderful little shop. Lots of mindful items and plenty of interesting books. There is a young lady there who does Tarot readings. She is very warm, friendly, and very accurate with her readings. All the staff was wonderful. It's located right in downtown Fergus. It also has a wonderful feel to it and scent to it. Something for everyone here.
review_4_text:
This is my absolute favourite used book store. They have old books, rare books, and just normal used books. They also have gifts,  decor, celtic items, and Outlander stuff.

Every time I go I find something I didn‚Äôt even realize I was looking for, and I always leave wishing I had bought that one item I put back. They also do psychic readings on occasion. I haven‚Äôt been there for that recently, but I have gone for a reading in the past and it was very accurate.
review_5_text:
The Coolest book store ever !!!
You don‚Äôt even need to like books, still you will love this shop !

name: Acadia Art & Rare Books - Est 1931
description: Acadia Books offers a diverse selection of books, art, prints, and ephemera. They also host Toronto Book Auctions and feature art by Rochelle.
full_address: 232 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M5A 1S3
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-3p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I visited this establishment out of curiosity and was thoroughly impressed. I found myself enamored with the ambiance and charm of the place. The owners and employees were exceptionally kind, contributing to a welcoming atmosphere. The vintage elements of the venue were particularly appealing, and I am certain I will return in the future. Additionally, the cats are absolutely adorable!
review_2_text: such a cute bookstore! the staff were friendly (and so were the cats)! they have a pretty sizeable collection of both books and art prints
review_3_text: The cat Pippin stole my heart. He was sleeping peacefully. The place smells like the old pages of a book that went through decades and that's what gave charm to the place. There are a lot of art books to choose from and also some rare finds. They sell artwork prints, and some aged small pocket books. This is a lovely place.
review_4_text: This bookstore is absolutely lovely. Full of all kinds books and treasures as well as various art pieces. The downstairs part of the store is more organized. The upstairs is slightly more clutter but there is a certain something about it that makes it comforting and nice nonetheless. A certain vibe for lack of a better word. The owner of the bookstore is very sweet and really cares about getting to know each and every person who walks through the door
review_5_text:
The bookstore is so cool if you‚Äôre looking from some vintage books, posters, magazines and cards !!
And obviously, THE CAT is the main character of this bookshop, so cute and really friendly

name: Word (The)
description: The Word Bookstore is a quality secondhand bookstore established in 1975. They offer a wide variety of first-edition, antiquarian, and collectible books, and also buy secondhand books. They rent books for film set decor and offer appraisal services.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Cute antique vibes second hand bookstore. Owner only accepts cash. Near McGill. Has some 1$ books. Got 3 sociology, philosophy and literature books for only 35$ ;)) quite a good deal.
review_2_text: Stupendous collection of clean, curated titles. Interesting vibe with rare titles, science, mystery and genre, poetry, fiction, and history, among others. Quality number of titles packed into an iconic space. Cash only. Cool neighborhood.
review_3_text: It's always an adventure to come here and I always leave with exciting and unexpected treasures of books at very reasonable prices. They're cash-only but that's not a bad thing because it forces me to budget. I always leave with more than I intended.
review_4_text: In the city for a respite visit from the States, I was welcomed warmly by staff and customers alike, all book people happily perusing options.  I left with French paperbacks to feed my soul and a First Nations picture book for my grandkids.  No problem paying with American dollars.  What a treasure you have Montr√©al!
review_5_text:
Second-hand books specializing in literature, philosophy, and poetry. This place is an absolute gem. The vibe is just so warm and cozy. The staff is super friendly as well. It's definitely my go-to local bookstore for amazing finds!
(Bonus they also have a section of 1$ books)

name: Book Addict
description: The Book Addict is a used and new bookstore located in beautiful downtown Guelph, Ontario. We specialize in a wide variety of genres, from fiction and mystery to sci-fi and history. We also offer gift items and puzzles!
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Great selection. Love that you can contact them via email to set books aside. Found what I was looking for and some!
review_2_text:
A fantastic used bookstore, absolutely packed full with a wide array of genres. Walking into the book addict is like walking back in time, aisles stacked high with classics and smells that distinct book smell. I saw stories I haven't seen in 25 year years and read as a child. I walked away wondering when I can come back again and browse, as there's so many books to buy.

I left having spent $30 on 4 novels, all relatively newer releases and was delighted with the woman running the counter, she was polite and friendly.

I'll be back again, and again. Happy to have found a  gem in the city.
review_3_text: Book Addict is always a pleasure to visit. They have a large selection of books in great condition, as well as very helpful, pleasant, and efficient staff!
review_4_text:
Located in a busy plaza parking lot the store is convenient.  I called before going asking for a specific group of books.  I was told that they had 2 out of the 3 books.  I went to try store and the woman working was extremely helpful and nice.  The store was like any other used book store which is slightly disorganized.

I purchased my books later to learn one of the books was not in the set of books that I wanted.

Both books were a fair price and surely will not disappoint.

#localguides
review_5_text: Great selection of books but only downside is be warned, they don't take Mastercard, debit or credit card, they only take Visa

name: Readers' Choice
description: Readers Choice Books offers a wide variety of used books, including non-fiction, art, history, and more. They also carry toys, puzzles, and merchandise. Enjoy a "Buy One Get One Free" sale on all non-fiction used books from December 14th, 2024 to February 15th, 2025, with no tax! Explore their "Day Planner" page for local activities.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text:
2023 July 4‚òÖ
A very welcoming used bookstore, games, and toy store. With chess outside the store for you to sit and play.
Wander inside the tightly packed store and paying close attention to the variety of unique kids toys inside, you'll find something that will intrigue you.
A nice place to check out while in the area.
review_2_text: Oh my gosh, this place is HEAVEN for book lovers! The owner is fun, funny, and has an encyclopedic knowledge of everything in the store. Plus, there is LOTS of other fun stuff like puzzles, games, out-of-print tee-shirts, and much, much more, at very reasonable prices. You could easily spend the whole day there, getting lost in the book aisles. If you are expecting a Chapters type experience, don't bother going. This place is WAY BETTER than Chapters could ever hope to beüòÄüëç
review_3_text: A wonderful bookshop with great selection and friendly service in the heart of Orangeville. I never leave this place empty handed! Even purchased a gorgeous crochet blanket once years ago that I still use today. Highly recommend Reader‚Äôs Choice!
review_4_text: Cute little book store with a variety of items. They not only have books but also items such as clothing, puzzles, children's toys, gifts and more. Friendly service from the person at the desk. Would recommend to a book lover.
review_5_text: They have books and gifts; it's so fun to shop there!!

name: N2N Books
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-6:30p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: A fantastic gem for used books. Great prices and a variety of organized genres. The volunteers are very helpful.
review_2_text: Huge selection of books in great condition, mostly priced at $2 or less! The store is well-organized and labelled to make it as easy as possible for customers to find specific items or just browse. Best used bookstore, and it is totally volunteer run with all proceeds going to the Neighbour to Neighbour food bank. Check it out!
review_3_text: Well organized and great selection of books the day we visited.  Also puzzles, movies and CDs. Helpful staff.  Option to pay via cash or debit (think credit available too).  We were on a time limit due to an appointment or could have spent a lot more time browsing and spending.  Definitely plan to visit again.
review_4_text: This is an excellent used book store! I have purchased many books here and when I am finished reading then I return them to be resold! If you are a reader I highly recommend this book store
review_5_text: A wonderful little bookstore supporting a wonderful organization. Easily the best organized and best priced. They are also open until 6:30pm on Thursdays.

name: Loyalist City Coins & Books
description: This website provides access to account administration and webmail services. It appears to be related to a bookstore hosted on a server provided by Hetzner.
full_address: 14 Charlotte St, Saint John, NB E2L 2H4
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 12-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I could have spent the entire day and more  just looking through their books and then the comics and they had much more than literature. So many knickknacks and oddities and wonders. The owners were very friendly and their pets were perfect. Loved this store.
review_2_text: One of the coolest stores i‚Äôve been to. Lots more than just Coins & Books, they have comics, sports collectibles, records, Die-cast cars etc. really cool spot!
review_3_text: Great shop for more than coins and books. Collectibles, dvd's,  albums. New items put out every week. The owners are friendly and very knowledgeable.
review_4_text: Do not recommend going there. The store is amazing, they got lots of collectibles from comics to films to vinyl, all kinds of stuff. Owners are helpful, nice people. However, one day when I went there, an acquaintance of the owners thought I was "stealing" stuff just because of my race. This was a shock as a customer of this place, because I have been going there for months. Ridiculous experience, such a pity.
review_5_text: This is one of my favorite places of all time. It's a must visit for every collector. The store is really nice and other than that they really have amazing stuff in the store. I could spend weeks just to explore everything there! I love it.

name: The Edmonton Book Store
description: The Edmonton Book Store specializes in rare books about Western Canada, Arctic regions, philosophy and literature with over 80,000 volumes in store. They buy and sell quality second-hand and out-of-print books.
full_address: 10533 Whyte Ave NW, Edmonton, AB T6E 2A3
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: One of the best collections (if not THE best) of Canadian poetry and poetry in general I have encountered in my LIFE! Simon at the front was effusive and kind. They also have an extensive online catalogue that ships all over Canada. Indispensable. Essential. One-of-a-kind!
review_2_text: I really liked the atmosphere of this store. Walking between the shelves and looking through the books. It's like a trip back in time, lots of books from different years. I wonder what the oldest book they have?
review_3_text: This store is one of the, if not the, best used bookstore in the city of Edmonton and surrounding areas. The store itself is a maze of amazing books around every twist and turn, there are two floors (the basement being much smaller but just as packed full with books. You can find all sorts of rare, interesting, and unique books in this store. I went in for a quick browse and I ended up spending over an hour just browsing before I even began thinking about narrowing down my choices to buy something! I ended up walking out with a book, and as I was checking out I got to chatting with the store worker. According to him, within the store there are over 90,000 books! I believe it but my gosh you could be in this store all day and never read the same title twice. Definitely a great place to check out if you are looking for your next "new to you" book! This store is an amazing addition to the city of Edmonton, and I hope it remains one for years to come.
review_4_text:
Great place.
I am new to Canada and the book keeper is so nice.  He is very kind and helping and caring.
We go there every weekend. My husband loves books.
It's a very nice cozy book store, with a great book collection, unique nice book.  Better than any other book stores I have seen so far.
My favorite ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text:
I could literally spend all day here. This is maybe my favourite store in Edmonton - the kind of bookstore that is relatively hard to come by nowadays, that both specialized in rare and antique books while also having a large selection of classics & nonfiction. The owner is lovely and if you come in on a quiet day he's usually happy to chat with you. Prices are also exceptionally reasonable, especially for the non-book merchandise. You can get genuine 19th century steel-engraving prints for under $20, and even the genuine antique books are very fairly priced according to age, condition and rarity. Also, on the off-chance that someone reading this happens to be a fanatic for Polar Exploration History like me l, there's a HUGE Polar Studies section with everything from Franklin to Cook, including very pretty old editions of some of the expedition memoirs.

Really though, half the time I come here I don't even buy anything. The atmosphere is so wonderful here and there's so much to look at that I can happily make an afternoon of just poking around. Think Pratchett's L-space. If you're a book lover or a lover of history, you owe it to yourself to pop in here next time you're on Whyte

name: The Bookcase Co
description: The Bookcase Co is a friendly used bookstore with great selection and prices. They also offer store credit for book donations.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-2p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 1-4p.m.}
review_1_text: Great prices. Friendly staff at the desk. Hidden gems aplenty!
review_2_text: This place is an oasis in a sea of technology and the digital age. I‚Äôve come across some amazing finds here. Really a great place for any of your literary needs.
review_3_text: Wonderful little bookshop with a great selection and prices. Most books I saw range between $7-$12 If they're not in the discard areas which at usually around $2 each or free. Wonderful place to visit to browse.
review_4_text: Robin is just lovely, had such good laughs and talks with her :)
review_5_text:
Great service! The owner delivered a book that I was looking for ,from her own home shelves to my apartment door.
I found her to provide the best service I have ever had from any store ever!
Impeccable service!
Thank you, wish you the best !
Will always trade with you for all my literary needs. John K. Bless your heart.

name: ALLISON THE BOOKMAN
description: Allison's the Bookman is a bookstore offering new and used books with daily discounts for seniors, military, and Chamber of Commerce members. They offer delivery with orders over $25, and accept book trade-ins for credit or donation. They also support Canadian businesses through LibroFM.
full_address: 342 Main St E, North Bay, ON P1B 1B4
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: I have enjoyed visiting Allison The Bookman since I was a kid - I remember my Mom taking me to get a new Archie comic book or 2 every Sunday back then - When I get a chance now to go, it brings me back to a favorite memory - You could spend hours browsing through the store - and you will always find something new. The creeky floors and smell of books is comforting.  We are so fortunate to have this little gem in North Bay üôÇ
review_2_text: Came in from out of town for the first time and absolutely loved the collection of books they had!!
review_3_text: I really enjoy a good novel, and for 50 years, I have been getting my books at the Allison the Book Store and to the awesome staff I say thanks
review_4_text: Store is much larger than it appears.  Great, easy to find selection.  Friendly helpful staff. I can't say enough positive things because this page wont allow it.  I'm not one for reading, but I'm about to own a collection of books simply because of their welcoming environment(and it's one of the dew place that allows my dog in the store)
review_5_text: THE place to get books! I've been buying books here since I was a kid,  and I hope I get to keep buying books here for a long time.

name: A Good Read
description: A Good Read bookstore is supported by the Canadian government's Support for Booksellers Programme. They offer a wide selection of books, including new arrivals in fiction, philosophy, and comics.
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-8p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-8p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-8p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-8p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-8p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-7p.m.}
review_1_text: Love this book shop. They have tons of recents and good sale / clearance collection. Friendly and locally run. Well organized.
review_2_text: Awesome book store! Friendly staff who gave me dog a treat. Lots of great books at low prices. Found quite a few business and biography books here.
review_3_text:
This place used to be great. Now they have a sign in the window complaining about the federal government.

I spent three hundred dollars on books here today and asked to buy a bag. After paying, I reached to grab one of the paper bags that were stacked right beside the register. When I did, the gen z purity policewoman behind the counter snapped at me, "don't reach behind the cash register!"

Yeah man, I don't think the federal government is the problem. Your service staff sucks and I couldn't even get an itemized receipt.

Also, before I even said hello to the staff, they were loudly complaining about how intolerable the owner is when he's attempting to quit smoking. How nice...
review_4_text:
Love strolling into this great bookstore! Owner is super friendly and always has treats available for my pup.

Also a plus that they‚Äôre open later than most shops.
review_5_text: This bookstore has a very interesting selection of books, the politics section is awesome, with subcategories from global politics to indigenous politics to city and environmental politics. (There's even a section on sex work politics). Going there always allows me to discover new books to add on my to read list. One of the best bookstores in the city for sure!

name: Big John‚Äôs Books
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
I don't go there often but when I do I'm always in awe of just how many amaizing books there are!
Big John's books is organized better than most used book stores and usually he knows what books he has and doesn't have.
I highly recommend visiting big johns books if you haven't and your in the area!
review_2_text: This treasury of used books is an irresistible stop for me when I'm in Lethbridge. It houses an enormous stock on 2 levels with a helpful manager available to assist. An easy stroll from Park Place Mall.
review_3_text: Big John's always has the best selection for gently used books. His prices are very reasonable, the store is clean and well maintained (there may be piles of books in places lol), and he recently opened up the basement to double his square footage for even more books. John is very knowledgeable and helpful and always greets you with a smile as well. We love going there to spend time in the stacks!!!
review_4_text: Man this place was fun. Books are everywhere! Great selection for great prices. Always support local bookstores over Indigo!
review_5_text: A lovely used book shop! Loads of selection and well organized.

name: Librairie La Feuille Enchantee
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
A place with lots of things to look at and buy at a very affordable price.
The service is close and impeccable!!

The best incense sellers in victo!ü§ü
review_2_text:
Wow, great discovery.
It's worth the trip.
Thanks to Marie-France üòä
review_3_text: I have loved this store for years ü´∂
review_4_text: Simply the best store. ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text:
Beautiful place, the person who worked there was really nice and advised me while being super patient (god knows how long it takes with me xD)
A superb serious store, it deserves to be better known!

name: Elaine's Books
full_address: 208 Duckworth St, St. John's, NL A1C 1G5
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Got my mom a house trinket box from here! Great collection of books and bookworm‚Äôs dream. There are books of all kinds - this century‚Äôs and last‚Äôs. Elaine was very friendly and showed us an 18th century bible! Will visit again the next time I‚Äôm in St. Johns.
review_2_text: I came across this used bookstore recently while visiting St. John's. They have a good selection of books, including fiction, non-fiction, poetry, and other genres. I ended up buying three books by Newfoundland authors, as their section on local writers is quite good. If you are a book reader and are in St. John's, I would definitely recommend coming here.
review_3_text: A cute bookshop with a friendly and talkative owner. I'm always on the lookout for rarer books so it was fun looking through the collections. I didn't end up finding anything but this store does have a good selection of more niche books.
review_4_text:
The BEST bookstore for MILES!!!!! Great selection of books at fantastic prices! If you can‚Äôt find what you are looking for, just ask. She knows what‚Äôs in inventory and where it is!!
Thanks for expanding my library collection.
review_5_text: The store was awesome. Love the owner, she loves to chat and makes everyone welcome. We were visiting our home of Newfoundland after many years being away. She has a great system of keeping the books organized. Be prepared to receive a ruler. Yes a wooden ruler. Her method is spot on! A wonderful woman. When we return in a year, we will definitely drop by again. So many wonderful books all for extremely low prices.

name: Westcott Books
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-6:30p.m.}
review_1_text:
Tucked away in Montreal‚Äôs St-Hubert Plaza at 6792 Rue St-Hubert, Westcott Books is a delightful used bookstore run by the affable Terry Westcott. This cozy, somewhat cluttered shop is a haven for book lovers, boasting an impressive selection of French, English, and Spanish books at unbeatable prices. Having been in the business for over 35 years, Terry‚Äôs passion for books is evident in the carefully curated collection, ranging from vintage mysteries and historical fiction to rare art tomes and collector‚Äôs editions.

Walking into Westcott Books feels like stepping into a literary time capsule. Books spill over from shelves onto countertops, chairs, and even the floor, creating a charmingly chaotic atmosphere that invites exploration. I recently stumbled upon a well-loved copy of The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho, a personal favorite, which sparked a warm chat with Terry about the book‚Äôs themes of destiny‚Äîperfectly in line with the store‚Äôs serendipitous vibe. The selection is diverse, with gems in multiple languages, making it a unique spot in a city dominated by French and English-language books.

The store‚Äôs ambiance is enhanced by Terry‚Äôs welcoming demeanor. He‚Äôs always ready to offer recommendations or negotiate prices, ensuring you leave with both a great deal and a smile. Prices are a steal‚Äîmost books range from $5 to $15, ideal for budget-conscious readers. However, the shop is cash-only, so come prepared. The cramped space and limited hours (typically afternoons) might deter some, but they add to the old-school charm.

While the disorganized stacks can make browsing a treasure hunt, that‚Äôs part of the fun. If you‚Äôre seeking mainstream bestsellers or a spacious setting, you might look elsewhere, but for rare finds and a personal touch, Westcott Books is unmatched. It‚Äôs a must-visit for Montrealer's in La Petite-Patrie or anyone craving a literary adventure.
review_2_text: I visited here recently and was very excited to find some good non fiction books but got  really disappointed for not finding any in English. Hope they get some good English books pretty soon so I can visit again as its really close to my place and its much convenient to visit.
review_3_text: Amazing how many books they have!
review_4_text: It says here that they open on Saturdays 10‚ÄØa.m.‚Äì7‚ÄØp.m.. So I traveled across the city and went there on Sat. Mar. 22 at 11 a.m. The store was closed. I waited outside for about 30 minutes and called the listed phone number twice. No answer. So disappointed. :((
review_5_text:
I went for the first time today, and I suspect I‚Äôll be back‚Ä¶ weekly? You can find everything there. I found the screenplay of a Fish Called Wanda (1988), and the sequel to the Pulitzer Winning Less, published in 2022.

The owner is adorable and quirky.

Didn‚Äôt know places like this still existed!

name: Cote Gauche Book store
full_address: 33 Rue du March√©, Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, QC J6T 1P3
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:30-5:30p.m., Thursday: 12:30-5:30p.m., Friday: 12:30-5:30p.m., Saturday: 12:30-5:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Not only are the books great quality but the customer service is immaculate. I first went about a year ago with my father and ever since I‚Äôve been in love, anytime I‚Äôm looking for a little something to read in my free time I can always count on this shop to have something in a genre I like for a very low price. Like I mentioned I first went about a year ago, that day we were served by what I think it the owner and though we don‚Äôt know her name, my father and I like to call ‚Äòmadame sourire‚Äô because ever time we enter this shop we cannot come out without a smile on our face
review_2_text: Great service
review_3_text: The staff is super nice! Listening to your needs and super pleasant. In addition, I was looking for a French English dictionary for CEGEP and they offered it to me. They really are loves. They have a great variety of books too
review_4_text:
A welcoming place where you can find everything to read at a very good price.

A bookstore with the vast majority of used books but you can also get some new ones as well, to my knowledge.  The welcome is always friendly and warm.  We feel appreciated as a customer as soon as we set foot there.  A popular bookstore which brilliantly filled this literary gap that existed in our city.  A business that has its place and where dedication and passion are always omnipresent.  Going there means adopting it!  It is located at the corner of St-Thomas and Du March√© streets opposite the M√©tro grocery store. I add two photos of my own.  I highly recommend that you stop by.
review_5_text:
Contrary to the idea that I had had for a long time without even having set foot there.... üôà Shame on me, it's not in my nature to be judgmental. My 17-year-old son went there for the first time a few months ago and he only talks to me about this place. He's been going there at least once a week since he discovered the place. My brother went with her a few times and he recommended that I go there that it was a really good place and that I would probably like the place.... After hearing about it for months, several times per week..... On the way to an appointment with my son last week, we walked past. As he wanted to go there, I entered and as a matter of fact, I literally fell in love with this little store which contains a considerable quantity of little jewels for all tastes and all ages. Regardless of your literary preference, I am almost certain that the majority of people who love to read are sure to find a bit of happiness.  Just for information purposes, I went there for 3 days in a row... I highly recommend at least going to take a look. For my part, I will return there every time I need it if I have to buy a book. I will also go back every time I have the opportunity just to chat with the staff, great people. You feel at home as soon as you walk through the door. Bookstore with impeccable second-hand books at very low prices.

*I have a big crush on Claire (if I'm not mistaken, I have great difficulty remembering names) this lady is absolutely fascinating with an incomparable personality!!!!

name: Barely Bent Used Books
full_address: 46 King St E, Dundas, ON L9H 1B8
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Barely Bent Books in Dundas, Ontario, is a hidden gem for book lovers! With its cozy atmosphere and thoughtfully curated selection of gently used books, it‚Äôs the perfect spot to find your next great read.

The friendly, knowledgeable staff make every visit a delight, offering personalized recommendations and sharing their passion for stories.

The story truly goes above and beyond for it customers. I cannot think of another bookstore that will text you when that book or author you are looking for comes in stock!

Affordable prices add to its charm. Whether you‚Äôre a local or visiting Dundas, Barely Bent Books is a must-see for bibliophiles!
review_2_text: Lovely book shop with a lovely owner. Everything is fairly priced and she is extremely kind and helpful if you are looking for something specific.
review_3_text: Delightful hidden gem. The owner was very kind, and a pleasure to speak with. She made us feel welcome on our very first visit‚Ä¶ will definitely be back.
review_4_text: It was a pleasure meeting Chantal and exploring her book shop. Great selection! Will definitely be checking it out again.
review_5_text: Great assortment of books, a little something for everyone!

name: The Reading Room Bookstore
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I found some rare older novels I wasn't expecting to see. The owner is very knowledgeable and helpful. Highly recommended.
review_2_text: All the books are quite overwhelming but the owner is very helpful
review_3_text:
Extremely friendly and knowledgeable owner, large selection of books, and very, very reasonable prices. I got a vintage paperback of ‚ÄúThe Shining‚Äù for myself and a couple
of books for the kids.
It is such a pleasant place to spend some time when visiting the area on a colder day. Glad we stopped by!
review_4_text: Popped in one day for a few minutes  when I was visiting my brother in the area, I should have given myself way more time to explore this wonderful store. Next time I'm in town I have to return.
review_5_text: Love this book store!!!  I always get my books there.  Lots of books to choose from.  I must mention the service.  Very friendly and helpful service.  Debbie and the other lady working there always know what books I am interested in.  To me that's very personable and that is going that extra mile!  I walk in and I am directed to the authors I love and given suggested authors as well.  I will continue to purchase my books from The Reading Room as they always have what I am looking for and the service is impeccable!  Thanks Debbie :)

name: Page One Used Books
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I‚Äôve been an avid book collector for years, I‚Äôve seen stores all over the world and I can confidently say this is among the best I‚Äôve been to. The owner is a lovely guy who‚Äôs as helpful and welcoming as anyone I‚Äôve met and his selection is full of gems. The selection is stellar, as are the prices. Worth visiting the town just to go here, which I will be doing in the future.
review_2_text:
Wonderful little used bookstore!
I absolutely love the chaos of used books piled everywhere, it‚Äôs very cozy.
Richard is fantastic, very friendly and helpful. I had an author in mind and he did his best to pull up what he had and offered to keep an eye out for any others that came his way.
Couldn‚Äôt ask for more!
review_3_text: I loved it there! Very cozy store with a HUGE selection! friendly and considerate owner! I found some very interesting gems there and he even asked if he could keep an eye out for anything specific. Some prices are posted otherwise you can find the price written just inside the cover.
review_4_text: This is an amazing used book store. Huge selection and tons of amazing finds in here! We took an hour detour on our way home just to stop by here again! The owner is full of knowledge and advice!
review_5_text: The owner of this shop is a dedicated book lover. The amount of books he has in this place is incredible and somehow he seems to know what and where they all area. You are guaranteed to find something you like here, but I would suggest not going in looking for something specific, but instead letting something find you.

name: Salamander Books
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Fantastic little book store, the way a bookstore should be run. Not only can they order in whatever you're looking for (so long as it's available), they have plenty of gems stocked throughout. Very reasonable prices, often beating large chains like Chapters. Lovely people in a lovely town.
review_2_text: Great wee books shop with very knowledgeable  owner.
review_3_text: My first stop for used book hunting. A great new & used bookstore with a variety & large selection of used books at great prices, more in the back just ask the owner (who is very nice and a pleasure to chat with) and she will look them up for you.
review_4_text: Great book store
review_5_text: Great local bookstore with lots of new and used gems. Friendly, helpful staff too!

name: Ten Old Books
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-3p.m.}
review_1_text: A lovely local store with fun staff, great books, and other neat surprises! Worth a visit (or ten!)
review_2_text: Books are way too  expensive for a used vook store. There are many other stores like this in Duncan that have a better selection and at better prices.  The location is nice, but that is about it.
review_3_text: Awesome staff.  Really helpful.  Small but good selection.
review_4_text: My partner and I love this book shop. So well curated! We always find something good for ourselves or as gifts for others.
review_5_text: Claudia and Britanny at Ten Old Books were wonderful hosts for our Living Apart Together book sale and autograph session. The store is a delightful mix of rare old books, used, new and local interest books and treasures from everywhere!

name: Ctr Books
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
I adore my visits to CTR Books! I love that it's a small, locally owned business. The owner is lovely, and just so helpful. The books are reasonably priced. The store is cash only, so come prepared. There's a parking lot on site.

Whether you're looking for old favourites or new, this is the place to go. I've picked up books to pass on that I remember reading as a child, older books that were missing from my parents' collection, and newer books to add to mine. No matter what genre you read, it's there. There is just an amazing amount of books in the space, so if you feel a bit overwhelmed definitely head to the front desk and ask for help locating what you're looking for.

BONUS! There's traditionally a sale in February, I was very excited to see it was still being done this year. The prices are always reasonable, but the sale is extra incentive to stock up! If you want to take advantage of the sale, stop in no later than February 28th!
review_2_text: Unique and exciting titles (looking at political, historical, mulitary and sociological commentaries). Tons of other authors, fantasy, children's books, etc.
review_3_text: This is a really cute bookstore with a HUGE selection and GREAT prices. I love coming here and seeing what they have because you never know what hidden treasures you're going to get.
review_4_text: This is the type of used book store I love to visit and buy from. The owner is a reader herself, and she's nice to talk to. She has a hole in the wall that makes the shopping trip more fun in my opinion.
review_5_text: Tons of books and owner has very helpful recommendations. Very fair prices. Floor to ceiling books like from a movie. Check it out!!

name: Elizabeth's Books
working_hours: {Monday: 5-10p.m., Tuesday: 5-10p.m., Wednesday: 5-10p.m., Thursday: 5-10p.m., Friday: 5-10p.m., Saturday: 5-10p.m., Sunday: 5-10p.m.}
review_1_text: As an American visitor to your wonderful city, I found a kindred spirit in Chris. He is not only an excellent ambassador for your town, he‚Äôs also an exceptionally knowledgeable and friendly bookseller.
review_2_text: I go here every time I'm in Lunenburg.   It is a great store.  The best part is that it opens late, sometime after supper and it usually stays open until at least 10 (and often quite a bit later).  In a town where most shops close early, it is nice to have something to do later on.  Chris (the owner) is full of interesting stories.
review_3_text: Great selection of books for a small town. The owner is super friendly and has a ton of good stories to tell about sailing that he has done, ships and other cool facts. Open later than other stores, so this is a great spot to stop after sunset.
review_4_text: Honestly this place is great for the vintage book collector. I myself am not one to read very much but the beautiful story behind this shop and its wonderful proprietor is enough to put it on you list for your next visit. I found many old woodworking and repair guides that you just can't get in conventional book stores. Store hours are from 3pm to 10pm and are by far the best in town. You could definitely walk away from this place with new reading material the won't break the bank!
review_5_text: Chris is the nicest books store owner I have ever met! He shared stories about the store, his adventures on the sea and more! His book store has so many amazing books and the atmosphere was amazing!

name: Librairie Historia Enr
full_address: 155 Rue Saint-Joseph E, Qu√©bec, QC G1K 3A8
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: What I liked best about the Historia is its authenticity. This is how a used bookstore should look, feel and smell. When I visited the store there were a couple of obviously local patrons. I was the only non-local customer but felt completely at ease and no one bother me while I browsed the bookshelves. The book selection is not only ample but varied. The focus is on history and the offer includes both vintage and contemporary stuff. If you are a history buff, look no further, this is the place.
review_2_text: Excellent find! Everything you've ever wanted in a book store complete with hard to find treasures. This is what a bookstore should feel like!
review_3_text:
Nice selection of books on the history of Quebec.
A major cleaning has been done since the last time I was there, we can move around the room much better.
review_4_text: Absolutely don't want to sell Assassin's Creed comics without selling a stack of game guides... Saying it's the same deal he has to sell everything with it.
review_5_text: There are books as far as the eye can see. So a huge choice. Also, he doesn't buy new books.

name: Second Story Books
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 9a.m.-4p.m.}
review_1_text: An oasis for book lovers. The selection is very well curated and there is a good selection for each genre.
review_2_text: We are on vacation and decided to stop in while we were passing through and we are so glad we did. The owner was absolutely lovely and super helpful and we found a gold mine of novels that can be pretty hard to find. We will definately be back.
review_3_text: A little gem that has been a fixture in the town of Rousseau for a long time. Packed to the ceiling with all kinds of gently used books. The owner is very friendly and helpful.
review_4_text:
Well stocked little second hand bookstore, that is quintessential to the small, picturesque town it serves. It is cozy and warm, like a library in a familiar home.
Must see! Very cute!
review_5_text: Great little store filled with the love of books. Great enough in fact, to make it into the Globe and Mail.....

name: Black Cat Books
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Every small town needs a used book store like this- the staff are extremely helpful and very knowledgeable. The store decorates the front window for the various holidays and always does a great job at it. This Holiday season they Advent book sets and my wife and I are loving it.
Thanks Black Cat Books for being awesome
review_2_text:
Thank you for the wonderful conversation about community connections and knowledge sharing! Your commitment to contributing to and creating community engagement in the way you do business is encouraging! I loved the idea of suggesting a second-hand book exchange among friends at gift-giving times where everyone gives a favorite book with notes and highlights inside explaining what parts they love and why they love it! I'll be incorporating this in my future traditions for sure!
Locally owned
Socially responsible
Engaging
Knowledgeable
Strong customer service
Inclusive
review_3_text: Very nice employee. Didn't mind me sitting right down in the middle of a pile of books and looking through the ones I had selected. Very helpful in finding particular authors and Very knowledgeable. Great experience.
review_4_text: Rarely open despite hours shown on the door. Quite messy in there and not a lot of recent or interesting books. A lot of potential but a lot of work is needed.
review_5_text: The overall selection is limited, but there is a strong regional history section. The proprietor is knowledgeable and friendly. Prices were reasonable.

name: Librairie Renaissance Notre-Dame-de-Gr√¢ce
description: Renaissance is a non-profit organization that supports job insertion programs through thrift stores, donation centers, and employment assistance services. They focus on responsible consumption and textile waste reduction. They also offer career opportunities and a podcast featuring inspiring stories from their community.
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 9a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Excellent thrift book store. It‚Äôs very proper and well managed. Books are mostly priced at $3.75 with some at $1.75. All the books are really good quality for the price. The ambience is quite nice too with the background music you just don‚Äôt wanna leave the place ;)
review_2_text: Its very big and has A LOT of clothes. It is second hand but everything is good quality. The only thing is that it is messy and hard to find your way around. I was able to find plenty board and card games that I like.
review_3_text: One of the best renaissance in the city! The prices are great (CDs, DVDs and Books ranging from 2$ -15$), amazing furniture pieces if you are lucky to be there are the right time and the staff is beyond sweet and kind! I go so often and I always leave with something!
review_4_text: Affordable bookstore. Well categorized . Don‚Äôt expect last editions of textbooks .almost before 2005.
review_5_text: They took all my daughters old things from her room.  Great.

name: Renaissance Librairie Beaumont
description: Renaissance is a non-profit organization that operates thrift stores and provides employment support services. Donations support their employment integration program. They also focus on textile waste reduction and feature stories from their community.
full_address: 1244 Beaumont Ave, Mount Royal, Quebec H3P 3E5
working_hours: {Monday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 8a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 8a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 8a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 8a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
Always amazing selection, great staff. If you're looking for rare books, music CDs, vinyls or movies, you will find something every time you go. The prices have fluctuated for video games tremendously, but with the quality of product there is to find, it's hard to imagine that they would've maintained the great deals they had when I first started visiting.

Please donate and visit this amazing place any time you're in the neighborhood.
review_2_text:
If you know me well, you‚Äôll know I‚Äôm a sucker for books and more so for books on sale and you know you‚Äôre helping out an NGO.
Most of the books you‚Äôll find here are $4.25 and they have a great selection of French and English books in all kinds of categories from photography to history to non fiction.
Great place to also get last minute gifts for your book loving friends.
review_3_text: The place is awesome!! It has an amazing selection of books, movies, CDs, etc. Unlike many bookstores that have stuff no one would ever want to get, this place is a treaaure trove of good stuff. This should be the standard all bookstores must follow.
review_4_text: Really great book selection, some toys and some different nick-knacks. Nice staff
review_5_text: I love it! It has a large selection of books, it is very organized, affordable, it has good music and customer service is great! I highly recommend this place!

name: Second Page Used Books
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I would give 0 stars if possible. Worst experience in a bookstore of my entire life. I saw the most beautiful book ends in the window 2 days ago and was waiting to go back to purchase them. I walked in excitedly with my father and approached the counter to ask the owner to look at them. As I walked up, the owner was shaking his arms at me and angrily said ‚Äúwhat??‚Äù Before I even said anything to him. The first words out of my mouth were ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Äù because I believed I must have offended him with my presence somehow. I asked to see the lovely book ends and he angrily said they are not for sale. He reached for them to show me and HE knocked over a pile of books in the process. Perhaps if behind the store wasn‚Äôt so chaotically disorganized and messy that wouldn‚Äôt have happened. He acted like it was my fault that he knocked over the books, and said ‚ÄúNow I‚Äôm even more upset that I have all these books to clean up‚Äù and huffed and glared at me. I don‚Äôt even touch the book ends as I am afraid to anger him further. I asked him if he remembers where he bought them from and he said shortly ‚Äústore closed down 10 years ago, can‚Äôt get them anymore‚Äù. He then proceeded to complain about his personal issues and that he shouldn‚Äôt even be there today because he is sick but needs to pay his rent‚Ä¶ which was not my fault as a customer. I was also looking for books as well but based on his treatment towards me I told my dad let‚Äôs just leave. Even though they weren‚Äôt for sale, I would have offered him more than his original purchase price for those book ends that he kept on a shelf collecting dust. Disappointed and offended to say the least.
review_2_text: This book store is a local treasure in the Comox Valley. Cozy, inviting and always a large selection of rotating preloved  books to discover. The owner has always been helpful and kind! I would definitely recommend a visit if your in down town Courtenay. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
review_3_text: This place is so cute! It has such a welcoming feeling to it as soon as you walk in. The owner is super friendly and his kitty cat Charlotte is so adorable. ü•∞ I recommend checking this place out!
review_4_text: Everything you could wish for from a second hand bookstore! A nice owner, a cute cat, a large selection that is clearly categorized by genre, and clear and fair pricing. A true gem on the Island
review_5_text: upholds all the best qualities of second hand book shops - a shopkeeper with fantastic taste, a book-shop cat (friendly, but, you know, hard at work running a book shop). Always a book that you didn't know you wanted but now seem to need... also a small section of miniature books (as book lovers love nothing more then a very small book).  Great sections on island history, fiction, science,  kids books and fantasy (likely great sections on other subjects, but these are where I look.

name: Cornucopia
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Must-visit while in Campbell River. Great selection of books and the owner is extremely kind.
review_2_text: Great selection, great prices, Johnathan is a treat. If you‚Äôre in Campbell and like books, it‚Äôs a must.
review_3_text: Come prepared to browse books for a long time - there are for sure some gems tucked away where you might least expect :) Super fun to dig here - and the guy who looks over the space just loves to share the good book vibe.
review_4_text: Johnny is an amazing owner of this small quaint vintage books and collectibles store!!! So well travelled and so much to learn from!  Love the antique tea cups and globes if you are looking to decorate your home with a little vintage touch!! For me, the globes make amazing travel themed decor!!
review_5_text: Thank you Johnathan ‚Ä¶lovley quaint bookstore always something new to look at and have a lively chat -a gem in Campbell River üòä

name: The Bookshelf
full_address: 620 Victoria Ave E, Thunder Bay, ON P7C 1A9
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-10p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-10p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-10p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-10p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-10p.m., Saturday: 12-10p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Great place! I only stopped in to check it out but they have a massive collection of books, games, and game accessories. Really cool place to meet with friends for tabletop adventures
review_2_text: Their staff are friendly, helpful, and committed to making sure the local gaming community has the support needed to keep playing. I messaged them around midnight about a few semi-rare Magic: The Gathering cards and was met with a legitimate response in mere minutes. They had everything ready for me shortly after they opened the following morning.
review_3_text: This place is a quiet and relaxing place to look for books. The staff is getting caring and polite and extremely helpful. It's great that they have so many different books that others don't want so other people have the chance to read them. The books are in good shape. You can donate any books you have and they treat them with respect. Any books they don't need they pass on to the friends of the library to sell. It's a great idea and a good place to go. They also sell games as well.
review_4_text:
My 1st time in the new location. Good job! Well organized but may I suggest some improvements to the lighting? A few corners were really dark and it was hard to see the titles.
Great selection though and the staff was very helpful.
review_5_text:
I've been a customer of The Bookshelf for nearly 30 years and I've never had a bad experience. The staff are always friendly and helpful, the store always organized, clean, and well stocked. As its almost entirely a used bookstore, you won't find new releases and best sellers are often in and out quickly. For classics, old favorites, and books that were hot just a few weeks ago; you can count on finding something great to read.

Books in lightly used condition are good for store credit (I think its still 25% cover price), and books purchased there are always returnable under the same conditions. Definitely the local Mecca for avid, spendthrifty readers.

name: Books Galore
description: Books Galore is a used bookstore in Coldbrook, Nova Scotia, offering a wide selection of well-organized books for all ages. They've been in business for 30 years and recently renovated to add more space. They offer store credit for used books.
full_address: 6637 Nova Scotia Trunk 1, Coldbrook, NS B4R 1B7
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Check this place out if you've got the chance. Great prices, very friendly and helpful staff; store is well kept and has a wide variety of books :) 10/10
review_2_text:
Steve the shopkeeper, was very resourceful.
The shoppe is very well organized and shopable ...
Soup to nuts,  thank you for the pleasant experience
review_3_text: Great place.  Well organized and very knowelagble.  If you are looking for a book, just ask them.
