review_4_text: Amazing hidden gem of a used book store. Was lost in there for a couple hours pining over the selection of books!
review_5_text: Books Galore has a great stock of genre fiction, and extremely fair prices. The staff is friendly and attentive, and one in particular -- a lady with glasses -- sticks out as an asset to the team, always there with a good recommendation. Highly recommended from me.

name: Blue Griffin Books
description: Blue Griffin Books offers rare, antiquarian, and used books for all ages, as well as puzzles and DVDs. They also feature work by local authors.
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: love this bookstore:) each time i go there i find a few great books! its hard to get through all the books but that makes it a treasure hunt:)
review_2_text: An amazing selection of books, fun to search for some gems. Staff is very friendly, I always forget to get his name.
review_3_text: I love books and this place has books. There are books everywhere. This is not the most organized store in the world but a joy to be in. If you are a book lover and love to look for books, this is the place for you. Jonathan somehow knows where each book is and he can help you but it's more fun to look. It's crowded and you need to be careful you don't knock a stack of books over but that makes it more fun. There is a trade-in policy so you can get discounts on books so take advantage of that. There's always parking available.
review_4_text:
Astonishing selection of books in every genre. Don't bother going unless you have the rest of the day free, you're going to need the time to browse through the collection.

Be prepared to be patient, the books are mostly organized alphabetically by genre but there is significant overflow stacked everywhere.

The person working that day was friendly, helpful, and extremely knowledgeable about the collection. If you have a specific author in mind, he'll help you find it.

An excellent place for someone who loves the smell and sense of books.
review_5_text: besides having an avalanche of books coming down upon me it was great!! could have spent the rest of my life in there. also not the greatest for the bank account. due to a great temptation for books. recommend 129%

name: The Bookstore
description: Durham‚Äôs coziest little haven for book lovers and curious souls! Offers books, crystals, tarot decks, and collectibles. A place to browse, chat, and discover something special.
full_address: 144 Garafraxa St S, Durham, ON N0G 1R0
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Fast shipping, arrived in great condition, would shop again in the future.
review_2_text: Such a cute bookstore with a wide range of books. The prices are really good and the lady who runs it is extremely nice and friendly.
review_3_text: Very disappointed drove 3 hours to get there and found a sign on the door, stating closed till further notice. A phone call made last week and no mention of being closed and also checked website.
review_4_text: Best book store! You can find great books here
review_5_text: Like shopping The Bookstore! Lots of selection, CDs, and video too. Worth the stop. üòä

name: SPCA Bookstore
description: The SPCA Swift Current operates a Used Bookstore as a fundraising arm, offering over 15,000 donated books. The organization provides humane care and shelter for animals in need and promotes animal welfare.
full_address: 37 1 Ave NE, Swift Current, SK S9H 2A9
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 1-3p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: 2024: We always make plans to come here when we are passing through Swift Current. Friendly volunteers, and a superb collection of books. I like buying extra items (homemade pet quilts etc) to support their cause. Always very clean and extremely well organized. I would donate and shop here more often but I live over 2000 miles away. Excellent job everyone!! I wish you continued success
review_2_text: Lovely little book store and been a few times staff always friendly and helpful
review_3_text: Amazing little bookstore! Huge selection of everything from classics to cookbooks, puzzles, a few handmade treasures, and best of all, all of their proceeds support the local animal shelter. A real gem in Swift Current!
review_4_text: Great place for books. Huge selection of books, fiction,  non fiction, super friendly people there and they support a great cause. 10 out of 10
review_5_text: The volunteers were friendly and helpful. The store has a great selection of books, many of them in new or almost new condition. The prices were fantastic; I will definitely be back!

name: The Owl Pen
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: The Owl Pen is such a cool little bookstore in Bracebridge. It‚Äôs packed with old books and has this cozy, kinda magical vibe. You could spend forever just browsing. The owner is super nice too. Honestly, it‚Äôs way more fun than scrolling online ‚Äî feels like a treasure hunt every time. Definitely worth checking out!
review_2_author: g r o a k y D o r /\/\ o u s e
review_2_text: It‚Äôs a cute book store.  Not a lot of records.  Also not at the price I want, however, the staff there are extremely nice and helpful.
review_3_text: This is a lovely book store with a huge selection of books. I was in search of some very specific titles from one author and was amazed they had all 5..I had traveled to other used books stores but could not find these five.The owner is a very friendly person and greets you with a smile. She knows her inventory and exact location of each book. Prices were in line with supply and demand and I thought were listed at a fair price. Will come back again !
review_4_text: Such a wonderful shop! Full of all kinds of books and a selection of vinyl as well. The shop owner let me noodle about on her husband's acoustic guitar for a song. Definitely a discovery of endless possibilities there!
review_5_text: I could have browsed in the store a lot longer...  the kids found some really interesting books and a game and we're very happy with their selections...  it's always wonderful to find a unique bookstore in The Villages and cities we visit!

name: Bouquinerie Nouvelle Chance
full_address: 1595 Chem. de la Canardi√®re, Qu√©bec, QC G1J 2C8
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: There are many devoted people at this place. It's a great organization.
review_2_text: Snob!
review_3_text: I have already visited quite a few used bookstores in town, and Nouvelle Chance is surely the best! Well laid out, the books are very well classified and, in most cases, in good condition. The prices are affordable and, what's more, it is a non-profit organization. I recommend it!
review_4_text: Great service, always friendly every time I go there. Very nice selection of vinyl and books.
review_5_text: Vast selection of inexpensive books. History, novels, religion, psychoanalysis, art, vinyl records, CDs, summer... All the more interesting since it is a non-profit organization.

name: Collection Normand Leduc
description: Collection Normand Leduc is a bookstore specializing in used books, rare books, and first editions. We offer a wide selection and a passion for literature.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12-5p.m., Friday: 12-5p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: If you're looking for a book, you might be able to find it here. The owner's brother probably had book-focused Diogenes syndrome. He accumulated over 40,000 books. After his death, the family sorted through and organized 25,000 books by theme, creating an unlikely library üëç. Card payment available.
review_2_text:
PATHETIC!!!!
Too bad this former teacher doesn't have the commercial flair!!!! And yes it is not given to everyone....following a promise to his nephew who stayed there to sell his brother's collection....an idea liquidate the collection at the highest price and renting the accommodation will certainly be more profitable than waiting for sales which will never arrive....In any case good luck...this will be my one and only visit thank you
review_3_text: Lots of rare and good condition books for those who have the patience and know how to look. By the way, this bookstore is not like the others, those who expect to see a cold trader who will try to empty your wallet can look elsewhere.
review_4_text: A gem! An impressive selection of books. The gentleman who runs it is full of humor and very welcoming. Thanks again!
review_5_text: An excellent selection of used books in very good condition and at a reasonable price.

name: Arbutus Quality Used Books
description: Arbutus Quality Used Books is Nanaimo‚Äôs longest-running used bookstore, offering a wide selection of affordable used books for over 30 years. They offer a diverse collection including fiction, non-fiction, vintage, comics, and more. Owner Neal Brown is known for his friendly service and extensive knowledge of his inventory.
working_hours: {Monday: 1-4p.m., Tuesday: 1-4p.m., Wednesday: 1-4p.m., Thursday: 1-4p.m., Friday: 1-4p.m., Saturday: 1-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Top shelf independent bookstore with a huge, constantly changing selection of books on every subject, for every taste, at great prices. There's no substitute for browsing in a brick and mortar bookstore. The owner is very amiable and helpful. Truly a Nanaimo gem, especially in this age of the big online realtors. Strongly deserving of local support
review_2_text: This is a small bookstore. The first time I went in, I was expecting to be in and out quickly. No way. The books have been very carefully selected for a particular kind of intellectual taste. It's the kind of place where you're bound to find that perfect book you'd never thought of reading or that one you always wanted to read but never got around to. In an age of mass book sales and on-line dealers, it's great to be able to still find this kind of store.
review_3_text:
absolute best book store in town!! amazing collection. and Neal, the owner, knows every book in there! do yourself a favour and spend some time searching for treasure here.
love it
review_4_text: The only place in Nanaimo you can get great used books for $1. So many books to pick through, and Neal's super friendly. Always a good visit.
review_5_text: Very diverse selection of books, including a lot of newer bestsellers for great prices. He also has some amazing kids books for super cheap. Definitely worth checking out.

name: Wee Book Inn
description: A fantastic used bookstore locally owned and operated with two locations in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada for 50 years.
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-9:30p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-9:30p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-9:30p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-9:30p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-9:30p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-9:30p.m., Sunday: 9a.m.-9:30p.m.}
review_1_text: I went there on a rainy evening so it was nice and quiet. Such a nice environment. I also got to donate two books and they gave me some store credit which was cool. A successful little book thrift. Great prices.
review_2_text: Wee Book Inn is a cozy book store with a decent selection of older/used books (plus a small selection of new books/magazines, DVDs, comic books, etc). It is open very late which is perfect for me and has never been too crowded when I went in. The only thing that bothers me is their "sci-fi/fantasy" section is very large (~30% of the store) and even though it is alphabetized by author it is still difficult to find books within this broad category.
review_3_text:
A nice addition to downtown, this used bookstore has many different genres from westerns, romance, and fiction, to manga, comic books, and graphic novels. I would definitely recommend this place if you are Downtown Edmonton and wanted somewhere to walk around and browse.

The prices are very affordable, and reasonable. On the one long wall, the shelves are designed so that you need to sift through the books to view all the titles, which is a bit of a poor design, but in the end works out as you end up reading a lot more titles that way because you can not skim the walls as quickly.

It was a very chill environment, and I ended up getting a book myself. The cat on their logo is the cutest thing I have seen today. Great used book store!
review_4_text: WBI can be extremely hit & miss regarding prices & credits & quality but I recently made a trade with a young employee by the name of Owen (Downtown) & he was very reasonable & a pleasure to deal with.
review_5_text: Decent sized bookstore, went to try and sell some books. Employee was nice, informed me that last call for buying books was 8pm but he had some time and went through the books we brought. Don't get much for selling books, $2/book..yikes

name: The Next Chapter
description: The Next Chapter is a bookstore offering a wide variety of genres including Fantasy, Romance, and Mystery. They host craft parties and events, including a Find Waldo passport registration. They have recently moved to a new location downtown.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
what a wonderfull little store, this hidden gem downtown is beautifull. has a wide range selection of books for all ages and genres. great prices as well.

def will be back
review_2_text: Love their new location. It's really easy to see where the different genres are. They are nice and separated.  Store was clean and staff is friendly but also leaves you alone to shop.
review_3_text: This is the cutest little book store we came in for their easter event the kids had a blast and I loved how they had so many books completely covered for their blind date with a book shelf. They had the cutest merchandise too!
review_4_text: Great bookstore and cafe good drinks,books and items for sale.
review_5_text:
Terrible terrible terrible.  I placed an order with them got a obligatory email response stating they got the order the payment cleared and thats where it sat for 10 days.
I reached out via FB as emails went unanswered.

On the tenth day they informed me their "was an inventory mistake" they went on to say they emailed but it probably went to junk mail and will refund me.

Im no noob I watch my junk mail in fact all folders there was no email sent.  There was no return to my account. At least not yet so they sat for near wo weeks knowing they had taken money under false pretenses and done nothing to remedy it.

AVG reports they are a scam website and fake online store.  Something I did not see until after Id approved the purchase
The ecommerce site they use is also not overly reputable.

I suspect its more likely they discovered the book was worth more than they had listed it for and will put it up for sale at a new improved rip off price.

Whatever the reasons do not trust this business with your money.   It does not take 10 days to see you made a "inventory" error  you do not need 10 days to start a refund nor do you only START the process until after the client reaches out to you.

name: The Bookseller
description: The Bookseller offers a select stock of approximately 38,000 used, rare, and out-of-print books. They specialize in 19th and 20th century first editions and collectible literature, as well as art, architecture, Biblical theology, and more.
full_address: GB, St. Entrance, 9562 Whyte Ave NW Building, 96, Edmonton, AB T6C 0Z8
street: GB, St. Entrance, 9562 Whyte Ave NW Building, 96
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Wednesday: 11:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Thursday: 11:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Friday: 11:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Saturday: 11:30a.m.-3:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Phenomenal used bookstore! Best selection of classics and philosophy I‚Äôve ever found. If I could give it more than 5 stars I would!! Plus the owner is the absolute sweetest + great prices. Only issue is the hours but it is definitely worth finding time to go.
review_2_text: Darrell (or Daryl?) knows his books and it shows!  Not only does he offer significant variety, he also has a very solid theological and biblical studies offering.  This is my go-to bookstore in Edmonton.
review_3_text: Lovely classic used bookstore‚Ä¶ excellent organization and very reasonable prices. The proprietor is also very knowledgeable and kind.
review_4_text: Absolutely wonderful store! So many great books at very reasonable prices. I didn't realize they closed so early today - I will make sure to come back closer to opening next time so I can fully peruse everything!
review_5_text: Stumbled across this while stopping for breakfast next door.  Nice location and a nice selection of old SciFi/Fantasy.  Not alphabetical and stacked two deep so be prepared to do a little work looking at the titles.  Only a half-dozen shelves though.  Lots of other topics and books to choose from, but not my area of interest.  Prices were reasonable for old paperbacks

name: Scheherazade Books & Music
description: Scheherazade Books & Music is a bookstore offering a selection of new arrivals in books and records (both used and new/sealed). They are currently updating their website and items listed may not always be in stock; contacting the store is recommended to confirm availability.
full_address: 97 Prince William St, Saint John, NB E2L 2B2
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: My favourite place to shop for books in Saint John. The shop is always so calm, the books are in great condition and affordable. Great to always see new arrivals too! And I love browsing the records and CDs ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_2_text:
Cute shop, well organized with some good selections. They have a banking system for used books. The owner is very strict on condition of books you bring - however, it‚Äôs nice to get a nice clean book so I won‚Äôt complain.
The books are a bit pricey but far from full price.
review_3_text: Neat little bookstore with a varied selection of used books. Very good prices. #ContestEntry
review_4_text: I visited Scheherazade earlier this month for the first time. They have an amazing collection of books in pristine condition.  The person who was working that day was amazing and helped me find a book I've been looking for, for years. Honestly, this is my favorite used bookstore. If you find yourself in the uptown area I highly suggest popping in and seeing what you can find.
review_5_text: Wonderful little store. I found some true gems in here. They have new and used books, everything in pristine condition and great prices.

name: The Sherwood Park Bookworm
description: The best used bookstore in town! Thousands of books in dozens of genres. Locally owned and operated for over 30 years. Offers free in-store pickup.
full_address: 120 Wye Rd #133, Sherwood Park, AB T8A 6P2
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Got lots of good books at great prices.
review_2_text: This is an adorable bookshop that I‚Äôm glad I was able to visit on the Canadian Indie Bookstore Passport weekend in 2024. While small, definitely packing variety and charm. The shopkeeper was kind and welcoming, and the selection of books was broad enough to make it worthy of a long perusal.
review_3_text:
Unfortunately they were not open (Feb21)
Sign says open and website too but doors locked. Standard mailbox greeting with no information on store hours.  Quite a few people left disappointed.  I'm surprised how many people were here for opening and stood until 1130 hoping for the best including me.
Too bad.
review_4_text: I absolutely loved this place! The staff were great and really helpful but not overwhelming! The space is small but tidy and well organized! They have a GREAT selection of women‚Äôs fic/romance which isn‚Äôt too common for used book stores. They had some great titles in unreal condition. Will 100% be visiting again!
review_5_text: I‚Äôve been here 5 times now and it‚Äôs always been a fantastic experience! I‚Äôve never left with less than 4 books and the owner and all of the workers are always friendly. Definitely a hidden gem!

name: Librairie L'Occasion
description: A bookstore offering quality used items at good prices. They specialize in novels, biographies, reference books, children's books, comic books, and books in English, as well as incense, salt lamps, pendulums, films, music and puzzles.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Super awesome owners. Known them for years. Have great choices in books and dvds. They also buy your old ones. A must go if your in the area!!!
review_2_text: Went out of my way to donate books instead of just dropping them off at Value Village. They wouldn't even take 10 seconds to look through them, they just categorically said no to everything.
review_3_text: Lot's of book in both french and english and amazing prices. You can return old books for a discount of future purchase. Id rather buy here than value village as its √† local business and better prices
review_4_text: Always a good experience when i go. Very friendly and willing to help. And when i couldn't find what i wanted, they suggested other authors in the same genre. And some of those books they had read.
review_5_text: Great used book store with DVDs and some vinyl as well. Mostly French but a decent english selection too. Worth a stop if you're in the area!

name: Bookmart
description: George Strange's Bookmart & Prairie Showcase has been in operation for over 40 years and is the largest used bookstore in southwestern Manitoba, with over 50,000 books.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: This place is amazing. You can donate your books and get in store credit. So that‚Äôs like a library but better I think everyone should come here.
review_2_text:
Update: This place is a giant treasure trove I could spend hours in. Tons of rare books, in hidden corners, and non-fiction galore.

***

Friendly and so many treasures. Really enjoyed the visit here.
review_3_text: This book store is AMAZING!!! We always look forward to coming into Brandon to browse the enormous selection of quality reads.
review_4_text:
Easily one of the best bookstores in the province. Just when you think you've seen it all, another nook of books opens up for you to explore.

A true gem right in the heart of Brandon.
review_5_text: One of my favorite places in Brandon. Place for anyone who loves books and likes to hunt for a treasure.

name: Legends Used Books
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I walked in this book store yesterday for some information. I said " Hi how are you? "He didn't acknowledge me. I asked him if the cupcake store beside him had closed for good. His answer was how the hell should I know.  Poor Attitude and not friendly at all. ZERO STARS
review_2_text: Came in to get some books for my family for Christmas. Legends has so many books from floor to ceiling. Dave helped me navigate the stacks and find something that fit the interests of each of my family members. Was great to support a local business.
review_3_text: Helpful and a fun browse always!
review_4_text:
Wonderful used book shop with classic overflowing shelves. They do not have a digital/searchable database of books so you have to rely on shelf reading.
Very limited selection of children's titles
review_5_text:
Lots of stock. I returned some books and picked up a few more reads. Helpful staff.
Your book credit only applies to 50% of the sticker price. That's the used book store model in Kamloops.

name: Cover To Cover Books Inc
description: Used bookstore with a wide selection of books.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Great prices & book selections! Has lots of k-cup coffees at good prices too. Friendly staff. Favourite book store around!
review_2_text: A lovely little spot with very friendly and knowledgeable staff, my only bone to pick would be the fact that the book I wanted to buy while being in excellent condition was priced $1 less than indigo and actually more expensive than their current sale price which I'm glad I checked, probably won't visit again as it was quite a drive from out of town to leave empty handed.
review_3_text: Wonderful bookstore! They have a lovely staff and owner. The books are fairly priced and you can get trade-in credits, which sweetens the deal. This is definitely a "happy place" location for me.
review_4_text: An absolute gem of a bookstore with a superb selection. I was able to find several extremely hard to find books here. The staff were very helpful and pleasant in making sure my order made it to me. Good bookstores like this one are rare.
review_5_text: I love going here! It's my local choice for all my book purchases.

name: Bison Books
description: Bison Books offers a curated collection of around 20,000 antiquarian and good used books, including first editions, fine bindings, and books on Indigenous studies, literature, art, and classics. They also buy books, offer appraisals, and provide mail order services.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I was looking for an old Inuit Carving book by George Swinton and found it at Bison. I live in Winnipeg and I was too busy to pick it up so I paid $10 and they delivered it the next day. Great Service! MM
review_2_text: Found this place by complete fluke, but was it ever a good find.  The place is a treasure trove of books with categories ranging from historical, non fiction, cookbooks and the eclectic.  The staff is wonderful and go the extra mile to help.  I very much appreciated the help they provided.   In general, come here and explore, you'll be glad you did.
review_3_text:
Great used book store, the fact that they specialize in first editions and other rare titles means that the rest of their stock is all good quality. I often find other used book stores have non-fiction sections filled with low quality books.

I only shopped for non-fiction and found everything on the shelf to be interesting, high quality titles. Prices on non-rare books were reasonable. This store also was much better organized than most used book stores.

Highly recommend.
review_4_text: A delightful little used bookstore. Could spend hours here!
review_5_text:
One of my longtime favourite local shops. It‚Äôs the dreamiest home for rare and used books. It‚Äôs filled my bookshelf with poetry, fiction and cookbooks by my favourite people. I always look forward to browsing this beautifully curated shop. The owner is the sweetest and so knowledgeable.
This place is definitely a gem of
Winnipeg!

name: ABC: Antiques, Books & Collectibles
description: ABC Antiques, Books and Collectibles is a small shop located in Tantallon, Nova Scotia, specializing in antique and vintage items, Nova Scotia and Atlantic Canadian books, and a variety of collectibles.
full_address: 12723 Peggys Cove Rd, Tantallon, NS B3Z 2N1
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12-4p.m., Friday: 12-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
Cool little spot! We got books, records and a cool little calendar.

There was lots to see and explore, and we enjoyed just taking our time and going through it all.

The only downside was that it was pretty tight quarters, and it is definitely not accessible to all.
review_2_text: Wonderfully organized and an amazing collection of local interest books modern and historic. Great visit on the way back from Peggy‚Äôs Cove.
review_3_text: Very well-curated collection with lots of local interest! A great place to find books that probably don't exist anywhere else.
review_4_text:
Not the friendliest shop owner I‚Äôve ever met. You‚Äôd think she‚Äôd be more welcoming or something given her line of work.
Cool selection of stuff. Decent pricing. No deals.
review_5_text:
Such a little gem of a store, there are so many interesting pieces and lots of books too. I bought some books, pottery & knick knacks.
The owners are lovely too. I would highly recommend stopping in here!

name: Selkirk Book Exchange
description: Selkirk Book Exchange offers a good selection of books at great prices with friendly service. It's a surprising and welcoming place to browse.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4:30p.m., Thursday: Closed, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I have been going to the Selkirk Book Exchange now for years.  Darren is a wonderful person who obviously loves books.  He is very helpful by suggesting different authors, depending on the type of books a person reads.  He has introduced me to many authors I had not heard of and for the most part he was right on with his suggestions.  I love going to his store and never come away with less than 20 - 30 books to keep me busy.
review_2_text: Darren is a person who knows his Authors and takes into consideration what a person likes to read. He will suggest new Authors for you that you never knew about.He can keep you reading for months.I know because he does this for me.Its no wonder that this store is the oldest in Winnipeg.
review_3_text: Fantastic selection. Great guy working too! Always a pleasure stopping in snooping around! Ps. I want a coloring book next time!!! üòπüëçüèª
review_4_text: Owner is very helpful, tons of books and lots of recommendations for similar reads. Quick response if you email your list of wanted books, he will tell you exactly what he has on hand.
review_5_text: Super surprised by the way this place operates. Sales come second to providing the community with literature. He was polite attentive and even gave me a free book because he seen how excited I was to see such a selection from an obsolete fun title

name: Paraphernalia Books 'N' Stuff
description: Paraphernalia Books 'N' Stuff started as a Used Bookstore and continues to offer a large selection of used books. Most books are not listed online, contact them with specific titles or visit the store to browse. They also sell British Food, Home Decor, Jigsaw Puzzles, Mugs and Glassware, Lapel Pins & Patches, and Metal Signs.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: 1-5p.m.}
review_1_text: A wonder experience to go if you're a book and nicknack lover, sweet and treats as well! This little shop is full of organized chaos and I love it, most certainly will be back. The staff are just people you'd want to know these days, a warm and inviting environment to come lose yourself in what they have to offer. Recommend. Fair prices an huge selection.
review_2_text: Went in here awhile ago. Been hooked on British stuff for a long while now and enjoyed my time in here. The owner is absolutely delightful and we got into a chat about many things on a chilly rainy day when there wasn't anyone else around. I eventually bought a few things, all of which she gave me real good prices on. Even gave me a stamp card to earn some discounts, but sadly I've misplaced it since. Either way, will definitely drop by again.
review_3_text: Really enjoyed visiting this little store. The lady working was very helpful and polite. There is a large book section to pick from and lots of interesting souvenirs and sweets from the UK to choose from. Will be returning because of the vast book collection in the back
review_4_text: Wonderful place. Passed through Oshawa on a roadtrip, and we made a quick stop because I had seen this store online and it seemed like a great place to buy old books. The variety of books is great. It's the perfect place to spend an afternoon looking through the book shelves and picking rare books you can't find anywhere else.The owner was a very sweet and helpful British lady. It's one of those places with a special character. I loved it and I wish I had had more time to look around and I hope I can come back.
review_5_text: the owner is so sweet and the books are fairly priced. I very much enjoyed visiting!

name: Volume Boutique Inc
description: Used bookstore in Montreal, specializing in books, comics, CDs, DVDs, and Xbox & PlayStation games. Established in 2004, located near Berri-Uqam metro station.
full_address: 255 St Catherine St E, Montreal, Quebec H2X 1L5
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-7p.m.}
review_1_text: Visiting Montreal, I was passing by and had to go inside. Found a couple albums from a band‚Äôs discography I didn‚Äôt already own  and one I have on vinyl. CDs like new. I am happy. I will be back again to check out your selection. Great staff here
review_2_text: A great place for second hand books, DVDs and CDs. Wide selection of Comics, novels and documentaries. They also buy used books, but not a lot of English materials.
review_3_text: Reasonable price, with a fair amount of comic collection.
review_4_text: Good variety of books and not so expensive. Some of the books are a bit old. You can get a 20% off discount. Selling books is not favourable there, will give you not more then 3-4$ for a new book.
review_5_text: As my children say Le Cool is not French. But I have been visiting here for 20 years consolidating my love for their mother and her city. Well its mine now. And this store is Le cool. What did it finally is the owner (he seemed too cool not to be) on selecting a great sale CD, saying he saw the Voice of God, the great Sufi in his one set in Montreal. Really Cool!

name: Les Tr√©sors du futur, librairie de livres usag√©s St-Hyacinthe
description: Librairie Bouquinerie is a bookstore.
full_address: 104, 3275 Bd Laurier E, Saint-Hyacinthe, QC J2R 2B1
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Big stock of book great service
review_2_text: I always find new and exciting used books.
review_3_text: I wanted to sell books there that I thought they bought as indicated on their sign (which says Sale, Purchase, Exchange), but I was told that they only gave credits in return to buy books from them with the owner's authorization. In short, misleading advertising and a scam.
review_4_text: Attentive service, lots of finds to make. A few fewer recent books for young children but we found what we wanted there. We will return!
review_5_text: Very nice place! The welcome is warm and very pleasant. The books are very well maintained.

name: MacLeod's Books
full_address: 455 W Pender St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2Z3
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m.}
review_1_text: Best bookstore I have ever been in or seen. Any and every book you could think of, owners been there for 50 odd years and you can tell, such a beautiful collection of books and friendly staff!! Also a variety of prices from $3 books to a collection for over $1k! Must see if you are passionate about literature or history.
review_2_text: No photographs inside the store which I could respect. Staffs were friendly and helpful. Very comprehensive collection of books that are mostly affordable. Awesome place I would love to get lost for hours in. Wish I had more time. Definitely a place of acquired taste though since it can be seen as messy or unorganized.
review_3_text: Very friendly book store, great selection of Stephen King books. They have so many books it's like the room of requirement from Harry Potter but filled with books floor to ceiling. Highly recommended for serious readers.
review_4_text:
I had such high hopes for this book shop as I'm looking for a decent book shop in this town. Instead, the first thing you smell when you walk in is damp and then you see the piles and piles of books just left to rot in the shop. The floor is carpeted and has never been cleaned.

The fact people see this and think it's adds character is very depressing.

The staff were friendly, but they were working in a sea of crap. God knows how they find anything. There are notes everywhere saying don't take photos. They don't want the truth to get out.
review_5_text:
Dreamy book store. This place was recommended to me to visit and I‚Äôm so glad I came to see it. There are books almost up to the ceiling!

If you‚Äôre ever in Vancouver, this place is a must see!

name: Pandosy Books
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I have been there last weekend and got impressed how well organized the store is. Plus I found very interesting books end up buying four. I will go back.
review_2_text: Great bookstore!! Went hoping to find some excellent children‚Äôs books - great selection when I was there, used but excellent condition, and a fraction if the cost of new‚Ä¶helpful and kind owner, gave me a few extra minutes past closing time! Definitely recommend!
review_3_text:
Pandosy Books in Kelowna is a bookalicious wonderland, a literary oasis that makes bibliophiles weep with joy! It's like walking into a candy shop, but instead of sweets, it's the delicious aroma of books that envelops you.

Every shelf is a treasure trove of bookalicious delights, from spine-tingling mysteries to heartwarming romances. It's like each book is whispering, "Pick me, pick me!" in a chorus of paper and ink.

And oh, the cozy nooks! Perfect for losing yourself in a good read, much like that old Asian gentleman atop Coit Tower who lost himself for a moment, only here you'll just be metaphorically fainting from the overwhelming choice of fabulous reads.

Five stars for Pandosy Books, the ultimate haven for book lovers and seekers of bookalicious adventures! üåüüìöüéâ
review_4_text: They have a lot more than just 1000s of books here. Tons of collectables and sports cards. Pretty cool place
review_5_text:
Positively the best place in the Okanagan to buy used Records, DVD's, Books, Collectables, and more! They also buy books and some DVD's. We could spend hours in here just looking for that hidden treasure. Very well organized and easy to find what your looking for, and if you have any issues, the staff there are terrific and can help you with anything you may need.
Everything we have bought there over the years has always been in great shape, and we have never had any issues.
Highly reccomend this store for all collectors out there!

name: Best Choice Quality Used Books
working_hours: {Monday: 9:30a.m.-4p.m., Tuesday: 9:30a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 9:30a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 9:30a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 9:30a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 9:30a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Our favourite bookstore! We always feel welcomed and they really know their inventory.  We always find something to bring home. The books are in good shape and clean, there are lots of goodies to find, we especially like the soaps and other bath products.
review_2_text: Beautiful shop, larger then it looks from the outside. Great selection, well organized. Prices are very fair. Wonderful owner, lovely pups. The atmosphere is very welcoming. One of my new favorite places. I will definitely be back.
review_3_text: Friendly owners/staff, cute dogs to pet, neat jewelry etc. It's a cozy shop that is actually quite a lot bigger than it initially appears. They have a kids corner with toys and a large selection of books as well as odds and ends. I've only been here once but it appears to also sell coffee.
review_4_text: What a lovely shop! Deceivingly large, I was amazed at how many books were inside! The soaps and wellness products were a nice surprise. The woman I chatted with was very knowledgeable, helped point me to the section I needed for the book I was looking for. She was so friendly and lovely to chat with. The soap are divine! Will absolutely be back.
review_5_text: Good prices and great selection. Also Red light therapy and much more

name: The Book Bin
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
Beautiful little hidden gem in Pandosy! The lady here is super nice, even bumped my price down from 11 bucks to 10. Since it is a used book store, selection is highly dependent on whatever comes in, so keep your expectations in check and you'll love this place!

One note, this place is cash and debit only, and card tap is not supported.
review_2_text: She was awesome.. found 3 books including a hard to find one
review_3_text: Very cute little store with lots to offer. Staff are really friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. If you are in the area definitely stop by you will find a good read here.
review_4_text:
Helpful friendly service.
Walked me to the exact spot where the author was for the book I requested.
review_5_text: The Book Bin is the best and cutest little used book store!  Pat, the owner, is incredibly friendly and knows her books!!  There is a HUGE selection of current and popular books/authors.  Pat also will give her recommendations based on what you enjoy to read.  I highly recommend The Book Bin!  Great prices and SO much to choose from!

name: Reader's Haven
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Visited for the first time today. What an adorable bookstore. We enjoyed chatting with the owner. I did not leave empty handed ü•∞ I highly recommend taking the time to drop in
review_2_text:
Loved this place and have already recommended it to friends!

The kitchen chairs near the various book cases begged me to sit, look at the books, and decide which ones were coming home with me....I could have picked a ton more!

Go in! Chat with the owner (she was awesome!). Be at home with the books. Let the books tell you how many you need. Listen to the books!!
review_3_text: The book shop is extremely tidy and well organized. I really enjoy chatting with the owner-- knowledgeable, incredible memory for all in stock, and a great conversationalist. The book pricing is excellent. I love the "Try Something Different" shelf with books for a dollar that was created to encourage reading outside of one's usual reading habits. It's a fantastic idea and contains a great, truly reflecting the intent. I never seem to have enough time when I go. I think that feeling is a sign of a great destination. There is enough to feel it was worth a visit and enough that I always want to return. In my opinion, this bookshop is what used bookshops are meant to be: friendly, filled to the brim, without feeling cluttered, with both popular and unique titles, and a person at the helm who is welcoming, knows what is on the shelves at any given time. It is also physically accessible with a mobility ramp and wide aisles.
review_4_text: Unprofessional staff, overheard heavy judgement on my book preferences did not feel comfortable will not ever be back
review_5_text: I visited this store with the intent on finding a specific novel by Thomas H. Raddall and was delighted to see that they stocked two copies. I was so happy to get it. In all the other second-hand bookstores I visited during my trip to Nova Scotia, I looked for local fiction yet never saw it, not even in Halifax. Readers' Haven had it...twice! I love to visit down east and to shop for books and Readers' Haven was a pleasure to visit.

name: Book Cellar The
working_hours: {Monday: 1-4p.m., Tuesday: 1-4p.m., Wednesday: 1-4p.m., Thursday: 1-4p.m., Friday: 1-4p.m., Saturday: 1-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Outstanding knowledge and very friendly customer service. I was looking for a book on creative nonfiction writing and the owner and a patron of the bookstore literally gifted me with an excellent book, "Tell it Slant, Creating, Refining, and Publishing Creative Nonfiction" by Brenda Miller.
review_2_text: Incredible book store in Invermere! We stumbled upon it looking for some new reads. Have every possible category of books you could possibly imagine! The owner (and his dog) are beyond kind and so helpful! Happy to support such a genuine kind person! I would recommend anyone visit this hidden gem!!
review_3_text: One of the best bookstores I‚Äôve ever visited. Such gems in store there, the owner was so kind and gave me 3 books for $10 (one being a university textbook). Such a warm and welcoming atmosphere, will for sure be returning!
review_4_text: This was my second time at the Book Cellar and Ray was able to give me some much needed advice. His knowledge of his store and life was endless. I ended up walking out with 4 books on woodworking for $20 and some of his wisdom. He had helped me with some stuff and I cannot thank him enough for this. There is a book for everyone in that store and you should most absolutely check it out.
review_5_text: Nice store, and Ray was beyond fair with the price of an out-of-print scrambling book I‚Äôd been looking for that he had on his shelf. Great place, and my daughter loved his dog.

name: Second Edition Used Book Store
description: Second Edition Used Books is a used bookstore in Stellerton, Nova Scotia, offering a wide selection of books, CDs, and DVDs. They specialize in estate libraries and offer good prices in a friendly atmosphere.
full_address: 279 S Foord St, Stellarton, NS B0K 1S0
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I can't say enough good things about this store; I'm so thrilled I found it. It has tons of variety and I walked out with 2 huge bags full!! And I'll likely be back by end of summer to stock up!!
review_2_text: Quaint little place. Enthusiastic owner who clearly loves his shop. Quite small but organized well. Found a few books I'd been looking for -- support these local guys!!
review_3_text: Customer service is 100%. Wide selection of Books, Movies and other interesting items. A sure place to visit as the owner always seems to have items arriving. +10 for me!
review_4_text: Lots of used books and movies. Used books are all decently priced and has lots of great selection. Located main street Stellarton to left of the Scotiabank. Friendly helpful service.
review_5_text: I always go there when I'm in Stellarton. The selection of books and DVDs is fantastic. The store is clean and well stocked.

name: Renaissance Librairie Ontario
description: Renaissance is a non-profit organization that operates thrift stores to fund employment integration programs. They offer donation centers, job search assistance, and textile waste reduction initiatives. They also celebrate 30 years of social impact and are involved in community events and initiatives.
full_address: 3921 Ontario St E, Montreal, Quebec H1W 1S8
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
This store specializes in books, music and films and is particularly well organized. The friendly staff offer excellent service and I will make it a point to return.

If only the other branches would put as much thought into their presentation of CDs!
review_2_text: If you're a fan of thrifting and a book lover you need to check this place out! I always find some really awesome gems and they're always brilliantly priced! In love and a frequent shopper, highly recommend!! Other notables: clean, organized however no public washroom.
review_3_text: Good service, good prices, good books
review_4_text:
Were nice clean and decently priced store. It's is very well maintained and organized. One of the best librairie of the chain. Friendly staff hard at work and very helpful. I strongly recommend this place for your book, cd, dvd and video game need. News arrival every day. I will go the extra mile to give to this one as I know my stuff will be treated with respect and care.
Have a great day guys!
review_5_text: I really love it. The pricing is just right for used books and movie. I would recommend to go when they are in sale. (Update: I haven't seen them have a sale in quite a while)

name: Librairie Nelligan Inc
description: Librairie √âligan offers a wide selection of books in various subjects, including philosophy, history, literature, and more. They carry titles in both French and English.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text: Came here for a certain type of book. I must have been there a good 10 minutes, walking around searching. There are thousands of books. There was an employee sitting at a table all along and completely ignored our presence refusing to help us out while he was on his phone talking. I attempted to make eye contact with him numerous times, but he ignored me. Obviously he had zero interest at selling so I left. Went to another book store down the street and was able to get the help I needed.
review_2_text:
You might have trouble if you come looking for something specific but otherwise it's a very interesting selection.
Large selection of theological books from all time periods and also histories/biographies, as well as fiction.
review_3_text: One of the best bookstores I've visited.
review_4_text: Peaceful atmosphere. Loved the cracking of the wooden floor that itself tells countless stories, and the smell of old books. ü™∂
review_5_text: This is the place you should go, if you want to find 'your' book.

name: Bookends
description: The Friends of the Ottawa Public Library Association (FOPLA) supports the Ottawa Public Library through fundraising and volunteer efforts. They host monthly Mammoth Book Sales with gently used books, CDs, and DVDs, and provide funding for library programs and initiatives.
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Tuesday: 1-7:30p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 1-7:30p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Good selection but worth stopping in just to talk to the nice folks who run it.
review_2_text: Cute store with great deals on used books
review_3_text: Very small neatly kept store.

name: The Bookworm
description: The Friends of the Ottawa Public Library Association (FOPLA) supports the Ottawa Public Library through fundraising and volunteer efforts. They host Mammoth Book Sales with gently used books, CDs, and DVDs. They also provide funding for library programming and initiatives.
full_address: 1599 Tenth Line Rd, Orl√©ans, ON K1E 3E8
working_hours: {Monday: 10:30a.m.-4:30p.m., Tuesday: 10:30a.m.-4:30p.m., Wednesday: 10:30a.m.-4:30p.m., Thursday: 10:30a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10:30a.m.-2:30p.m., Saturday: 10:30a.m.-2:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: The website says it's open until 6 pm on Thursday, but it was already closed when I reached there around 5pm
review_2_text: LOVE this little used bookstore tucked away between the library and the rest of Ray Friel. I've found many gems here and the volunteers are exceptionally helpful. Happy reading!

name: Book Bazaar
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 1-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
What a wonderful place to walk around, spend some time looking at the collection of books available! They have a LARGE selection of books here, with an upper and lower level worth of books. With no shortage of options and categories.

They have everything you can possibly think of; science fiction, Canadian literature, fiction and non-fiction, etc.

The employee at the front desk here is sweet and kind; he was playing some classical music, which is wonderful to listen to while walking around ‚ò∫Ô∏è I noticed he helped a few people who did walk in find a couple books if they were lost!

Definitely a place to come and check out, 100% recommend if you‚Äôre a book lover!
review_2_text: A good two floor second hand book store. It is open until 5 on Sundays, which is a plus! The books are well organized in sections for history, gardening, cook books. They even have a nautical section. Staff seem helpful.
review_3_text: This place feels like I‚Äôve stepped into a hidden library in Hogsmeade. Warm, inviting, and steeped in the rich scent of old books. There‚Äôs a kind of magic in the air, a quiet hum of stories waiting to be discovered. And the owner? An absolute gem. Welcoming, kind, and the perfect guardian of such a cozy haven.
review_4_text: I love coming here and shopping for books. prices are decent, books are in good condition, and the atmosphere is nice. the only issue I have is that the store is organized by genre and that's it. it's not the place to go if you're in a rush or looking for something specific, as it will take you a while to find. Nonetheless I would check out if you're in the area and have the time to do so.
review_5_text: Yes, you have to be a bit of a self-sufficient shopper, but that's part of the fun. If you go in open-minded, you'll find more books than you can carry out. I love browsing in here, and find lots of books under $10

name: au Lieu du Livre
full_address: 169 Rue Cr√©mazie O, Qu√©bec, QC G1R 1X6
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Excellent place for used books - go with an author in mind and the bookseller can help you find the author
review_2_text: It's an extremely small used bookstore with books everywhere, even the floor. I had difficulty walking between the stacks and could barely look at stuff without everything falling to the ground. Very sparse (almost nonexistent) YA selection. Just go to "Lire et Relire" on Frank-Carrel instead.
review_3_text: You can find whatever you want, but the owner can't speak English. The prices are a little expensive for used books.
review_4_text: Great choice of books.
review_5_text: Perle cach√©e des librairies secondes mains! Prix bas, qualit√© √©lev√©, propri√©taire dynamique et cordial!

name: Berry & Peterson Booksellers
full_address: 348 King St E, Kingston, ON K7L 3B6
working_hours: {Monday: 12-5p.m., Tuesday: 12-5p.m., Wednesday: 12-5p.m., Thursday: 12-5p.m., Friday: 12-5p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: I discovered this shoppe by pure chance while strolling around downtown Kingston and with some time to kill before brunch. I only had less than an hour but it was totally fun and brought back a lot of memories of old bookstores (the narrow staircase, stone walls and the wooden beams with walls and walls of books). The books were reasonably priced (look for the penciled price in the inside cover) and they were having a ‚Äúbuy 2, get third one free‚Äù deal.  Will definitely go back.
review_2_text: Very quaint little book store. My friend picked up a beautiful hard cover copy of crime and punishment.
review_3_text:
I stumbled upon this gem and was left breathless. Reading through the reviews and seeing pix here I realized there was still so much to explore. (It has an upstairs?!?) I didn't make it much pass the first few bookcases, that were full of leather bound, special editions of classic literature. I was in love, pulled up a chair and started digging in. Prices are very reasonable, and John Berry is a delight. As a book lover it's so great to share the admiration of books, and he is a true book collector, and charming to boot!
It's a paradise for book lovers, this is true. And you will spend many hours. I ended up looking through my pile to select what to keep on price point, but then John said he has a buy 2 get 3rd free sale, and I was able to buy all 6!! A fabulous edition to my library.
Thanks John I will be back. To get out of my town and to just come and visit you. Thank you so much for keeping this wonderful shop!
review_4_text:
Very well stocked store and reasonably priced!
Such an interesting building.  Even if you're not looking for a book, at least check it out.  Don't forget to go upstairs!
review_5_text: Fantastic used bookstore with something for everyone. I hit it every time I'm in Kingston. I recently bought a beautiful signed first edition leather-bound novel on a wonderfully arcane subject along with an original Nancy Drew book to give to a friend as a birthday gift. My son loves their fantasy fiction section. The prices are excellent and there are frequent sales. Plan to spend an hour or more.

name: Bestsellers Bookstore
description: Bestsellers Bookstore offers a wide variety of books, magazines, and collectibles. They have a diverse inventory including fiction, non-fiction, vintage items, and more.
full_address: 35-A Commercial St Second Floor, Nanaimo, BC V9R 5G3
review_1_text:
**Be cautious** that they do not return phone calls when your delivery goes missing.

In a nutshell, the book was for some reason returned to sender by Canada Post, so "Kelly" at Bestseller Books ultimately gets both my money and her book back. This could have easily been a 5-star review by simply returning my phone call instead of taking both my money and the book I paid for, and not even answering their phone calls or calling customers back to resolve this.

*******Happy to remove this review if you phone back and either return the money you took from me, or the book I ordered.******
review_2_text: It is tidy, bright and really well organized.   The owner is personable and helpful.  She is a great combination of knowledge and business sense and controls the quality of the used books she offers.  I could browse here for hours.  She is also incredibly dog friendly!
review_3_text: This is a great spot. My personal favourite bookstore. Always great service and well priced. The owners are always friendly and helpful. I‚Äôm sad to know that they‚Äôre  closing their doors due to losing their lease. Hopefully they relocate eventually. It‚Äôs the end of an era for downtown Nanaimo.
review_4_text: The place has lost its lease. August may be their last month of operation.  Sad to see such a great store closing. Staff has very keen eyes, helpful, polite, caring and knowledgeable. Thank you in advance for your service.
review_5_text:
I've been purchasing books from Bestseller Bookstore for 5 years and have always found the owners to be courteous and knowledgeable. Books are well priced and the selection of topics is extensive.
I have had occasion to ask for authors they did not have in stock and they have been helpful in contacting me whenever they get a book in I might be interested in stock.
As far as I'm concerned the best used bookstore in Nanaimo.

Have fun!

Jim Foston - Nanaimo resident.

name: Librairie Bonheur D'Occasion Inc
description: Bonheur d‚Äôoccasion is a bookstore in Montreal that buys and sells used books, and offers in-home book purchases.
full_address: 475 Boul. de Maisonneuve E, Montr√©al, QC H2L 4E3
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
A little book store in front of the Quebec national archives and library (BANQ).

The attendant was helpful and helped me find a Bescherelle (French grammar book) and I bought it since it wasn't available in the library. Only $10 so affordable prices.

I appreciate him for speaking slowly in French so I understood
review_2_text: Great curation of fiction / more academic non-fiction. Fair pricing as well.
review_3_text: I called the store and spoke in english as my first language is English l, the guy responded in french and when i answered back in english, he hung up on me !
review_4_text: I love this book store! They even sell interesting post cards. They have a nice selection of erotic novels, pin up related books and erotic photographs. Happy reading!
review_5_text: Lovely bookstore inside the library, a large selection of fiction in English.

name: Watson's Mill Used Book Store
description: The Used Book Store in Dickinson Square offers a wide selection of gently used books, jigsaw puzzles, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Proceeds support Watson‚Äôs Mill and Dickinson House. Donations are gratefully accepted from the public.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Nice used bookstore located in Manotick in a historic preserved barn. They've books on a wide selection of topics at reasonable prices as well as some puzzles and free books. The folks working there have organized the books well and are pretty helpful.
review_2_text: I visit every time I‚Äôm in Manotick, and buy something every time too! Always a good find here, and value is great for such a wide selection!! üòÅ thank you to the friendly staff for being so helpful too!
review_3_text: This is a wonderful used book store where I have found many unexpected treasures. Prices are very reasonable and some free books too.
review_4_text: Not a huge selection but the prices are great and it's well organized. The staff is helpful and we found some local treasures!
review_5_text: Small store, but good selection for the size. Great people working there, and the prices can‚Äôt be beat! Found a few books from authors I love and will be back.

name: Andrena's Book Company
full_address: 910 Columbia St W #1, Kamloops, BC V2C 1L2
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 9a.m.-3p.m.}
review_1_text:
Nice place with a good concept for membership.

Bring back the book you've bought and get 50% of what you paid for them in credit !!

Nice to meet you Crystal !

Thanks for everything ^_^

Nice place to go if you are a reader in Kamloops !
review_2_text:
Worst customer service. Blocked our truck in because we had a truck and trailer and couldn't find any parking.  Only parked to pick up food.

To your response.  Wendy's full of witnesses saw how the owner was speaking to us 6. But when you blocked us in, blocking neighboring business and many cars couldn't go in and out.  Yes that way was the way to solve it. We were back in 5 mins like we said with our food. We had a truck and trailer hence parking in an open area. We didn't block no one or interfere.  Just you had a problem with us.  Seems a bit targeted
review_3_text: Store is well-kept with a great collection of books. I couldn‚Äôt help but overhear the staff (sorry I didn‚Äôt manage to get your name!) behind the counter leaving voice mails to customers to inform them that the books they were looking for are now available. Such meticulous service! Love it that you guys catalogue titles!!
review_4_text: Awesome bookshop! What a treasure to find on our way through BC when the kids ran out of reading material. Good section for young readers, teens and everyone else.
review_5_text: Store has lots of interesting books and good choices

name: Knotanew Book Store
description: Knotanew Bookstore is an independent bookstore in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan offering a curated selection of new, used, and local books.
full_address: 239 George St N, Peterborough, ON K9J 2N2
working_hours: {Monday: 12-4p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text: Such an amazing bookstore and such a kind owner. My fianc√© and I went in there, looking for a book to finish his collection and came out with a bunch more. Such an amazing selection, including classics, fiction, even children‚Äôs books! The lovely man at the store took his time to help us find exactly what we needed and even went to check other areas to ensure we had everything we needed. Above and beyond service if you ask me. The book conditions were great and we are so excited to go there again.
review_2_text: Great little used bookstore! Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and professional. Prices were very reasonable for what was offered.
review_3_text: I liked their selection of genre books.  If you are looking for something special for a JR Tolkien fan, would suggest here.  Particularly if seeking hard to find editions or books.  Some of books are in stacks (which means the spines are in good shape).  Ask for help.  I found a book I wanted to read that I looked for, for decades, so definitely check out their offerings.  You never know what you find.  They had Andre Norton books!
review_4_text: I love this place! Always something good in the fantasy and sci-fi section. Owner is awesome and fun to chat with about the books. Cheers!!!
review_5_text: Great book store that we visit every year while on vacation. Very interesting collection of fiction, non-fiction, beautiful folios and more. Make sure to give yourself some time to explore all this shop has to offer!

name: Cultures A Partager
description: The Fondation des parlementaires qu√©b√©cois promotes cultural exchange through book donations. They collect, sort, and redistribute over 3 million books annually to organizations in Quebec and French-speaking countries. They rely on donations and a large network of volunteers.
full_address: 214 Av. de la Cath√©drale, Rimouski, QC G5L 5J2
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12-4:30p.m., Thursday: 12-4:30p.m., Friday: 12-4:30p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-3p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Very nice little book shop. Average of 5$ per book.  Will return as soon as I'm in Rimouski.
review_2_text: Small used book store, I would add a few board games and puzzles for greater diversity, but it's still good for finding a variety of older and recent books.
review_3_text: Always satisfied with the website, the products are shown in close-up. I would have liked to see the product in photos before purchasing but it's OK, it's too much work. I love your bookstore, I'll come back to it.
review_4_text: Very courteous staff. Lots of book choices for all tastes. They are in very good condition the majority of the time and the prices are more than reasonable. The money goes to a good cause too. Without a doubt the best place for quality used books.
review_5_text: Very nice place to find all kinds of used books. Welcoming staff.

name: Renaissance Librairie Fleury-Hamel
description: Renaissance Qu√©bec is a non-profit organization with a network of thrift stores and donation centers. They support employment integration programs through generated revenue. They also offer employment resources and are committed to textile waste reduction.
full_address: 1499 Rue Fleury E, Montreal, Quebec H2C 1S3
working_hours: {Monday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 9a.m.-9p.m., Friday: 9a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 9a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 9a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text:
I've been a loyal customer of Renaissance Library at 1499 rue Fleury for over five years, and I can confidently say that their team delivers outstanding service. The staff members are incredibly friendly, respectful, and always go above and beyond to assist customers.
Mr. Luc, the manager, exemplifies true leadership with his excellent communication, integrity, decision-making skills, adaptability, and strong work ethic. His guidance is reflected in the team‚Äôs exceptional sense of responsibility and ownership.
A special mention to Phillipe, Patrick, Marie-Eve, Sara, Leslie, Michel, and others who have been part of this wonderful team. They are ethical, hardworking, well-organized, and dedicated to making the customer experience truly enjoyable. Their teamwork and heartfelt commitment to their work are genuinely impressive.
Having purchased hundreds of books from this library, I deeply appreciate their efforts in maintaining such a welcoming and well-managed space. Their customer service sets a high standard, and I‚Äôm grateful to be a long-time patron.
Thank you all for your exceptional service!
review_2_text:
Sweet little place with a great assortment of dvds, CDs and books too. Theres even a section for children. The staff are really helpful too.
I come once in a while and always leave with a little gem. Heads up though it's not very big. The one on Boulevard Lebeau is bigger.
review_3_text: Good store but needs more English books. Once in a bloom moon I fine good books.
review_4_text: I'm always able to find something! Prices are great and everything is well organized. As an added bonus the music is always fantastico!
review_5_text: Excellent selection of used French and English books.

name: Cardinal Books
description: Cardinal Books is located in Birr, Ontario, Canada, and offers a select stock of approximately 20,000 used, rare, and out-of-print books. They specialize in 19th and 20th century first editions, collectible literature, illustrated books, and books on art, architecture, theology, church history, philosophy, and history. They also carry local history, arts & crafts and are happy to purchase collections in the USA and Canada.
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: 2 stone stairs from the parking lot to the store without a railing made the building inaccessible for me. Also no ramp and so no chance for anyone in awhheelchair. I probably would have spent enough to cover the cost of a railing in my single visit but won't be bothered to stop there again. No point in stopping when I can't get in the store and there's lots of other accessible choices around.
review_2_text: Recently ordered a rare book online from this shop and it was a great experience. The book is in very good condition and came excellently packaged. Will have to see if they have any other books I need.
review_3_text: I‚Äôve been here countless times and come away with some fantastic finds each time! The owner is very knowledgeable as well as fair and very friendly! I also highly recommend the 50% off sale that runs in the summer time - it‚Äôs worth the drive out to Birr for sure!
review_4_text: This wonderful shop is a real gem. The history section is very well stocked, and the staff are kind and knowledgeable.
review_5_text: By far my favourite bookstore.  I've yet to pull a book off the shelf that the owner couldn't tell me something interesting about (I'm working on it...), and the selection is just incredible.  A portion of his collection is listed online, but there's more to be found in-store.  Well worth the trip.

name: Orleans Book Market
description: BookMarket is a used bookstore in Edmonton, Alberta, offering a wide selection of books at affordable prices. We buy books and offer a great trade-in value!
full_address: 1675 Tenth Line Rd, Orl√©ans, ON K1E 3P6
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text:
This book store has a pretty big selection but a lot of what they have are older/less sought after.

The organization system is good though, so if you are looking for an older book by a specific author, it‚Äôs worth checking out this store. The staff are also very very nice people.
review_2_text: I absolutely love this used book store.  I haven't seen a bigger selection of used horror books elsewhere in Ottawa and I wish it were even bigger.   The Staff is always friendly and willing to help.
review_3_text:
There are lots of books. I picked up some Agatha Christie but they had all kinds.
Couple of things that stood out were the French kids books and a set of Will and Ariel Durant history books.
review_4_text: If you're willing to take a chance on unexpected finds, this is *definitely* a place to keep coming back to. I would strongly recommend that their landlord give them more floor space to work with!
review_5_text: Found 3 great books and staff were wonderful, recommend this place for books of any kind.

name: Pulpfiction Books
description: Pulpfiction Books! Vancouver's legendary independent bookstore, Established in June 2000.
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-7p.m.}
review_1_text:
Shop üá®üá¶ local
I love the customer service for finding or ordering books from this store.  Good prices and I have had very helpful staff every time.
review_2_text: Went here for Stephen King books, got a hardcover under the dome 1060+ page book for $20. Very affordable prices compared to other places like chapters indigo. Very helpful staff
review_3_text: i really love this place, it‚Äôs got a great selection of books (lot of good finds here!) and the staff is super friendly. it‚Äôs really quite cozy inside too üôÇ
review_4_text: I just love this little bookstore. You can do all of your ordering through this team and will always save money versus other options. The staff is always friendly and very knowledgeable!
review_5_text: Horrible staff (think it was the owner). Unnecessarily rude lol Needs to get on prozac or something to cheer him up.

name: Echo Books
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-4p.m.}
review_1_text: The shop has come a long way with how organized it is and it absolutely looks great. That being said I am very disappointed with their pricing. I bought a children‚Äôs book for 11$ not thinking. When I got home I realized how much I paid, realized it was higher then the brand new purchase price, and competitors had it listed as selling for 3-5$
review_2_text: Great deals on book and a decent selection. It's more organized than i would have expected for a used book store and the gentleman who helped me was knowledgeable and friendly for the most part. Love this store.
review_3_text: Great used book store. Well organized and pretty spacious. Variety of topics represented
review_4_text: It's okay... It's always a mess, they don't have a good system for shelving, organizing or reorganizing books. Last visit boxes were obstructing shelves and walkways and an isle was closed. Prices are from reasonable to high and it's hard to find anything unless you aren't picky and just try something, or ask and hope the person on staff is the one who hid it.
review_5_text: Good selection, plenty of local history books that are not available anywhere else. Basement well organized. Chill and quiet.

name: Librairie De La Montee
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I have gone to this bookshop a couple of times. Bought low priced books and also much higher priced books. The selection of genres is wide, mostly books written in French. The attendant or owner sounds knowledgeable but sometimes dismissive, don't waste his time he's not into chitchat.
review_2_text: There is a nice selection of English books for a used bookstores. The lady working there was lovely and helpful. The prices were great! 10/10 would recommend stopping by if you are in the area or even go out of your way to discover your next read!
review_3_text: This place is a gold mine and very quirky. The staff is there if you need them, but they don‚Äôt get in your way. I absolutely love it. Also, great selection!
review_4_text: helpful staff, a surprising nice selection, but quite pricy for used books.
review_5_text: Went to sell books.  He said they are too old and I should donate at a church.  Than he suggested a church close by.

name: Lawrence Books
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: Closed, Saturday: 1-5p.m., Sunday: 1-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Lawrence Books is again open, at the moment on a limited basis (weekend afternoons only, I think), as the owners are senior citizens and that's their preference.  I visited today (November 10th) and browsed through the maze of book stacks, which is jam packed with vintage material.  I love book stores like this, and I was happy to find it open again after so long. Their inventory is amazing!
review_2_text: Come for rare finds, huge selection, and the adventure! Don't expect organization, and the fiction section is freezing in the winter-- it's  part of the charm. Super helpful and knowledgeable owner. Very reasonable pricing. This place is a Vancouver gem.
review_3_text: Hello Everyone,  I walked in today and it is open on weekends only. The owner had some health issues during the pandemic.  Check it out! A great selection of books.
review_4_text: Such a charming bookstore. A real westside gem! You can spend hours inside.
review_5_text: This place is 100% a front. Hasn't been opened in years. Even when it was opened, it was about once a week and for 4 hours. Not sure how they continue to power or hold the lease on the property. Someone is cleaning their money here. I've lived in the neighborhood for 25 years.

name: Renaissance Don Faubourg des Prairies
description: Renaissance Qu√©bec is a used bookstore specializing in French-language books. They offer a wide variety of books at affordable prices.

name: Renaissance Librairie Saint-Denis
description: Renaissance Qu√©bec is a used and rare bookstore located in Quebec City. We specialize in books about Quebec, Canada, and French language books.
