review_1_text: Small cute used bookstore on Saint Dennis street as part of the Renaissance friperie/thrift store chain. While it may be small in size, it has good variety of genre and selections. In fact I was able to find a couple of really interesting philosophy/non fiction English books while there! Also the staff members were super friendly and helpful. They also have random knickknacks and board games on sale.
review_2_text: Small bookstore with only 3 shelves of English novels. Able to get 3 books though so I'm happy about that. Staff are nice and friendly.
review_3_text: Second time I went there to drop off items. The staff were courteous and smiling. Very professional and I will go again when I have more to donate.
review_4_text: Decent little book store with small English section.  While I didn‚Äôt buy anything, it was still nice to wander through.
review_5_text: It‚Äôs one of my favorite places to go in montreal. The workers are always nice. A worker saw me and my friend sitting on the ground and the next time we went they had brought some chairs. And in my opinion they have the best selection of books and it changes often.üíõüíõ

review_2_text:
Great ONLINE used book store! My books are super beautiful!
üòÉ
You can't read on site, but you can pick up your order there.
review_3_text: Buy several books and board games for children.. fast and impeccable delivery. I'm going to buy it again to give the book a second life
review_4_text: Always books that look new and always at a good price.
review_5_text: Fast delivery and book in excellent condition. Not expensive too!

name: Librairie l'√âchange
description: Librairie √âchange is a general bookstore specializing in used books, with a wide selection of titles.
full_address: 713 Mont-Royal Ave E, Montreal, Quebec H2J 1W7
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-7p.m.}
review_1_text:
Great spot for music, books, and excellent help! Huge selection of items from many genres. Friendly staff, always helpful. Will visit again soon!

Update - I checked out other parts of the store, and there is much more to see. A lot more reference materials, and the CD selection, upon a second view, is quite impressive! The prices, for the most part, are reasonable - an MJ album (Thriller) was 18$ used, Kate Bush (15$). Not bad!

Books, there are a lot of options! I think you need a good day to browse, read, and enjoy the selection to see what's there, and what might you want.
review_2_text:
L'√âchange is one of the most pleasant used bookstores to shop at in Montreal. Nicely laid out and modern, it is a great place for afternoon book shopping.

The store features robust arts, architecture, photography, fiction, theatre, philosophy, non-fiction, and kids sections. There are also CDs and vinyls on hand, but this is not the shop's specialty.

A quick note: like other bookstores on Mont-Royal, the selection is mostly in French (the province's main language), and foreigners might not have a lot to select from.

Overall, it is a wonderful stop for arts, culture, and especially book lovers. Here, all the greats are present, from Richard Avedon to Plato, Mies van der Rohe to Dickens.
review_3_text:
Lovely place for readers.
Sadly most collection was in French, though I still found a piece or two for my collection.
review_4_author: Les Plus Belle Choses Dans Le Monde
review_4_text: Good selection of books, movies, and music, and friendly and helpful employees. I was thrilled to find a Martine St-Clair album here. Visit this establishment when you're in Montr√©al.
review_5_text: I have been shopping here since 1995, when I was 13. My grandmother still lives a block away and I would always stop in when visiting her as a kid, teen, adult etc. In the mid 90s, this was the only place I could find all the punk tapes and CDs I was looking for. It was a mecca for me and I am forever thankful that I had such a wonderful place to really find myself musically. After I moved from punk to Brit pop in the late 90s, early 2000s, this was the first place I'd go to find all the records I'd read about in NME, Q, etc. They always had them and they were always well priced. A true gem that I'm glad to see is still kicking.

name: Mark Jokinen Books
description: Jokinen's Bookstore is an independent bookstore located in Hadley, Massachusetts, offering a wide selection of new and used books.
full_address: 271 George St N, Peterborough, ON K9J 3G9
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I love, love, love this place!  The selection is amazing, and Mark is just the best.  He somehow seems to have the entire inventory in his head, and can not only tell you if he has a copy of *any* book you ask for, but he can locate it instantly - and can also recommend similar titles, authors - or something new altogether.  I love going here - and always spend far too long and lots of $!  This has been one of the best shops in Peterborough since before we moved here over 20 years ago!  Thank you, Mark!!
review_2_text:
The best spot for used books in Peterborough and perhaps the province. The owner is well-versed in his collection, ever so helpful for searches for books that may be obscure or of limited edition, pertaining to special subjects. I can't even guesstimate how many books he has for sale and I worked at the library of Trent University many moons ago! With a broad array of subjects, both fiction and non-fiction, the books in his store cover topics from all ends of the spectrum.

I usually enter his store looking for a specific book/subject and end up leaving with multiple books because the selection is that good. Always I leave with a big grin, ready to dig into his books.

He treats readers with such a welcoming level of hospitality and has an excellent memory for guests and his collection. Often he has deals, such as buy 3 and get one free. Hours could be spent here reading the jackets of books. I am a faithful customer and will always return, wanting more.
review_3_text: I love this place. It feels lived-in, an actual place that isn't just a business. It maintains a large part of the spirit of Peterborough; to me anyway. It is a chaotic mess that doesn't pretend to be anything else but a collection of some of the best books that circulate this sleepy, college/uni town.
review_4_text: Great selection, and I really enjoyed browsing here.  We first met Mark at his previous location yrs ago. Friendly and knowledgeable.
review_5_text:
I was so impressed that not only was there a choice of books available from the author I was searching, but that the owner was so knowledgeable and helpful when I mentioned it to him. He went directly to the exact spot where the books I was looking for were located, which was amazing given the huge selection of books in his store. That time it served me well as I was in a bit of a hurry, but this is a place where I enjoy spending time at my leisure,  and being curious.

So, if you like to search for books and wait for serendipity or if you know exactly what you need, in any case, this is a great place to shop.

name: Lire et Relire
description: Livres √† moiti√© prix is a bookstore offering books at half price.
full_address: 1533 Autoroute Laval Ouest, Laval, QC H7L 3W3
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: quite disappointed.  brought 30 books a mixture of recipe and children books. some new books got only 60$. when I ask how they rate it the guy told me oh I already counted it don't worry and everytime he was telling me to go and check for book I want in exchange while he was still checking my books. for me it was a scam.
review_2_text: Books heaven! My kids went crazy with the amazing variety of books. The used books are in great shape, and you'll be paying half the original price, i think it's an amazing deal for books lovers! The other section for new books is also at an advantageous price. The place is well organized, and you can search easily for the things that interest you.
review_3_text: Ive shopped many times there you can find great books at a low price and theyre in good shape. The only thing i wish they had was an inventory. It could probably help sell more if we could search by word or event (history books). Other than that i really recommend a visit
review_4_text: Lots of rare finds, and manga! They were kind enough to let us browse after closing hours. We will definitely be back!
review_5_text:
seriously I almost want to keep this place a secret thats how amazing it was such a great service, you can email them let them know which book you are looking for and they will call you when its ready !!!!! that everyone is what I call service.

I own a business and who ever owns this place I want to say thanks

name: Phoenix Book Store
full_address: 980 2nd Ave E, Owen Sound, ON N4K 2C9
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text:
If you enjoy books there is something really intriguing about a used bookstore.
You never know what you might find, like a treasure hunt for books.
So while doing a walk about in Owen Sound and I spied the Phoenix Book Store the hunt was on.
Interesting spot, packed with books, and some organization.
Fortunately my wife was busy shopping elsewhere so I had a solid hour plus in there.
And I came away with a few gems.
My parents were born and raised in Glengarry County, History of Glengarry, 1979, last printed in 1980.
Marked at $59.00 and the gentleman rounded it down to $50.
You would be looking upwards of $100+.
Bobby Orr, my favourite hockey player of all time, ‚ÄúMy Story‚Äù, hardcover, for $15.
Amazon paperback $35.
And I‚Äôm a Blues music fan and a cool little book called Blues From the Delta by William Ferris, for $5. (Documentary on Mississippi Delta Blues).
On line you are going to pay ~$40.
Anyway, you get my drift, hit this great little book shop up!
review_2_text:
Great book store in OS -very glad there is somewhere to find good things to read in OS.

The owner is always around for a chat or to recommend something to read.

The sci-fi selection is amazing and you can really find vintage series if that's what you are into.

There is a decent flow of classics and history, science, etc

The philosophy and psychology sections are a bit slower to move.
review_3_text: Used bookstore, skewing more towards paperbacks and other light summer beach reading.  Reasonable prices.  Lots of paperbacks, but some other works as well.  Friendly owner.
review_4_text: This was my first visit to the bookstore and was well worth the trip. Great selection and customer service and perfect spot for bibliophiles like myself. Planning to return as often as possible!
review_5_text:
I adore this bookstore!
When you enter you are definitely entering in the world of all readers! Books are easy to search as they are intelligently sorted. They may be are not in orders and only placed together but the fun of searching gets to you and brings you in the old days, which is what i love from this place!

The man/ owner is fabulous! He is always smiling, ready to help you and will even search to see if he has what you are looking for! I found so much books i love there!

Old books from almost new ones but used, if you want good prices used books, i recommend the place!

Books have to survive the computer ones!

name: Chapter and Verse
full_address: 23 Mississaga St W, Orillia, ON L3V 3A5
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-4p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: I visited the store late Monday for the first time. What a unique experience. The area is cozy and welcoming. The books nicely organized and in excellent condition. It was self serve which I managed nicely. I will definitely be back! Thank you for creating such a welcoming place.
review_2_text: Looks great in the photos but we couldn't find it! There was just sign in the street and it was too cold to keep looking ü•∫
review_3_text: If you like used books üìö they have them
review_4_text: love to pop into this shop from time to time, owner is wonderful, and adds so much to the amazing Used bookstore community
review_5_text: Great place for cheap books. Staff were amazing with my autism and helped me pick out perfect books for me

name: Renaissance Bookstore-Donation Centre
description: Renaissance Qu√©bec est une librairie sp√©cialis√©e qui offre une vaste s√©lection de livres neufs et d‚Äôoccasion, en plus d‚Äôune gamme compl√®te de cadeaux et de produits culturels.

review_1_text: Very small and intimate centre. You can't drop off almost everything, but they only sell books and media. CD's, DVD, Blu-ray, some board games and books... lots of books.
review_2_text: Clean and well organized.  Most books are $3.75 or less.  Smaller selection of English books.
review_3_text: Many good books in a very clean shop. A nice section of books in English too.
review_4_text: A great service and they helped me bring the bags inside!
review_5_text: Best prices good bye to salvation army

name: Gritty Grotto Books
full_address: 10442 Whyte Ave NW, Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2
working_hours: {Monday: 12-5p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Not sure I would call it a book store so much as a novelty/vintage kind of store, but either way it was a fun stop. There‚Äôs all kinds of pins and stickers and patches of just about anything you‚Äôd be interested in, leather bound old hardcovers, quality incense, jewelry, vintage magazines and signs, etc. It‚Äôs a lot. Would definitely be worth a visit even if you‚Äôre on whyte ave!
review_2_text:
It was slightly harder to find. It is actually downstairs of the record store above it. It wasn't really a dedicated used book store. There was a variety of different retro and new age stuff for sale. The other items were especially fun to look at. I loved the cat clocks!

As for the book store portion, there wasn't a very large selection to choose from and it seemed more like an after thought as it took up only a tiny portion of the store.
review_3_text: Voodoo and mystical items from far and wide range here. Good books. Smells good too.
review_4_text: Wonderful place with many treasures and neat finds. A nostalgia trip with all the best of those hippy days.
review_5_text: Sigma bookstore filled with skibidi people

name: Comptoir du Livre Enr
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-8p.m., Sunday: 10a.m.-8p.m.}
review_1_text: Nice used bookstore. Mostly they have books in French but they do have a section of English books (and some scattered as well). The English books I found were mostly like novels or slightly older non fictions. Located across the library. Probably this place is more for local than tourist unless you do read French books.
review_2_text: Great selections of books. Employee friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.
review_3_text: A cute used book store with a good collection of CDs. Visited it several times when traveling to Quebec, and left with a big box of disks!
review_4_text: I was browsing the lovely selection of books when the owner walked up to me and spoke in french to me. when i said that I was sorry because I don't speak french he stared at me angrily and threw his arms out to either side. would not recommend going here if you are not local/can't communicate in French. I just left feeling unwelcome.
review_5_text:
The store itself is great, but not welcoming at all. If you're not local, I'd avoid this place.

As an international traveller, to be rudely told "I don't speak English", despite being asked in perfect English if I spoke French, or I wanted a bag is not exactly welcoming to tourists. The official language of Quebec is English, and all other places are able to swap between English and French, but the attitude here was terrible. Such a shame.

name: Zoinks Music and Books
full_address: 1019 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1M1
working_hours: {Monday: 12-6p.m., Tuesday: 12-6p.m., Wednesday: 12-6p.m., Thursday: 12-6p.m., Friday: 12-6p.m., Saturday: 12-6p.m., Sunday: 12-6p.m.}
review_1_text:
The owner was super chill and minded his own business lol.
The place is cute and books are organised well, mostly 5-10$ each. Got a good collection of Lit, Sci, Fantasy, Poetry, and Politics!
They also have AMAZING record collection, must visit.
review_2_text:
Fantastic prices on books, but the selection is small and the counter person
has a strange vibe. The music that was playing was very ominous and liminal, creating an odd shopping experience. The counter person was standoffish and not really interested in engaging. He accidentally knocked over my coffee cup and did clean it up but didn‚Äôt apologize for it.
review_3_text: Great selection, terrible customer service, the front counter person was generally rude and was not willing to answer questions  about selection/prices. I‚Äôve been there a few times and they have the same vibe. There‚Äôs another counter person who is more helpful I would say try to go at different times or with different staff.
review_4_text: Walked in recently, no one else in the store. No greeting or acknowledgment. Asked if they had any home decor books. Got a flat, almost upset ‚ÄòNo‚Äô, then walked out, noticing there was one in the window‚Ä¶ not going back with that kind of customer service.
review_5_text: A good range and interesting selection of books. I enjoyed.

name: Charlie Bouquine
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-3:30p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: Lots of books. Including a decent English selection. A lot are used and in great condition. Inexpensive.
review_2_text: Found great deal on used books. The owner is quite nice.
review_3_text: A super beautiful place full of books! They are in pretty good condition, the prices are good and the owner is really nice.
review_4_text: One Saturday afternoon, not having noticed the time, we entered the store knowing what book we wanted. The Open sign was on and the door unlocked. The lady greeted us very unpleasantly and asked us if we knew what we wanted. We told her yes and she said ‚ÄúI think I have it, but I would have to look and my cash register is closed since the shop is closed‚Äù So we leave disappointed and once in the portico, she says loudly ‚ÄúIt says on the door what time it closes!! ¬ª First and last time I go to this unfriendly place.
review_5_text: I shopped here when this store was called "the Book Coliseum"! It‚Äôs guaranteed, you will make great discoveries there, I guarantee it! And the owner is a very nice person! THANKS!

name: Yann Vernay libraire
full_address: Boutique des Bouquinistes √† la Grande Biblioth√®que, 475 Boul. de Maisonneuve E, Montr√©al, QC H2L 4E3
street: Boutique des Bouquinistes √† la Grande Biblioth√®que, 475 Boul. de Maisonneuve E
working_hours: {Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Great bookstore! Very well curated and nice workers. Great pricing as well.
review_2_text: Leave your political slogans at home. This is a used book store for a public city library. That crap has no place here.
review_3_text: I couldn‚Äôt find them üòî
review_4_text: I discovered this place yesterday on the recommendation of a colleague. I found a little treasure I'd been looking for for months. The prices are a bit steep for used books, but the quality is simply impeccable. There's a lot to choose from!
review_5_text: A pretty little second-hand bookstore located in the hall of the BAnQ. Large selection of books in French and English, and the stock is renewed very regularly... difficult to resist, especially since the prices are more than fair! We are welcomed and advised by a lovely team, which doesn‚Äôt spoil anything.

name: Scene Of The Crime Books
description: Scene of the Crime Books is a used and rare mystery bookstore. We specialize in first editions, signed copies, and all things mystery!
full_address: 20 Hawthorne Ave, St. Catharines, ON L2M 6A9
review_1_text: What a delightful hidden gem of a local business! I never even knew Scene of the Crime Books existed until less than 24 hours ago and now that I know they exist, I will be a frequent customer! The books I bought are in pristine condition, the prices are extremely fair and they respond to emails and phone calls quickly. I am over the moon with their amazing books and customer service!
review_2_text: Always quick delivery and excellent quality of vintage books.   Even at Christmas time, with adverse weather conditions in both Manitoba and Ontario.
review_3_text: Not a store.  A residence.
review_4_text: Sure

name: Librairie Icitte
description: Librairie Icite is a bookstore located in Canada.
full_address: 855 Chem. du Coteau-Rouge, Longueuil, QC J4K 1V4
working_hours: {Monday: 12-2:30p.m., Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12-3:30p.m., Friday: 12-6p.m., Saturday: 12-5p.m., Sunday: 12-5p.m.}
review_1_text: Few selection of manga at 9.95$ each which is not that good honestly. For the other kind of books they seems to have a good variety but I haven't went through much sections.
review_2_text: Small store with a huuuge collection of books on a bunch of different subjects. Also they have an amazon store and you check what books they have. Love that they have really old, arcane books (like a book on theological  philosophy written in latin) and spiritual books like rare books on Kabbalah, astrology, etc
review_3_text: Perfect and unique bookstore to find rare books and comic books.  The owner is very friendly, nice and knowledgable.
review_4_text: Really good service, found a lot of interesting stuff there
review_5_text: Love how they have tarot card decks, and many spiritual books.

name: Amy's Used Books
description: Amy's Used Books offers a wide selection of used books at affordable prices. We are located in Jacksonville, Florida.
full_address: 51 S Albion St, Amherst, NS B4H 2W4
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-9p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-5p.m., Sunday: Closed}
review_1_text: This store is such a hidden gem. I found the books to be reasonably priced, and you can find some super vintage and rare books! I was very excited to find an old edition of Anne of Green Gables :)
review_2_text:
Absolutely love Amy's Used Books! The selection is incredible, with a vast array of genres to choose from. Every visit uncovers new treasures and hidden gems. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it a perfect spot to browse and relax.

The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always making visitors feel welcome with great recommendations. Plus, the prices are unbeatable! If you're a book lover, this is a must-visit spot in Amherst. Can't recommend it enough!
review_3_text: OMG. What a place. There are over 400K books at this marvellous store. We found mystery novels, art books and kids books. We would certainly go back.
review_4_text:
Wow, the number of books and selection is just friggin amazing.
This is definitely a go-to place!
review_5_text:
The gentleman who owns/runs the store was helpful and knowledgeable. I couldn‚Äôt stay for long as the smell of old books was overwhelming for my sinuses and the sheer amount of books is definitely overwhelming as the space is tight.
I will say the books are pricey for second hand, but still an experience worth having for any book lover!

name: Capricorn Books
full_address: Next to Tim Hortons, 117 Kearney Lake Rd Unit 4, Halifax, NS B3M 4N9
street: Next to Tim Hortons, 117 Kearney Lake Rd Unit 4
working_hours: {Monday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Friday: 11a.m.-7p.m., Saturday: 11a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 12-6p.m.}
review_1_text:
Disappointed by the way I was treated.
I visited the store and spent about 40 minutes browsing books. During that time, the staff member repeatedly sprayed a vinegar and water solution around the space. At first, I didn‚Äôt think much of it, until she told me it was because my hair product scent was bothering her (for context, I wasn‚Äôt wearing any perfume). I apologized, even though I didn‚Äôt think the scent was strong.

A couple of minutes later, she came back and said ‚Äúyou‚Äôve been in here for 45 minutes how much longer are you staying here, I can‚Äôt handle the smell anymore.‚Äù We weren‚Äôt even standing near her at that point. I ended up leaving before my boyfriend out of discomfort.

I completely understand sensitivity to smells, but spraying vinegar (which has a much stronger and harsher scent than any hair product) while customers are shopping is not the way to handle it. I felt embarrassed and unwelcome. It‚Äôs unfortunate because the store seemed nice at first, but I won‚Äôt be returning . I see other reviews that say the same thing that I experienced, at least put a sign on the door for others if there is a bad intolerance of scents. driving your customers out making them feel uncomfortable is not a good business moto.
review_2_text:
Iam not much of a reader, but my mom wanted to stop by and she seems to like it here. But I don't think the lady likes me because she was staring at me as if I was doing something wrong. I was just having a chill conversation with my brother. We shared a few laughs but we weren't super loud or anything but it seemed like she was trying to use all her will power to make us leave with her eyes üòÖ.

The books are definitely less expensive here than most places but they are all second hand, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.
review_3_text: Really enjoyed poking around the store with my daughter today. We'll be back soon =)
review_4_text: A bookstore with a nice, comfy atmosphere. The owner was very helpful in showing me around when I was looking for books in a specific genre. Highly recommend checking it out.

review_3_text: Clearly the book store that my and my friend prefer, we spent pleasant moments looking for books there, you look for a book, mention it to the staff and without even looking for it on a screen, they know in which corner the book can be found. The atmosphere is relaxing and more ancient than futuristic, it's not full of technology like in libraries, that's what I like, enjoying it like back then when phones weren't as popular as they are today. The books are mostly used at very low prices even if they look like new. I recommend, since it's my favorite place ‚ò∫Ô∏è

review_5_text:
Good morning

name: Library Center of Don Renaissance Pierrefonds
description: Renaissance Qu√©bec is a second-hand bookstore specializing in books from all eras, in French and English. We also have a wide selection of vinyl records, CDs and DVDs.
working_hours: {Monday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 8a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 8a.m.-6p.m.}
review_1_text: Good selection of second hand books in english and french, and some digital media (music, movies, games). Excellent service from staff for my special request.
review_2_text:
My sister are regular customers at the Renaissance Pierrefonds. Many thanks to Sarah for her help. She is always working so hard, without complaining. And to Heike who is always helping us to discover new authors and suggesting us titles of great books to read. They are a great asset to Renaissance Pierrefonds and it is always a pleasure to see them when we are in the neighbourhood.
Thank you ladies, for the excellent service you are providing to us.
review_3_text:
Books mean a lot to me and my family. I spent a long time researching where to donate books as my husband and I are downsizing from a 5-bedroom family home where we raised our 4 kids over 32 years and we are now moving to an apartment. Purging the hundreds of items has been a huge undertaking, but never would we have imagined our beloved books (there were zero magazines, most of the books hard covers like new, some cooking books) might end up anywhere but in someone‚Äôs hands for new enjoyment.

We chose this particular branch of Renaissance because it specializes in books! Librairie is part of its name!

So imagine our shock and disappointment when the older gentleman inside the door grumpily mumbled ‚Äòyeah? What do you want?‚Äô to my husband as he entered. This man may be an unpaid volunteer, and I thank him for his service if that is the case. But he clearly hates his job so why do it? He literally told ny husband ‚Äòwe don‚Äôt take books‚Äô. What? My husband, who is 80 and in remarkable good shape, but 80 nonetheless, ignored the grumpy reception and instead continued to explain we had just packed up 10 boxes of like-new books which are sure to please the center‚Äôs users.

The man must have a change of heart when my husband told him that he was a kind man, without a note of irony or sarcasm, because the gentleman ended up helping my husband empty our car and bring the boxes of books inside. I was at the wheel of the car because I am mobility challenged and could not have helped, other than to park as close to the door as possible.

Anyway, I was so disappointed by the turn of events, especially after handpicking this organization for our precious books, it left us feeling as though we had been annoyances instead of eager donors.

Do your homework, folks. There has to be a better place, and way, of keeping our beloved books alive.
review_4_text: Nice little bookstore ‚Äì¬†selling primarily, but not just books, but also CDs, puzzles, comic books & a few video games. A bit on the smaller side, but is packed with something for everyone ‚Äì¬†I seldom walk out empty-handed. Shelves are routinely stocked from a seemingly endless stream of donations. Heike & David, who work at this location usually, are friendly, cordial and great to talk to, and will recommend titles according to your tastes. I recommend the store to anyone in the area.
review_5_text: I had a great time at Library Center of Don Renaissance Pierrefonds! The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the facilities were clean and well-maintained. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great place to read, study, or just relax.

review_1_text: I asked whether I could leave some books with Subtext and the cashier sneered ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not that simple‚Äù. Subtext‚Äôs website said they were accepting books, so I didn‚Äôt think I said anything unreasonable? The website should be updated to include that students need to bring their ONEcard with them when dropping off books (I hadn‚Äôt known). The cashier also mentioned that students would have to physically come back to campus to check if their books had sold when the website says that you can also ‚Äúyou can call, or email‚Äù. An important detail to leave out for those who are graduating and leaving the country? Disappointed that this cashier would provide me with false information. I was hoping that my books could‚Äôve been used by another student, but instead I ended up having to donate them.
review_2_text: It is currently 10:48. they were supposed to be open at 9. otherwise excellent prices
review_3_text: i do not understand the purpose of this place. it is meant to sell used textbooks, but they refused to put my 2 textbooks on consignment without any logical explanation. if you are looking to sell a used textbook, don‚Äôt waste your time lugging your textbook to school for them to say no. probably best to just put it on craigslist
review_4_text: Weird pricing scheme and the consignment element really takes advantage of students in need of money. Better to use an online marketplace instead.
review_5_text: Update your hours. Lugging books all the way to your shop on the bus to find that you are closed is frustrating to say the least.

name: D & E Lake Ltd.
description: De La Ke Ltd is a leading book and manuscript dealer specializing in fine and rare books, historical documents, and autograph material. We serve collectors, libraries, and institutions worldwide.
full_address: 239 King St E, Toronto, ON M5A 1J9
working_hours: {Monday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Tuesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Wednesday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Thursday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Friday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Saturday: 10a.m.-6p.m., Sunday: 11a.m.-2:30p.m.}
review_1_text: We've found some great gems in here. The owner (and his daughter) really know their stuff! You can name literally any book and he will know what it is, who wrote it and if he doesn't have it, he will tell you where you can go (they have another location on Summerhill, too). Their collection of psychology books is immense! It's extremely dusty in there, so be prepared, but it's well worth it!
review_2_text: I've been to this store a few times, it's filled with lots of gems and I've historically spent over $500 on books. The man, whom I believe is the owner, has historically been a very pushy and particular individual. I didn't mind it in the past, as he usually also made some good recommendations based on what genres I was browsing. But today, my experience has completely put me off from ever visiting again nor recommending this store to anyone else. I brought a friend to the shop to show them the selection of books. He was already engaged with another customer, but immediately asked us what were looking for. I said we're just taking a look, he seemed annoyed at that. As soon as we took a step into an aisle he asked where we were going and commented on a very small bag I was wearing, with a hostile tone. He said to flip it to the front of my body, which I understand, given the messy over stacking of books he has in the store. And then proceeds to again ask what were looking for, which I said again just taking a look around. I've been to the third floor multiple times before without issue, but this time around as we went to the staircase, his hostility increased and he raised his voice asking us where we were going, that we're not allowed to go up. This is the first time I've ever been told something like this, and I've been here numerous times. I'm perplexed by his behavior, but seeing all the other reviews now I see this is a common issue with the staff here. It was an incredibly unwelcoming environment, and I felt incredibly awkward having brought a friend here for the first time. So we decided to just leave the store without any further engagement with him, and as we leave he simply snarkly commented thank you. Truly, there are many wonderful independent book stores you can visit and support instead of this store. Save yourself the trouble/exposure to this person.
review_3_text: The shopkeeper is incredibly knowledgeable and helpful, offering recommendations tailored to your interests and providing insights into rare or unique finds. The atmosphere is a bit disorganized, but it adds to the sense of adventure, making it a perfect spot to spend a rainy afternoon exploring shelves filled with literary treasures. Whether you're a seasoned bookworm or just starting to build your collection, this bookstore is a must visit. I highly recommend taking the time to visit and immerse yourself in the world of literature.
review_4_text:
Yeah it's expensive but also consider the service Don gives you when you ask him about a book or a topic. I'm a massive Chinese Civil War history buff and he was able to give me tons of books related to it, and about the Paris Commune.

The selection is unparalleled. I asked him how he came to have such a large collection of thins and he told me "I write a lot of cheques, that's how."

He's not rude or unprofessional, he's just straightforward and his humour is a bit dry. He's very friendly and receptive and wants to expand your knowledge, if you let him.
review_5_text:
Thank you Don for the fast framing. Very good price, and fast service.
Books are amazing, especially USSR themes, post soviet /pre soviet. Interesting antique. Very interesting location. See you soon.

review_1_text: Like most other people have mentioned, the older gentleman who works here is truly....delightful. He stopped me at the door for not wearing a mask (even though he was handing me a box of masks to use) while I was *barely* over the threshold, and asked "what I wanted." When I said I was hoping to look around he basically said I couldn't read the sign on the door (among the other 15+ crudely hand written, faded signs) so obviously I can't read. I left after that. You sell used books, man. Chill out üòÇ
review_2_text: I had a terrible experience here today with the man at the counter. I was made to feel like I shouldn‚Äôt be able to look around and browse because certain things weren‚Äôt priced. I went up to the cash with my items and was ridiculed for picking up certain finds? The clerk was also very rude when I asked for a receipt‚Ä¶ he said ‚Äúdo you really need it?!?‚Äù‚Ä¶ like huh? I found some things I wanted but I won‚Äôt be shopping here again. Learn some customer service basics guys.
review_3_text: The selection of books is plentiful but a lot of really not interesting books. They want you still wear a mask in November of 2024...... The older guy who works in there completely anti social and does not provide good service. The younger gentlemen was helpful. I gave 2 stars because the young man was helpful they lost one for selection of actual quality books, the other was lost from the mask wearing still and the last lost star came from grumpy old man from never ending story running the place.
review_4_text: The man was rude and didn‚Äôt seem to want to let us look around. Just asked what we want. There are too many local book stores who deserve the business. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone.
review_5_text: I had a pleasant experience, this shop is a treasure trove. I honestly don‚Äôt get what people are complaining about in many of the recent reviews. Go for the books! I could spend all day here.

description: Outsider Enterprises is a unique shop offering comics, vintage toys, magic supplies and more!
working_hours: {Monday: Open 24 hours, Tuesday: Open 24 hours, Wednesday: Open 24 hours, Thursday: Open 24 hours, Friday: Open 24 hours, Saturday: Open 24 hours, Sunday: Open 24 hours}
review_1_text: If I could I would rate this bookseller a zero. Thomas from Outsider Enterprises is an extremely money-grubbing individual. Definitely exhausted all resources before considering them as a bookseller. Save your money or at least find a reputable bookseller.
review_2_text: Order came quickly and book was in pristine condition. I was very impressed with the care taken to wrap the book and protect it during shipping - the bookseller went above and beyond! Great experience overall!

name: Theatre of the Mind Books
review_1_text: Like everyone has said, you have to go next-door to the pawnshop to ask them to open up the bookstore for you, however, the owners are very kind and gracious. The bookstore is huge!  I only dinged the review one star because it wasn‚Äôt the most organized.  I did have some sections of organization, but overall it‚Äôs a treasure hunt.  And we did find some treasures!  If you like used books and treasure hunts, you will enjoy The Theatre of the Mind :)
review_2_text: Went there today on a Saturday afternoon and they were Open. A sign on the door has a phone number for the Mission City Pawn Shop next door and to call them if someone wants to browse the books. They are a very large location, ie the size of a theater. A lot of times they have multiples of each title so maybe an overstock buyer.
review_3_text: Would love this place a whole lot more if the owners didn't treat it as a burden to run. Showed up about 3pm on a Saturday afternoon and a sign on door says go next door to the pawn shop if you want to go in. So ok, next door at pawn shop ask them if they will let us in and there is this big production for them to do that, including making us wait about 10-15 minutes before they do. Once inside though, wow the place is HUGE. But so poorly organized and cared for. Literal cobwebs on the stacks of books which are in no sensible order. Then at 3:40 guy says he's gotta close up and we gotta go. Barely there for 20 minutes. Too bad cause I could have easily found dozens of books. Has so much potential but it's like they don't want to do any business. Weird place.
review_4_text: Very disorganized, no prices on items. I was sent over to the pawn shop next door to have my items priced. I feel they asked too much. To my observation they don't seem too intent on selling anything.
review_5_text: Old movie theatre converted to a bookstore. No organization to collection; novels, cookbooks, magazines all together on same shelf. No catalog, worker there didn't know what books were available and wasn't interested in looking.
